title: Great stay near NYU
text: Great stay at a clean and fresh feeling hotel in great location. I was there caring for my post surgery NYU student and staff was very friendly, kind and accommodating during a stressful time.   Extra thanks to Moises the bellhop who was especially helpful during our stay.

title: Boutique Hotel
text: What a great location which is ideally located to terrific restaurants, bars and shopping venues. The hotel is very clean and  has a boutique vibe in the overall look, furniture and there was even a jazz group that played in the hotel bar. One thing I do want to point out is how willing the staff was to make EVERYTHING perfect during my stay. Top notch in execution and it's very clear the staff loves what they do. Hats off to Roger, who I saw engaged with a person who wasn't…very polite. Roger kept his composure and went above and beyond in accommodating this rude individual. Keep your head when others around you are losing theirs. I can't wait to stay again at this location. Just can't say enough about the visit.

title: A little gem!
text: We will return to the Hyatt Union Square! Well appointed, comfortable and extremely clean rooms. The staff couldn’t be more helpful and accommodating! This was a truly great stay and a great place to start for a wonderful time in New York City!

title: Good but not perfect
text: A nice Hyatt property with good location for lower end of Manhattan.  Shops/restaurants/coffee shops. book stores all in good proximity.  Early check-in was challenging as we were hopeful to get in before we had to leave for Broadway maintinee.  We rushed it and ended up with a lesser room than booked and were still late to the play.  The room next to elevator made it very difficult to sleep at night.  Trash container in bathroom needs to be larger.  Maid service forgot to leave wash clothes one day.  Bell service very good.  Portions in restaurant suffereing from shrinkflation.

title: Location, Well Appointed Rooms, Friendly Staff
text: Steps away from Union Station, The Strand, and a myriad of excellent restaurants in the East Village. This is a typically well-situated, well-appointed, and responsively operated Hyatt Hotel. Reliable. Quality.

title: The staff makes this property
text: I've seen comments here that the rooms are cramped at this property.  This was our fourth stay here and the rooms have always been quite nice for a NYC property.  The staff makes this property a four/five star place, they always go above and beyond.  We'll stay again when in the area.

title: Great location & service
text: Sharing these 2 right away: great location & great service. Rooms did not have enough storage - bathroom, on the other side, was a good use of space. Even though the room was quite small (well, that's NYC), it was well organised I need to add. Still, we were happy with our stay there so if you're looking for something around Union Square - this is a great option to consider.

title: Fabulous Find in New York
text: While I know there are plenty of hotels to choose from, this place was a gem. Very conveniently located, it is a beautiful and cozy hotel with outstanding service, food and fabulous staff. The breakfasts are amazing and the bartender made me an absolutely perfect "slightly" dirty martini!

title: SKIP THIS HOTEL
text:
Terrible experience. We booked a category 6 Suite with 72K points. Check-in time is 3PM. Called day before and talked to receptionist (whoever picked up the phone) and was confirmed that check-in time would be 3PM and that valet parking would be FREE since we booked with points. We’d asked specifically since we would be driving from Philly.

Got to hotel at 2:30PM. Was told by the manager there that the guests staying in our Suite were Globalists and so could stay until 4PM, so the hotel decided to “graciously” put us up in a dinky temporary room. Are you kidding me? Did we NOT pay for the SUITE and was told and confirmed that checkin would be 3PM? They didn’t call me to tell me the suite was ready until 6PM!

On top of that, they decided to charge me for parking, BOTH days, even though their own staff told us it would be free.

Let me tell you about the hotel itself. One elevator didn’t work. A portion of the hallway ceiling was leaking and they put a bin underneath to catch the water. 

Most of the motorized couldn’t be opened with the buttons and had to be manually opened. They gave us ONE set of bathrobe and slippers, for a SUITE.

And the pullout couch bed was atrocious, filthy. So many disgusting stains. No sheets or anything. Had to ask for those too. The service staff just handed me the sheets and was about to take off! I was like, uhhh…can you help me put them on??? 

Are you freaking kidding me? Did I just book Motel 6 or a Category 6 goddamn Hyatt room?

title: Convenient NY Hotel
text: The Hyatt Union Square was convenient for my trip, and the room was extremely comfortable. The staff was polite and friendly, and the housekeepers did a fabulous job and were quick. The fitness center was standard for hotels, and included a water dispenser that had infused water to refill my water jug.

title: Amazing rooms and customer service
text: Loved it! I’m very particular where I stay and this hotel exceeded my expectations! One of the best hotels since my time in Western Europe. Customer service exceptional, restaurant had a great menu, and the room was was PERFECT. Love the style, cute card they hand written for me, and the yummy snacks!

title: Trapped in the elevator for 90 minutes
text: The property in general was fine; my low rating of this property is based on my experience of being trapped in the elevator for 90 minutes while management did little to nothing to get us out.  There were 7 people in the elevator clearly under the 2,000 lb limit, and the elevator doors closed and would not reopen.  Engineering tried to reset the elevator, which only resulted in the fan circulating the air in the car shutting down.  Despite our numerous requests to call they fire department, management waited over an hour to do so.  After, management issued a perfunctory apology for the "inconvenience" and has not responded to our concerns.

title: Surly bar staff
text: Concierge staff was wonderful. Location was perfect. Room was facing the street so street noise was heard in the morning. Bar staff was unsmiling, surly and unwelcoming. Ordered drinks for the table, and they all arrived at different times with the simplest arriving last. We felt as if we were an inconvenience for them. The following evening my bill arrived half way through my unfinished drink. Very disappointing. Other than that the room was clean, concierge staff was stellar and made up for the horrific service in the bar.

title: Excellent Staff, Comfy Rooms
text: I was blown away by the customer service at this hotel. To be welcomed with a glass of prosecco, a tote bag & refillable water bottle (which was SO helpful as a traveler) was great. But to be welcomed by such wonderful staff made the experience one of the best I've had at a hotel in a long time! Everyone was so friendly and seemed like they were really enjoying themselves.

title: Wish we could have spent more time!
text: On Super Bowl Sunday Hyatt Union Square was a good place to stay in NYC.  Not to crowded and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We ate in the on site restaurant. The food was very good and the service was excellent. Fortunately we had a room overlooking 4th Avenue which was clean and comfortable. Looking forward to staying there again. Could be the go to hotel, no matter where your business is in the city.

title: Poor service at reception
text:
Rooms and condition of the hotel were fine.  I have stayed here several times but have never been treated so poorly by the staff and hotel manager.  

I normally never complete survey unless the service is exceptional or very poor.

title: Work Trip
text: The hotel was very nice. I was blown away by their 2 layers of black curtains to keep the room dark for early mornings. I wish there was an icemaker on the floor or minifridge in the room. I also wish there was a small nook with drinks or snack to purchase.

title: Pleasant stay
text: Good location for our wedding / event, very friendly and helpful staff.  Breakfast at hotels I tend to avoid with better options in the area, but was pleasantly surprised by the quality and reasonable price for NYC.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Room was clean and bed was comfortable with crisp white bed linens. Large window provided good light and a feeling of openness. Bathroom shower large and provided plenty of hot water. Only drawback was small light over the sink which made it difficult to see well enough to apply makeup.

title: No Valet Parking
text: To use their so called Valet parking, you need to parallel park your car on the street and then give them the keys. Before leaving you need to give them 1 hour to bring your car back from the neighboring car garage. Save yourself $30 and go park at the garage next door. Besides that the hotel is nice with a great bar and great food. Check in process wasn’t great but the rest of the staff were amazing! Our corner suite was small even by city standards however.

title: Great location
text: We stayed here to be close to NYU dorms when moving in our daughter.  Rooms were clean and staff is sweet.  Breakfast is excellent. Rooms are small with bathroom open to the room.  City view room faced a fire house so not great for light sleepers. Great location close to East Village and Union Square.

title: Great service
text: The folks working there were all superb. They seemed to genuinely enjoy being of help and making sure things were going well.  It makes coming and going very pleasant! I highly recommend staying here on that basis alone. The location of course is also great.

title: great place to stay
text: great location, great staff.  would have liked a small fridge in room however it did not detract from the quallity of the room.  Location was excellent.  close access to everthing we wanted to see.  Walking distance perfect. Would definitely stay again.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Staff was overly helpful nice and welcoming, from front desk to doorman, smiling, willing to make our stay amazing. Hotel room were very clean, modern. Everyone made us very comfortable and welcome, even my teenager adored her stay. Location was perfect. Christmas decoration was very cute.

title: Nice property and cool location
text: Nice property in a good location right off of Union Square.  Easy access to the subway. There's a good  Variety of restaurants and price points in walking distance.  Room was cool and in very good condition.  Bed was comfortable.

title: great location and room
text: Great room and location overall, love being in Union Sq. Staff provided an excellent check in complete with champagne. The room was great, nice high floor views, didn't get to experience any of the food services. Made our NYE trip excellent!

title: Big Thumbs Up
text: Great Hotel.  Great Location.  Great Staff.  Very impressed with cleanliness and quality of staff.  Will stay again without question.  Proximity to Union Square and so many food options a big plus.  Also easy access to transportation too.

title: “Your Small Town Blues”
text: After not visiting New York for 3 years, I decided to pay it a visit and I stayed in this hotel and my stay was rather phenomenal. As soon as I approached the hotel, I got the New York holiday feel the I was looking for. The lobby atmosphere was warm and welcoming and the holiday decor was elegantly festive. The front desk staff were beyond hospitable and welcoming, especially the front desk manager, who ensured that was stay was great from arrival to departure. The check-in/out procedure was seamless. The room design was very well-thought for the city vibe and it was very clean and quite, considering the busy area. In terms of parking, they do offer parking, but I chose to park on the street right across from the hotel and paid the meter. This is the kind of hotel that offers you the “small town blues” feeling that Frank Sinatra talks about in his song New York, New York. Highly recommended on my end

title: Hyatt Time Square
text: Location of the hotel is perfect. You havw a lot of options around you. However, rooms are a bit small. You will not have the best views. Also, the hotel needs better housekeeping overall. Other than that, location wise is perfect

title: Hotel in decline?
text:
Hotel options around NYU are limited, and for the past many years we have stayed at the Hyatt Union Square.  Unfortunately, each visit the hotel seems to get worse.  The front desk personnel does their best to be helpful, but this time:  the room was not available until well after 3, there were no face cloths available for the 4 nights of our stay, the morning lobby coffee seemed to always be empty and the creamer was missing and the coffee pods in our room were not refilled until we called to ask, and finally one night there was no hot water.  
When the W Union Square finishes its remodel I’ll start staying there.

title: If you want to hear the elevator all night…
text: Our room was tiny but clean and on the 10th floor. If you pay close to $1,200 for one night (as we did) you would think you wouldn’t hear the elevator, metallically clanking up, up, up and down, down, down all night and early morning long. It sounded like the NYC Subway was directly below us. It was truly impossible to sleep. That’s my huge and main criticism of the place, though the breakfast was completely mediocre (old, dried-out corn muffin and two of us wanted coffee and only one of us was given some). The bed was perfectly comfortable, in the plus side; and it’s a handy East Village location. But, wow, it cost a lot of money to lie awake all night, listening to that elevator!

title: PESIMA ESTADIA
text:
El hotel se encuentra en pesimas condiciones, sucio, los muebles raidos, la ducha llena de hongos, el desayuno incomible, no saben ni siquiera hacer una omelette. !!!
El valor del hotel es un robo $ 1300 dolares por noche , tiene 4 estrellas pero no merece ni una.
El personal muy amable pero no pueden resolver estos problemas.

title: Good room at a reasonable price within walking distance of everything south of Times Square
text: Good room at a reasonable price within walking distance of everything south of Times Square. This location offered umbrellas and electric bicycles. Mini-fridge is not provided automatically, but is available upon request. The valet service is provided by a third party and was the only thing that wasn’t perfect.

title: Staying at the Union Square Hyatt
text: We visited NYU, it is close to the campus. It is a nice neighborhood to walk in, close to subway also. The restaurants near by were very good, especially the Bowery attached to the hotel. Across the Street, “Dig” restaurant is great for alternative, gluten free, non dairy items, for special diet people like myself. The room was comfortable and we liked the security feature -needing the room key to use the elevator and lobby door in the late evening.

title: Hyatt Union Square
text: Nice hotel, great location, very friendly staff. Rooms need some improvement, and there needs to be someone at the entrance. The floors need to have an ice maker so guests can self serve. The gym is excellent!

title: Great Place, Great Staff
text: We stayed to visit our daughter who goes to school in NYC.  Loved it and will be back.  Bellman, front desk and staff were exceedingly pleasant and helpful.  The lobby bar is great too.  Hand crafted cocktails are excellent!

title: 4.30 Check in ....unacceptable!
text: Sadly after a full day tripping out in NYC we were looking forward to check in at 3, relax and prepare for a 6pm dinner reservation. Arrived a 4pm. The room became available at 4:30. Can't imagine a more influential wrong doing than that. My evening soon after, was psychologically affected1

title: great location, staff
text: Stayed for a week visiting my daughter; great location near shopping and subway. Cannot go wrong here!! Restaurant was great; even someone is always there to hold the door for you!! made me feel like a king! Strand Bookstore is right around the corner; nice move!!

title: Great location, nice room, really nice staff.
text: This was a very nice location to explore NYC from.  All of the train lines run through the subway station just a block up, Union Square market is lovely, and there are great breakfast places nearby. The staff was very friendly and they give you a refillable aluminum (not plastic) water bottle with nice water in the fitness center to refill with.  Also the fitness center was impressive compared to most hotel fitness centers.

title: Clean and Quiet, but laden with design flaws!
text: There were many design flaws in my hotel room. 1. The shallow-ness of the bathroom sink. It was impossible to watch my hands, without splashing water on my clothing. 2. The shower curtain was a chain link mesh, with two clear shower liners. The problem is, the liners were not wide enough to span the shower itself. If I pulled the liners to the middle, there was a gap at either end. If I pulled them to cover the ends, there was an inexplicable gap in the middle. 3. There was no towel near the shower, where I can hang a towel! The bench in the shower is not useful, as water is going to be splashed on that bench. 4. The bed sheets were too small for the thickness of the mattress, and could not be tucked in properly. 5. The bed frame was a smooth wooden platform. This meant that the mattress itself shifted every time I got in, out, or rolled over. I ended up using other room furniture to try and block the mattress in. These are all design flaws that I would not have expected at the Hyatt.

title: Terrible! Do not stay!
text:
Terrible! Do not stay! I should have left when I was waiting in line to check in for 15 minutes. While waiting two people came down and stated they were put into rooms that were never cleaned from the previous guest. 

My bathroom was gross. The room is dark and no regriderator was in my room.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Amazing hotel. Incredible staff. Clean rooms. Very comfortable beds. Great restaurant. Great location. Very easy to valet park. Walkable to shopping and restaurants Dog friendly.  I highly recommend staying here.

title: Wonderful staff and accommodations
text: What a wonderful experience from the moment I pulled up in my car the bellman Jonathan catered to me  it was raining and he gave me his umbrella and then walked all my luggage inside for me while I was inside waiting dry were I was then greeting and seamlessly checked in by a supervisor Roger. the room was wonderful the room service  was delicious and I look forward to my next stay at this wonderful establishment

title: Recommendation
text: This is a great location to get around in NYC.  These room were a much better size compared to other hotels I had stayed at in the general area. I appreciated the complimentary coffee in the morning and the evening sparkling wine after spending the day out in NYC>

title: Convenient, fairly priced
text: This was our second time staying at this Hyatt. We like the location, close to NYU, subways, good vegetarian restaurants, Washington Square etc. Our room had wood floors (cleaner than carpet), good light and plug in options and a good desk for working. We also had a pleasant patio, but alas the weather was not suitable for much use of it. The staff are friendly and helpful and the restaurant was reasonably priced. There is a also a reasonable exercise room in the basement

title: Great Hotel excellent location
text: Staff was very attentive and accommodating. Rooms were nicely setup to fulfill all your needs. Great location. Fun bar. Would definitely stay there again. Also has a great gym. Has all the amenities you need

title: Nice area
text: Easy to get anywhere via metro. Taxis cheaper than Uber at present, as well. Union square park very pretty. Felt very safe while visiting. Many gluten free menus (Senza Gluten = GREAT GF Italian Restaurant)

title: Perfect location near NYU
text: We visited our granddaughter. Arriving was easy and quick. They were able to accommodate an early arrival. Every request was quickly fulfilled and the staff was friendly. For an urban location, it was quiet on the 8th floor. The bed was incredibly comfortable.

title: Elevator debacle and ceiling leak
text: The majority of out of town guests and wedding party stayed at The Hyatt Union Square.  The lobby was packed with people waiting for their rooms to be ready.  Then at some point the elevators were not working but nobody informed the hotel guests, even a simple sign on the elevator door would have sufficed.  There are only 12 floors so that could have been an easy solution.  Well, my daughter got stuck in the elevator for an hour.  I was in panic mode.  It's pouring rain, the weekend is her wedding and she is alone in the elevator.  Finally , a elevator technician arrived and pried the door open.  Then to top it off the ceiling on thr 11th floor was leaking into buckets.  Small rooms, overpriced but good location.

title: 5 stars, 5 paws
text:
Who actually enjoys their hotel stay while recovering from surgery? Me and my family did! Not only did they take such could care of me, my pup Snacks was treated pawfectly! I was so impressed with their attention to Snacks! & the snack bar 😀
Thank you Marina, Tatyana, Charles, & Roger!
I plan to stay here again after my last surgery, will definitely recommend to friends. As someone who used to work in hospitality you all knocked it out of the park. 5 awesome stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Mid Hyatt that’s lost its way
text:
I’ve been staying at this Hyatt for ~10 years and appreciated it for what it used to be. A dependable option for a small, clean room, consistent service, and lower cost than other NY Hyatts. It was the very definition of mid - and that was fine! It embraced it and provided a solid product in line with its lower price and competitors. 

Post-pandemic they slapped on a destination fee, added doormen, raised the prices, and project bougie energy without investing in the hard or soft product to match. The hotel is showing its age (rooms leaking on this trip, banged up interiors, etc), service is mediocre, and no obvious investment in either since my visits pre-pandemic except for seemingly more staff in the lobby. 

My most recent stay involved some issue on each of my 5 days there - from my room not being ready until 5:30, trash on floor, missing towels, WiFi not working, errant fees on my bill, noisy elevator keeping me up at night. I’m also a Lifetime Globalist, so you should expect an equal or worse experience than mine. 

And yes - the destination fee is a massive scam here. The perks are egregiously bad, to the point that the included “Premium” WiFi only allows two concurrent connections per room. All for $30/day. 

This Hyatt needs to do some soul searching and embrace its mid-tier status. Invest in fixing your hard and soft products, scrap the destination fee, and go back to being a solid, affordable option for a clean, NY-sized hotel room. 

Until then, I’d recommend another hotel unless you can find a room here for < 330/nt (destination fee included 😉)

title: Such Friendly Staff
text:
When the hotel staff if warm and friendly it can make all of the difference, especially in a city so busy and big. One staff member who really stuck out to me was the Bellman Jonathan! 

Such a pleasure seeing him and being greeted by one of his jokes as I enter the hotel. Also the check-in experience was smooth and the room was ready when we arrived early,which is always a big bonus.

title: Very comfortable and convenient stay
text:
I am a disabled person with limited mobility, that drove from Massachusetts to NYC.   I stayed in Stamford the night prior in a hotel.  It’s too long of a drive for one day. 
I had to check in 2 hours prior to normal.   At first my room wasn’t ready. I showed him my back, and neck, as I wear electrical nerve stimulators on my entire spine. 
I asked for any room with floor space to lay on.  And, I received a room immediately.  They saved my trip, as my body crashed.  Big time. I needed the 2 plus hour crash, to enjoy my concert.  And I did. 
All, thanks to the Hyatt, Union Square and their Staff.

title: Amazing decor and staff
text:
During my recent visit to the Hyatt Union Square, I had the pleasure of experiencing the exceptional service provided by Jonathan, the friendly bellhop. While I waited for my friends, who were guests at the hotel, over at the bar, Jonathan was incredibly helpful with directions and local tips. His warm and welcoming attitude truly made my wait enjoyable.

Moreover, I couldn't help but notice the exquisite decor throughout the hotel. The attention to detail in the design added a touch of elegance to the entire experience. Knowing my friends were staying here and experiencing this level of service and lovely decor, I wholeheartedly give the Hyatt Union Square a solid 5-star rating. It's a place that truly values its guests and creates a wonderful atmosphere.

title: Good hotel, but expensive
text: The room was decent, however the size was tiny. For the price I paid, I expected it to be much better. Check in was easy, and the staff were pleasant. However the price of the room, didnt match the actual room. Unlikely to stay again because for that price I can find much better.

title: Nothing went well
text: I have a explorist level membership at Hyatt. Despite this i had not a pleasant stay at Hyatt union square. The hotel check in standard time is 3pm and despite requesting for an easily check in , i was given a room only at 4pm. I had booked a junior suite which was suppose to be room with a view. The room 311 had no view at all. Finally the hotel do not accept cash at all, a fact which should have been disclosed at the time of booking and came as a rude shock and a last minute rearranging the mode of payment. Net net very unpleasant experience.

title: Perfect stop
text: Great location, fabulous service, rooms very well appointed and clean. This was a last minute, quick flip trip. We had never stayed at this hotel, but the location was perfect for where we were going. So glad we chose the Hyatt USNY.

title: Great location
text: Great location.  Close to Subway.  Easy connections to various tourist sites.  Lots of good places to eat nearby.  Strand bookstore around the corner is worth a visit.  JFK Airport is a little inconvenient to get to.

title: Average hotel, good location, overpriced
text: Nothing special, good location. Late check in due to cleaning of room takig longer than usual. If this were branded differently, it would cost half the price. I wouldn't stay again unless there are no nearby options.

title: Don’t go ACs don’t work; noisy hotel
text: Air conditioner not working in nites, the room was a sauna for 2 days, 79 degrees. There was no effort to help fix it, the front desk just smiled when we were like the a/c doesn’t work. There was working going on 11th floor, heard drilling noise, 4am, vacuuming.

title: Good place to stay near Union Square.  Not a bargain but OK for NY.
text: A hotel located 2 blocks from Union Square.  The rooms were good size by NY standards but would be considered small elsewhere.  We got a room with a balcony which made the space seem much larger.  NY prices so don't expect a bargain but the hotel is conveniently located near subway stops near Union Square and NYU.  The restaurant was good but had limited fare and, of course, was expensive for what you get.  Overall good for staying in Manhattan.

title: Below average experience for a Hyatt.
text: Hotel Location is excellent.   Hotel building is old,  has been remodeled, A/C system did not work well.  Maintenance did resolve the issue after some time.   Late at night.  Elevator needs some maintenance.  Overall experience was just Ok.

title: Probably poorest room at a major Hyatt hotel
text:
Probably poorest room at a main stream Hyatt we’ve ever stayed at.
- Tiny room even by NY standards
- No  separate bathroom just separate toilet. 
- Check-in person had to be corrected on Globalist benefits.
- No kettle or mini bar fridge in room
- on arrival every drawer in the room open and toilet seat up
- Not a great start.  
However, excellent service from that moment at the restaurant and front desk which redeemed the tiny room.  Restaurant service was excellent every day.

title: Business trip to NYC
text:
1. Service was terrible.My AC didn’t work the 2nd day. I asked the front desk and they just said some BS to explain this is normal in NYC due to temperatures changes. I came back at night and the AC was still not working. My room was suffocating even I opened the windows. I went down to ask again and The front desk said similar thing again. I insisted they sent a technician to check on my AC which they finally did. The technician confirmed my AC was not working and he reset it to fix it. I’m super unhappy that the front desk was not trying to help but just saying some BS to buff people off. 

2. Check in process was terrible. I arrived early at 8am and asking if there’s any possibility for early check in. The front desk told me no because their cleaners only started working at 10am. I ended up hanging around in the tiny lobby and on the street for 8 hours before I could check in at 3pm. I’m an Explorist hyatt member and I felt that they should at least offer to call me back if there’s any room that’s ready before 3pm. I did notice many people checked out in the morning before 11am and I don’t understand why they can be a bit more flexible.

title: Hidden Gem
text: A nice Hyatt tucked away just below Union Square.  Rooms are small but pretty efficiently designed. Staff was generally attentive, but some confusion on what was included with my stay since I paid with points. The Bowery restaurant was reasonably priced with well executed food and attentive staff.

title: Never again
text: Check in was horrible. We had to wait for a room to be ready. The hotel is showing age and lack of upkeep. The bathroom has mold on very stained tiles. The toilet doesnt work. The doors constantly getting stucked. The counters are dusty. The front desk people are rude. Only thing positive is the doorman

title: Soggiorno super ed indimenticabile
text:
Nel cuore di Union Square e Financial District
Comodissimo a tutto ciò che serve per visitare San Francisco, a 400 metri dalla fermata bart e munì e Cabs
Camera grande e confortevole completa di cassaforte
Possibilità di colazione come in caffetteria a prezzo comparabili ad altri locali con lo sconto cliente
Soggiornato in camera al 30 piano, con vista su Financial District .. impagabile…

title: Excellent location, on-point staff
text:
We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Union Square NYC. 
The place is impeccably maintained, the staff was always ready to meet our needs, the Bowery Road food was excellent. All around A+
Our rooms were spacious, the clever closets on each side of the beds were very useful. The beds were very comfortable and we slept peacefully in the city that never sleeps. 
The young staff was eager and well trained. The text-for-service was handy and easy- not to mention very responsive. The hotel staff worked as a team, even the turn-down of the rooms was completed seamlessly-  and we felt cared for- which is probably the best achievement a hotel staff can get these days- well done 👍

title: Terrible Customer Service. Wifi was broken
text: I couldn't check in to my room until 4:30 and they initially gave me a Queen room even though I purchased a King room!  I didn't even get a free breakfast or an apology.  I got a lot of attitude back when I was upset that I couldn't check in to my room at the check in time of 3 pm.   I asked for credit or a free breakfast voucher and they gave me a $25 coupon which would not have covered even one person's meal and there were three of us.   I thought the least they could've done was to say sorry or give us all a free breakfast.

title: Great Location
text:
Small room typical of an NYC hotel, but clean, comfortable and very friendly and helpful staff.

Great Location right in the Union Square Park vicinity. Will definitely stay there again next time I need to be in the Union Square area.

title: Perfect hotel for exploring NYC
text: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. Check in was easy, our room was spacious, clean and very quiet. The welcome wine when we checked in on a Thursday was a nice touch. The Nespresso in the room was also quite nice. What really made this hotel extra special were the 2 gentleman at the front door that welcomed us every time we left or came back. Huge shout out to Donnie and Sialka who really made our stay extra special. Thank you for making us feel safe and secure.

title: Top of the Line Service
text: Accommodating, caring, helpful staff. Great food. All around a great experience. Love the reusable tote and water bottles upon check in. The location is perfect. Great for staycations or visitors. And they have doggie treats.

title: Not as good anymore
text: Checked in early, early check in fees were excessive. They gave us a room in the second floor facing the broiler/roof with bird poop everywhere. Room was musty/moldy. Requested a room change, had to wait forever! By then we could have been a regular check in and avoided $150 early check in fees.  The bathroom has aged. Shower had mold, shampoo container broken. Why was the coffee maker on the bedside? Prepandemic we used to stay here for weeks and loved it. Now the actual hotel and staff are not good anymore for a Hyatt standard. Only plus is the location.

title: late check in / connecting door between rooms
text: The check in is at 15:00. it is quite late after arriving at 7:00 am at JFK.They make you wait around a lot. Rooms have doors connecting rooms, which are no good for noisy neighbors. Over all stay was ok, but for the price you will be paying I would expect more.

title: Long Weekend in New York
text: I arranged a long weekend to visit New York as a birthday treat for my wife. The location of the hotel was really good and thew subway was only a few minutes walk away which we used almost every day. Union Square is a lively and interesting area and the different markets were really good. Local shops for groceries and essentials were good and various places to eat and drink were all only a few minutes walk from the hotel . The hotel had a spacious and sometimes bustling bar and the restaurant offers a good menu Although our room was a bit small it was clean and comfortable but lacked a mini fridge where we wanted to keep cold drinks and same fruit. The room had a coffee maker but when we requested a kettle so we could make tea the hotel kindly obliged and provided one. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful on our arrival and throughout our stay. All in all a good location and with the subway close by it was very easy to get around New York.

title: Esta muy bien, pero les falta un poquito mas
text: Muy, muy amables, falta resolucion, respuesta. precios altos, Habitaciones chicas, les falta lugar de guardado. Muy linda decoracion, maravilloso gimnasio. Si mantienen esos precios agranden las habitaciones. Sino, bajen los precios (que es lo mas facil)

title: Lo recomiendo
text:
Es muy cómodo y buena atención 
Lo más importante su ubicación, detalles que faltaron que en la habitación no había algún mini refrigerador y no incluye en el valor servicio de desayuno 
Lo importante es que tiene dos restaurantes dentro del hotel

title: Location and not much else
text:
The challenge with Hyatts in Manhattan is that you're either choosing between value-priced options with tiny rooms and minimal service on the seedy and sweaty long blocks of Midtown or the couple of higher-end properties where rates rarely fall below $600/night. The Union Square property, well-rated and located, has always been sort of a wild card. Though not technically on Union Square, it's got a location with far more charm (and great subway access to Manhattan and Brooklyn) and the rates split the difference between the 3 and 4+-star Hyatts. 

Pros: Location. The area around the hotel is one of Manhattan's nicer ones, with a good mix of tourists and locals. Great restaurant options are nearby. Union Square is lively and its greenmarket is a great place to hang out. While some parts of Manhattan are emptied out by WFH, Union Square is busy and feels safe at all but the wee-est hours.

Cons: Rooms are small, no bigger than the Hyatts in Midtown. (As a Hyatt Exporist I usually get some sort of upgrade in size or view, but was told it was impossible due to high occupancy.) King rooms have bathrooms that are split, with the sink exposed in the room. The only fully enclosed space was the toilet. The shower is entered and exited from an open area. The hotel charges a big premium for rooms with two beds, and this is apparently why. A number of things weren't working in our room, such as the phone, and though I reported it, there was no obvious action taken until the day I checked out. A request for morning housekeeping service was received as something beyond the hotel's control. Front desk staff was thin. There were often long waits to speak to a host and though a couple were amiable, others were indifferent and blasé. 

Post-pandemic, there has been a huge trade-down in the caliber of customer facing hotel workers in cities like NYC. They are uniformly under 30, with limited training, and many don't really have the personality for the work, nor can they relate to the needs and experience of travelers. So it is now commonplace not to be thanked at checkout or to receive anything close to a sincere welcome at arrival. Hyatt Union Square is typical of this trend. 

As best as I can see, this property's rate premium is entirely due to its location, not its facilities or service. I would not avoid it in the future, but neither would I be eager to return.

title: Not Worth It
text: I'm a Hyatt Explorist (used to be a Globalist). Avoid this property. Not worth the price. Rooms are cramped. Plumbing issues. Staff not as polite as at other properties I've been to. "Courtyard view" leaves a lot to be desired.

title: small boutique style hotel in good area
text: Hyatt Union Square is in a good location , small boutique kind of style hotel, rooms are a little small but most are in NYC hotels. The hotels restaurant and bar is finally opened to full service after the covid period.  The Union square area seemed to be cleaner and more traffic as more more stores and restaurants have re-opened. perfect spot for traveling anywhere in NYC

title: a weekend stay
text: The ugly alley view certainly did not match a photo view of a bright short-walled patio. However facility  was sufficient  for a visitor busy elsewhere and not planning to sit inside. Shower and vanity could use updating . Desk staff courteous and helpful. Two quiet and efficient elevators a plus.

title: Good location but sub par rooms
text: Very noisy air conditioning that was so loud that it did not let me sleep! No drinking water facilities in the reception which is quite disappointing. Overall experience was not great and would not recommend

title: Very comfortable 3 day business trip
text: Love staying at this property.  Wonderful location, central to everything with great destinations in walking distance. The manager is exceptionally thoughtful and her staff is very pleasant and helpful.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  Appreciate the small touches and consistently good food in the restaurant.

title: Great location, clean comforttable and quiet rooms
text: Great location for wanting to be downtown and convenient to Brooklyn. Nice staff. Nice rooms. My room was very comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was a bit pricey but that tends to be standard. The bar had jazz at night which was a nice addition.

title: Great Service and Hotel
text: The staff makes this place. Great service and team all around! Tatiana at the front desk was incredibly accommodating. Everything from the bar to the food was great. I was upgraded to a terrace suite and it was incredible (for NYC...which can have tight hotel rooms).

title: Not a Typical Hyatt Property
text:
This property was originally built as a Holiday Inn so definitely not up to Hyatt standards.
Teensy rooms, few amenities in rooms, spotty internet and TV service. 
Felt it was settling for an inferior product. Aside from the physical aspects, the saving grace was the staff, who were professional, competent and accommodating.

title: Good Evening
text: The Hyatt is an amazing hotel. Which is very accommodating and has excellent staff members. Excellent service. I will recommend the Hyatt to my friends and family. I will stay at the Hyatt soon. Thank You so much.

title: Excellent stay!
text: What a wonderful experience at this property! The staff is absolutely incredible - so friendly and helpful! And they interacted with one another so well, too! Not sure if the management is aware of their top tier team but I hope they do! Special shoutout to Donnie, the bellman, who was at that door and greeted us so kindly each time! Our room was lovely and serviced daily and had all the essentials. We will look forward to staying again in the future!

title: Hotel in poor condition
text:
The door, floor windows are not well maintained and everything feels, definitely is not what you see in the picture. 
This hotels has saw it’s better days and union square is not what is used to be. I will not recommend if you travel with the family

The positive aspect is that staff was attentive and great overall

title: Disappointing experience
text: First night no AC, no internet, no working room phones. Remainder of stay, intermittent and lesser quality internet service. Room with courtyard view does not match at all the room pic on hotel website. Shower walls with water marks, looked dirty. Dark rooms, dark ambience everywhere. Hotel need an uplift. Staff was alright, resturant food was ok as well. Wouldn’t stay there unless improvements are done to entire hotel.

title: Hyatt in Union Square
text: Upon arriving the staff immediately acknowledged me and also identified me as a Hyatt member. I was offered a glass of wine while my room was in it's final inspection for cleanliness and completion. The staff was very kind and courteous at all times during my stay of 3 days. The room was extremely clean and came with robes and slippers which was especially nice to clean up and feel comfortable after coming from a very long plane flight from Europe. Their bar is amazing with an encyclopedia of liquor displayed on the wall. Their restaurant, The Bowery, has exceptional food and services. It also will deliver to your hotel room as well. All in all, an excellent hotel to stay at. It is centrally located near Union Square park and many other shops and restaurants to choose from while staying at the hotel. You will not be disappointed.

title: Great value and location!
text: I always stay at this hotel while in NYC.  Close to Union Square and lots of amenities.  The Bowery Road restaurant has a great atmosphere and the food is always good.  I feel that the rates are very competitive and staff is always helpful.

title: Nice hotel in a busy area
text:
Nice hotel in a busy area. Better experience than anticipated.
Nice pillows and bedding for a nice and quiet night. We appreciated the good quality of the bedding: Nice pillows, good duvet, nice sheets, very good bathrobes and slippers. 
The turn down service was an additional plus, much appreciated.
Negatives: Shower head could not be adjusted, spreading water all over. Bar soap too small which kept falling from your hands.
Amenities: Shampoo, conditioner and liquid soap in shower  OK, but in containers fixed to the wall, not easy to use.
Hand cream felt cheap and of low quality.
Overall: Nice hotel, a bit expensive.

title: Great Hotel with a Great Location
text: Check in with a very nice staff member was very quick and easy. We were able to get in our room early which was a bonus. The room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. The front desk was very helpful with our inquiries throughout our stay. The bellhop quickly secured a taxi to return to the airport. There are many shops and restaurants within walking distance of the Hyatt. Union Square subway station has connections to everywhere. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Quiet, comfortable room
text: Overall very pleased with the hotel. The bed was quite comfortable and the room very quiet for being on the 4th floor with a street view. The black out curtains were appreciated. While the room was small, it was adequate sizewise

title: Great hotel near Union Square
text: Welcoming staff, cool vibe and great location. Nice, modern rooms. It feels like a boutique hotel and is within walking distance of many popular attractions. Ethan was very helpful getting us checked out and on our way. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Great location but beware of extra charges
text:
Pros:
Very convenient location, close to the metro lines
Comfortable room, decent size (for New York standard)
Nespresso machine in the room
Good service

Cons:
When we checked in, they double-billed me. We caught the additional charges and they reverted. They also billed me for some patch at the mini bar that has been missing when I checked in. Make sure you check that all the mini bar items are there when you checked in and let them know if anything is missing. 
Note also that there is a destination fee per night.

title: Hyatt Union Square is a little gem in the village
text: I loved staying in this boutique version of a Hyatt. Although the rooms are small, it is central to shopping, eating and wandering the Manhattan streets. The hotel was immaculately clean with fun and novel snack bar items and welcome amenities. The restaurant is tasty and inviting. And don't forget their sparkling wine happy hour. Hyatt has been around a long time and it shows with their services and amenities. I think I'll be coming back again and again.

title: Recommended
text: I had no issues with my stay.  Room was small as with any NY hotel that i've stayed and very clean. Staff was friendly.  Checkin was quick and easy. Champagne upon check in was a nice touch. Coffee was provided in the morning which is normal these days.

title: Convenient Union Square Location
text:
Very convenient location and the room, while small, was fine and comfortable.  

Room 604: faces the back, which was fine bc it was dark when I wanted to sleep and relatively quiet;  I heard every single word from the room next door and it sounded like cattle leaving when they opened and closed the door; odd built in furniture the was completely taken up by poor selection of mini-bar items - I had to move the snacks and coffee maker just to have nightstand space; tiny closet; strange waste of space to have second barn door by toilet when there was already a door on the bathroom; shower dripped, toilet tank ran - had to take lid off multiple times to adjust to make it stop filling, closet light had a short and blinked non stop, all the light switches had bright blue identifying lights on them that illuminated the room all night - was thankful for my mask, doors need weatherstripping to keep hallway light out at night - I used towels, bath towels had holes- looked like what I use to dry my car.

HOTEL: pretty lobby, nice bar & restaurant (didn’t eat or drink there this trip, but I’ve dined and had drinks there previously).  That said: no one at the door or front desk when I arrived- I had to find someone after 5 minutes; doorman was oblivious to anyone around him, I literally had to say ‘excuse me’ to get by him as he was on his phone; the music from the lounge SO loud at 5PM that I had to ask the front desk man to repeat everything he said multiple times; 

For my needs, this location was perfect but TBH, for the same money I could have stayed at the Soho Grand or the Roxy at a MUCH nicer property.

title: Convenient location, modern rooms, tiny wardrobe space
text: This is a modern hotel in a convenient location.  The quiet room I had was in an ally. Quiet, no view.  I assume any view overlooking 4th avenue would be a noise one, (I used to live two blocks up-- I would know...)  Service is top notch, and it's a beautiful hotel.  However, there is one teeny tiny stand alone wardrobe that has space for maybe one or two full length hanging items... (I tend to wear long flowy dresses, so this was an issue for me- perhaps not for you.)  If anything, the closet space seemed only appropriate for a business man.  It was weird.  I'd think twice about staying here again-- I hate living out of a suitcase.

title: Almost perfect
text: Honestly, for nearly $500.00 a night, I would expect breakfast.  There were some nice things, just seems like I could have a fridge for leftovers.  Rooms are small, functional, but lack fridge and microwave.

title: Not worth the money
text:
At 700+ dollars a night you get a very average hotel with dirty floors and full housekeeping very 2nd day. No water also provided. On the third day of stay some
Refillable bottles were kept for which you have to go to the basement gym for refills. Not with the money

title: Thoughtful, authentic hospitality
text:
Loved my stay here because of the thoughtfulness of the hospitality. They provide two metal water cantinas and a canvas bag which encourages health and reduces waste. I used these items over and over - and the canvas bag - which I left for another guest to use- made for a great shopping bag at the Whole Foods around the corner. What an ingenious way to reduce the use of plastic bottles by providing metal water containers that can be refilled on site. This insightful generosity s the signature of authenticity setting the tone of their brand immediately. So smart. 

This thoughtfulness carries over into the staff who are efficient and personable across the board. They helped me change reservations and provided for special needs that I had with kindness, prompt attention and professionalism. I’ve been coming to nyc for business for 6 years and their hospitality is a total stand-out. Nobody is cross or vexed in the lobby because the staff has everyone taken care of. 

Now, having said that? The coffee in the lobby in the mornings could use some work! It’s really weak and doesn’t taste great. Fortunately there’s a Starbucks a block away but who want to schlepp for coffee first thing in the morning? 

If you don’t know New York, Union Square Union Square is an ideal location for its beauty, merchant selection, restaurant density and best of all the union square train station where you can catch a train to any part of the city. A stay here is totally worth it! Enjoy!

title: A step above the normal.
text: This was the accommodating hotel I have been to.  The Director of Front Office Shaka Kebe was extremely helpful and the front desk staff went over and beyond to make our stay amazing.  Ethan the bellman always assisted with a smile and was nice.

title: Good option when staying in NYC
text:
We booked a 1 night stay in a "King Courtyard View" and thrilled to get upgraded to a terrace room with Globalist status.  You don't get a real view with this room as it's on a lower floor but the terrace is spacious and comfortable.  It's nice to have outdoor space during warmer months in NYC.

Other reviews have noted the excellent customer service which was felt upon arrival.  Everyone from the front desk and valet were very welcoming.   A sour point is the Globalist breakfast.  Even though this WOH benefit notes that it includes an 18% tip per entrée they will tell you that they are not responsible for tipping.  It is confusing and shame on management at this property for not tipping the staff. 

WORKING ON THE ROAD
- There was one working space with a desk so not ideal for a couple that both need to work during the day from the room.  
- The internet was fast and reliable

title: Great staff at the Hyatt Union Square
text: Reserved a room at the Hyatt Union Square based largely on location but happy to say that the staff there was excellent and most helpful. Tatiana, in particular, helped with something important that improved our four night stay.   Enjoyed a very good breakfast in the on-site restaurant.  The location is excellent for the East Village and even beyond.

title: Special place for a stay vacation
text: Special location close to Union Square Market, Strand, Food Hall and Trader Joe’s. Special place for special occasions! We had to find a place close the Eye Infirmary due to an emergency surgery and picked this hotel due its close proximity. We’ll be back to better enjoy it.

title: Meh, too expensive too small too dirty
text: We spent four nights in this hotel. The room was dark, dirty and small. The staff did the best they could to accommodate whatever we asked, but are limited in their abilities to get things done. Location is great. Water bottles were good. Food service was barely noticeable. shower a slimy floor was dirty bathroom overly cramped no place to hang anything. No place to store luggage. Overall I would not recommend this to most. Anyone at $500 a night including the silly resort fee. There is much better hotels to be had in the area.

title: Avoid this hotel  if you can
text: This is the second worst Hyatt (including all Hyatt brands)  that I have stayed at.  The staff weren't very friendly, you had to work to get your daily waters, and when I asked about the tip being included for the globalist breakfast benefit, someone named Roger at the front desk offered to let the staff in the restaurant know that I did not want to tip them.  The rooms are extremely small, but that is normal for New York.  This is just a bad hotel overall.

title: New York City Visit
text: Excellent location; excellent accommodations. I recommend this Hyatt when in New York City. Clean, quiet room; comfortable sleeping. Pleasant staff. Parking is a perk. I wouldn't stay anywhere else ever.

title: Hyatt Union Square Excellent
text: The people, service, and facilities were all above expectations. Excellent  staff and quality of room and facility were great. The location of hotel was optimal for being close to downtown and the village and subway right down the block. The bar in hotel was really good. The room was quiet, and very clean.

title: Destination Fee Warning
text: There was a garbage $30 fee tacked on to my bill that appears at check out. I asked them explain what is covered. A $10 credit at restaurant (didn't know about), a glass of prosecco (never offered), WIFI (never used). Find a better place that respects you.

title: Trip to NYU
text: Good room , very convenient to NYU where we’re visiting our kid.  Service was great, Donnie in particular was very helpful and friendly when we needed to store our luggage.  All the staff was very helpful and welcomed our feedback.  Would stay here again.

title: Room doors that SLAM SHUT - ALL NIGHT
text: The hotel is in a great location.  The room was clean and the front desk staff very kind.  My biggest issue with this hotel is that your room's front door SLAMS shut. This cannot be controlled due to the hinge mechanism.  This in turn produced ENDLESS doors slamming ALL NIGHT.  You will not get a good night's sleep staying here.

title: Very pleasant staff and great room
text: The front desk staff were all very welcoming and pleasant. Most notable were Lilly and Mykel who were always so helpful. The room was very clean and modern. Housekeeping did a great job of refreshing the room every day. The hotel was also in a great location- accessible to many restaurants and right at a prominent subway stop.

title: Great Customer Care from Mykel
text: Thank you to Myles for the amazing customer care.  He helped us with food and show options and always had a smile when we walked through the door.  You really made us feel at home during our NYU visit!

title: excellent hotel
text:
Hotel très sympathique et cool, chambres confortables et assez spacieuses pour New York
idéalement situé car downtown mais Midtown accessible, le quartier est très sympa et bien desservi
le personnel est très gentil et prévenant, avec notamment un personnel qui accueille et  apporte de l'aide pour bagages, café etc, mention spéciale à Jayson!
le ménage de la chambre est fait tous les jours, et soigné, par contre les produits de toilette et café ne sont pas renouvelés il faut réclamer.
On peut regretter que le restaurant attenant ne soit pas vraiment une ressource pour un café ou un snack  (trop cher), mais il y a pas mal de  cafés dans le coin.

title: Hyatt Union Square
text: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and each and every time the service is exceptional. Specifically Mel and Donnie are very welcoming and helpful. They are very helpful in accommodations and moving around the city.

title: NYU '27 Mom
text: Booked room for Weekend on the Square. Convenient location, only a 10-15 min walk to NYU. Our room was quite small, but we were hardly there, and it was just fine for sleeping. Clean, comfortable bed and surprisingly quiet given the location. Welcoming and courteous staff. We were very pleased and will definitely choose Hyatt Union Square again.

title: Amazing service
text: I was so surprised by how wonderful we were treated. We had to request many items during our stay (toothbrush, extra blankets, box fan, feminine products which were brought along with cookies!) and the staff exceeded our expectations. They were so happy to serve us and overall wonderful human beings. They truly enjoy their jobs and it shows.

title: Family group of 13- Great stay!
text:
Hotel and staff were top notch throughout. 
Rooms were clean and modern. 
Staff were friendly and knowledgeable. 
(Shout out to Jayson at the front entrance for super friendly attitude and personality every day!)
Great restaurant and bar (Bowery Road) inside premises. 
Would definitely come again when in town.

title: Great Hotel
text: The hotel staff is amazing.  Greeted so nicely every time I stepped into the hotel. The staff was very quick with room service.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Surprisingly great!
text: I have Titanium status w/another chain and can’t remember ever receiving such a warm welcome as I did upon arrival. Checked in with Mell, she was fabulous (as was everyone else) will stay there again!

title: Amazing immaculate hotel!
text: This is our second year staying at this hotel. We picked it because of its proximity to where we needed to be and came back because of everything else. The staff is phenomenal and beyond accommodating. Especially Nell and Donnie. They are friendly, accommodating and kind. The restaurant, Brewery Road was great! The rooms are well appointed and clean. The flowers were beautiful at the entrance! We will definitely be back’

title: This hotel has fallen apart; needs a complete overhaul.
text: Bathroom was in disrepair, issues with sink and shower. Sink was chipped. Toilet made noises all night long. There were missing shelves and glass covers for the shelving. The glasses and fridge were disgusting and not clean. Overall, the hotel has completely fallen apart and it's clear no one is paying attention. We've stayed in this hostel probably 10+ times over the last several years, and we won't be back again. Horrible experience.

title: Great spot for business or pleasure
text: Went for work but would be very pleased to stay here on a vacation as well. Convenient location (walked about 25 mins to Penn Station) and moments away from NYU campus. The staff was incredibly welcoming and the service was excellent - a glass of champagne upon check-in, chocolates in the evening, etc. The building also seems very secure. The lobby is small (as in all NY hotels) but the room was actually a very comfortable size with a large shower. The bar in the lobby has a solid happy hour as well. Will be staying here again!

title: Love the staff here
text: This is a lovely hotel with large rooms for NYC.  It’s a great location with lots of fun restaurants in the area. But what really made my visit was the staff. Mel at the front desk is efficient, personable and so welcoming.  This is the second time I’ve stayed at this hotel, and both times she helped me when I arrived. I will choose to stay here over other hotels in the area because of how she made me feel welcome and well taken care of.  The bar staff were also amazing.

title: Came to visit friends
text: I came in to visit with friends and attend a conference. Donnie was the best parts of our trip! He was always there with a smile and a kind word! His enthusiasm made our stay absolutely amazing! It was a great trip!

title: Best staff ever. Ask for Lily!
text: The staff at this hotel were the friendliest and most attentive folks ever. Lily took care of us from the moment we arrived right through checkout. Roger was also very helpful the day before we checked in!

title: Great location, Nice Modern Hotel
text: Very nice modern hotel with friendly staff, very near the subway, many great spots to visit within walking distance. Super close to mammy shops such as a 24 hour drugstore and many coffee-bagel shops. Close to Union Square and Washington Square so this is a very vibrant area. We would definitely stay here again.

title: A go-to hotel in NYC
text: Beautifully designed room (and spacious by NYC standards), super friendly staff, great location. Fitness center had everything I needed and the on-site restaurant was great. This will be my go-to hotel for my business travel!

title: Continues the downward slide into mediocrity
text: With the exception of housekeeping, none of the employees seemed to know how to do their job, nor did they care. The doorman watched a woman struggle through two sets of doors and never thought to assist her.

title: BEWARE travellers if you are coming for a special occasion
text: The hotel gave up a suite that we reserved months in advanced that was meant for a wedding venue without informing us. When the bride broke down and cried at the lobby they did not offer any solution to the problem. We had to plead our case to the guest that was assigned to the suite/room to willingly give up the suite for one night. The level of service at the front office is not acceptable. The elevator also broke down in the first morning and a call to the front desk to resolve the issue was not answered. If you are planning a special occasion at this location, keep in mind that the staff do not care about your needs and never response to your questions or concerns. Be prepared to plead to other guests to get what you want. To this date, we are still waiting for an apology or compensation for the mistakes that were made. To add insult to injury, we are also loyal Hyatt members!

title: Outstanding stay and great location
text: Our check in was swift, the room was outstanding, not big but just great. Would have liked a fridge in the room though. The view was great from the 11th floor and the overall service was up to par with Hyatt properties. We will stay there again.

title: Ok
text: It was ok. Clean enough. Elevator got stuck for several minutes. Somewhat dated. Street noise at night is to be expected, but annoying. There are better and cleaner places to stay in Manhattan for the price you pay for this place.

title: Expected more
text:
Came for a work trip for 6 days. 

There was no internet for 2 days, the shower and faucet would sputter and I had to call to get the hot water working. 

At one point the hotel staff removed the sheets from my bed and left the sheets on the desk, had to call two times for it to be fixed.

title: Amazing Stay
text:
Greta Location Not Far From The Mid City Very Convenient To Trains. Rooms Were Nice Had A Lovely View To Wake Up Too ,  Check In Was Smooth Mel From Front Desk Was Very Bright and Helpful With Every Need or Questions I Had.
10/10 Would Stay Again.

title: Perfect hotel in Union Square
text: We needed a hotel in the Union Square hotel for a family event. We found this gem! The hotel was so clean and the staff was lovely and very accommodating! Would recommend this hotel for visiting the NY. Area, it was a great location!

title: Hyatt Union Square, best place to stay in NY
text:
Great hotel, clean, attentive and super friendly staff.  Hyatt Union Square is my go to hotel when visiting New York.  I come to NY atleast 6-7 times a year and never stay anywhere else.

Special shout out to Lilly and Donnie who always make my stay special and feel at home

title: Great hotel with next-level service & staff
text:
For anyone looking to stay in the Midtown Manhattan area of NYC, this is a perfect place.  The location is VERY conveniently located next to Union Square with plenty of dining, shopping,entertainment, & transit options.  Attached directly to the hotel is Bowery Road restaurant with excellent food & cocktails.  Also attached is the Library of Distilled Spirits bar - amazing & low-key place to grab a drink & unwind with smooth jazz playing in the background.

The hotel room itself was cozy, but with all the amenities you need - even a King size bed (most places offer only Queens due to space restrictions).  The oversized walk-in shower was also quite nice.

But without question, the best quality of this hotel was the AMAZING staff!  From the days prior to my visit when I called with questions, to our arrival greeting, to everytime we passed through the lobby, the Staff was some of the friendliest I'd ever encountered in my travels.  Specifically, Roger, Kavina (Manager) & Lily treated us like family the entire time.  Every time we saw them, they asked how we were, how we are enjoying NYC, if there is anything they could do to enhance our stay, & even greeted us with hugs!  Lily was especially incredible.  She always remembered our names & treated us like she'd known us for years.  I have a very high bar of expectations in the Customer Service/Hospitality industry.  But I am happy to say that Lily raised that bar to new heights.  She has raised the standard of what hospitality means & what I will look for in the future.

I will likely need to visit NYC a few times per year for business.  And everytime I come back, I will be sure to stay at the Hyatt Union Square.  Thank you Lily, Kavina, Roger, & the entire staff for a wonderful experience!

title: Heat not working, no late check out available
text:
Temperature did not change with changing the thermostat in the winter!!! No effort for providing a late check out. The outlet by the sink almost broke my personal dryer, had to change the outlet.  
Location is very good, stuff friendly otherwise but not able to accomodate a late check out. Toiletries were bare minimum.

title: Great location, but noisy and poor service
text:
I stayed at the Hyatt union square for five days, and found it a mixed blessing. 
Location is great, very central and close to subway. 
But; my room was very noisy and difficult to sleep in. It had a street view, and maybe courtyard would have been better, but still too noisy. 
Also: service was slow, and many of the staff seemed distant, uninterested, or even maybe stoned. They appeared not helpful or interested in helping. Housecleaning was poor, room was not done in a good way, no refill of nespresso, and if we asked for something it was not fixed, only after a couple of inquiries. Also: furniture in the room was of poor quality. 

All in all: great location, the rest was not good enough.

title: Perfect for NYU visits
text: My daughter became a student at NYU two years ago, and that's when I discovered this Hyatt.  I love it, and look forward to going back again and again. Special thanks to Mel and Karina at the front desk for making my stay so wonderful!!

title: Do not trust the staff at this hotel
text: I would highly recommend looking at other hotels in the area. Do not stay at this Hyatt. The staff has zero integrity. I had a terrible incident with the housekeeping department and the managerial staff is not helping to recover my property. Do not stay here.

title: Amazing Staff!!
text: The staff at Hyatt Union Square were amazing!  Every single one of them greeted us with a smile, asked if they could assist in any way and wished us a lovely day.  Management should be commended for assembling a great team.  We also appreciated the quiet, clean rooms with the best black out shades as well!

title: Nice hotel, but note that pesky destination fee
text:
This is a lovely hotel.  Taking away a star because of the annoying “destination” fee. 

The staff was wonderful. Friendly, accommodating, and most of them seemed ready to go out of their way to make people feel welcome. 

The lobby is dark and kind of gloomy-not bright as it appears on the website.

The room is small, but possibly not by NY standards. Was clean and modern with operable windows. 

Worth noting, though there’s probably nothing that can be done. Terrible design of the bathroom sink. The faucet isn’t high enough so that when washing your hands, there’s no way to avoid hitting the bottom of the faucet which is just kind of icky. I would move my hands away from the faucet when lathering up, but even so, it was really difficult to avoid hitting the spigot when rinsing. 

The hotel was convenient to my activities, and there’s a Whole Foods just around the corner. Some street noise at night but probably no worse than other busy areas of Manhattan.

title: Tired interior, dirty bedding, hot water issues but friendly hotel staff, nice restaurant and convenient location
text:
As a Globalist I have to say I will not be returning to this location until I read about a top-to-bottom renovation.  Numerous issues from dirty bedding (discovered at 10pm) that resulted in finding ripped and dirty mattress cover, had to help remake our own bed!  Lost hot water 2x during stay.  
Staff was friendly and listened and yes, asked if we wanted to move but after unpacking we didn't opt to move as most got settled over the week stay.

title: Stolen phone in the room
text: My phone got stolen from the room. I requested the hotel's staff for help. The staff was uninterested and showed no intentions of helping. At the end of my stay, they simply asked me to fill my details in ileftmystuff.com "in case the phone shows up". OUTRAGEOUS!

title: "Destination Charges" once again spoil an otherwise nice location
text: This hotel is one of the few in the Union Square area, which is close to relatives we were visiting. The room was very clean and modern, and the mattress and pillows were some of the most comfortable we've ever slept on.  However the bathroom is very badly designed, with no towel racks near the sink, which has no usable vanity area and a faucet that comes down to about 4 inches from the bottom of the shallow basin, hardly enough room to get your hands under. Lastly, that damned Destination Charge of $25, a.k.a. Resort Fee, which is tacked on to the bill but never quoted as part of the room rate. Really, don't the hotels know that EVERYONE is fed up with these hidden charges, and it only hurts our loyalty to their brands when we run into them? They claim we get benefits in return, but very few would consider them likely to be used or worth the extra cost. Just charge us a few $ extra if that's what you have to do to make an honest buck, and we'll pay it without the shell game.

title: great staff!
text: the hyatt at union square is a small gem in a big city! the restaurant in the hotel has many wonderful options for all meals and the rooms are sufficiently comfortable, but the staff is so helpful and hardworking. lily, who works at the front desk, helped us with anything we needed including finding transportation and she always had a smile on her face and a cheery attitude, even after working a double shift. i would definitely stay here again!

title: Hyatt- Union Square, Our New York Home
text: We have chosen to stay at the Hyatt Hotel -Union Square (4-6 times/ year) since 2020 when our daughter began attending college in New York. We had our most recent stay on Jan 21-23, 2023, and as with each time before, we were greeted like family, with a 'Welcome Back" and even a few extra snacks in our room!!!! I have to give special 'thanks' and a shout-out to Lily, who checked us in. She was professional, friendly, personable and so helpful. She made sure every detail of our stay was satisfactory and urged us to contact her if we had any needs.  The hotel was busy, as usual, but she never made me feel rushed and I watched her give the same attention to guests that came before and after me. Given the cost of a hotel stay in New York, I really appreciated that. Lily was even kind enough to entertain my questions about apartment shopping and driving in the city. Thanks Lily!  Besides, being an ideal location for food, shopping & entertainment, it's hotel staff like Lily who keeps us coming back to the Hyatt Hotel - Union Square!!!

title: Hyatt Unión Sq
text: A really good hotel experience all around. The staff is ready to help and generally courteous and friendly. It was easy to get any additional items I needed during my stay and the quality of the room was better than I expected based on other New York hotels I’ve stayed in.

title: Hyatt Union iSquare is First Rate
text: The front desk staff were exceptional in every way.  Very helpful.  Siaka and Earl went out of the way to help me get in the right room and were accommodating when I thought i would need to extend my stay. Well done!  Hyatt Union Sq is always my 1st choice when coming to NYC.

title: Super nice!
text: I stayed overnight, I was in the city to spend time with someone near and dear. From the time I walked in to the time I left, the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and welcoming.

title: Amazing!
text: The team at the Hyatt were extremely nice and wonderful. I loved every minute. The check in was nice and it was in a good location so it made it easy to get around. I was suggested artichoke pizza which was really good. 😋

title: Solid business stay
text:
Stayed one night on business in January 2023.

Fantastic location in Union Square, surrounded by coffee places, restaurants, etc., and mere steps from a major subway stop with access to several lines.

I was in a room that turned a corner with a somewhat unusual shape; the furniture, etc., had been well-designed for the space.  Everything was clean; some of the fixtures felt a little on the cheap side and were showing some wear and tear, but nothing severe.  Bed was very comfortable.

Room was relatively quiet by NYC standards.   Shower had great water pressure.

Service at check-in and check-out was warm and welcoming.  Small, but chic, lobby with a bar that has a great vibe and attracts some locals.

Price was very affordable for such a quality hotel in NYC.  Would definitely return.

title: Smooth and welcoming from start to finish
text: Tatiana at front desk was excellent. Attentive and thorough, providing excellent customer service from check in to check out and everything in between. Beds were comfortable and rooms had all that was needed. Porters were helpful.

title: Great location. Lively lobby and neighboring restaurant.
text: This Hyatt was new to me. Very convenient to Union Square and subway. Front desk staff were really great. The rooms are pretty compact, but nice and clean with black out curtains and they had most of the necessary amenities, including a nespresso machine! No mini bar that I could find. Lol. But that’s probably a good thing. Only negative was noise from rolling bathroom doors in adjoining rooms (?) and people banging around in the hallway too early ☹️

title: Elagance, Value and Great Location
text: Our favorite hotel in NYC.  The staff is well trained and the rooms are elegantly appointed.  Nice bar and cozy lounge area.  Ideal location. Walking distance to many key areas and the subway is close by.

title: Superb hotel, staff, accomodations
text: Luxury; friendly and attentive staff; beautiful hotel; great rooms - usual NYC size - but optimally designed; nice bathrooms; nespresso machines. For NYC, the value you get is outstanding. Very reasonably priced.

title: Genuine and professional staff
text:
Had a great week-long stay, starting from New Year’s Eve weekend with my husband, and staying the rest of the week for work. The hotel front desk staff, especially Lily and Siaka, were very accommodating in helping us get upgraded rooms as a Globalist, taking time to ensure that the rooms were to our satisfaction. Lily was very kind and helpful, and a lot fun every time I saw her! And appreciated Donny’s easy going, friendly convos, on my first and last night. 

The bartender at the Library of Distilled Spirits on New Year’s Eve was very friendly, and we enjoyed his recommendations on tequila. 

The restaurant staff were all nice and professional (went there every morning for breakfast and had dinner at the restaurant bar on a Monday night). 

The rooms were spacious and clean. The 10th floor room facing 13th St. was nice for the city view and the 4th floor corner junior suite facing 13th St., though on the lower floor, was lovely to spread out in for the longer stay. 

All in all, it was a great way to start 2023 in NY with a friendly, genuine and professional team at Hyatt Union Square.

title: Union Square
text: repeat visitor to this hotel as we find the location near enough to Penn Station and places of interest- restaurants, movie theaters and Strand bookstore. Pleasant cocktail bar at hotel with great selection of beverages.

title: OUTSTANDING
text: This hotel exceeds expectations on all points.  The rooms and the hotel were clean, well appointed.  The hotel staff are professional, courteous, helpful, and go above and beyond to assist.  The food at the hotel restaurant (and in room dining) was delicious! I highly recommend this hotel and plan to return.

title: Average hotel, good location
text: Stayed here again, since my last time a few years ago. Hotel is on a good location. Staff was very friendly and check in was smooth. Room was small, but had everything what you'd need and was clean. The room though showed its age. For me nothing to worry about.

title: Great stay
text:
The hotel is lovely. Reception is welcoming and the guys there made us feel very welcome and a free glass of prosecco for each of us was very welcome after a long day traveling.  Rooms are a very good size and everything you need well nearly everything cups for coffee are tiny we do prefer larger cups/mugs. The bed is a great size and comfy the pillows are so soft and you sink into them heaven.
The subway is literally around the corner from the hotel and we used it all the time great to get everywhere.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Union Square Hyatt has a lot going for it, including nice rooms, nice staff, and great location. Most rooms in NYC are small, and this is no exception, but the room design works really well to make the most of the space. We did not eat at the restaurant, but the bar is very nice. Subway is 1/2 a block, drug store is a block, Whole Foods and Sephora are a block and a half. Several great restaurants in easy walk. Pretty quiet at night aside from a coupe sirens.

title: Hyatt Holiday
