text: It’s perfect location is just one of the many things that Hyatt Union Square is the ideal destination. The Destilled Bar and hotel resto provide an intimate ambience while in the midst of the city. As a world traveler , I always appreciate the hospitality of the staff who were diverse and authentic. The amazing staff- Lilly, Earl, Ethan, Oscar, Abraham, Paula always made me feel welcome during my 4 night stay. Kudos to the team.

title: A Hidden Gem in NYC
text: This is a great hotel in a great location near Union Square.  The staff was amazing and overall the experience was everything we expected and more!  Great breakfast!  The room with the balcony on the second floor was perfect.  We will definitely be returning to the Hyatt Union Square.

title: Great Location, But Small and Noisy Rooms and Spotty Service
text:
I hold top tier (Globalist) elite status with Hyatt; I spend a lot of nights in hotel rooms.

I live a few blocks from the property; I spent six nights at the Hyatt right before Christmas as some work was being done on our apartment.  I regret that what follows is a less-than-stellar review.

One of the things I like about living in the area is the proximity to the subways (4,5, 6 and L, N, Q, R, W trains) and the busses on 3rd and 4th Avenues which makes it very easy to travel via mass transit. In the neighborhood are a lot of places in the Union Square and East Village area for coffee and other meals, including the new Urbanspace food hall on 14th between 4th and 3rd Avenues.
The front desk was kind enough to upgrade my reservation from the base King Courtyard to a King High Floor in recognition of my elite status. An additional benefit of Globalist status is free breakfast vouchers and waived destination fees. The free breakfast is ordered at the lobby restaurant and remains one entrée and a hot drink - the steak and eggs entree has an additional $10 surcharge. I did the American Breakfast and hot tea a few days ($25) and it was fine; I mixed in other menu choices so I wasn't eating the same breakfast each day. Any gratuity is posted to the room folio as a food/beverage charge. Upon check in, elite members are given a small paper bag with two mini water bottles, two packets of property-branded trail mix, and a card listing additional amenities covered under the Destination Fee.

Two failures from the amenities was the High-Speed Internet option which is often a different tier from the standard speed. That's not the case here; the entire property has a single, pokey 10 Mbps WiFi option. Worse was the $15 per day Dry Cleaning amenity, which I used to have my dress shirts pressed each day. The same day (drop off by 9am, get it back by 7 pm) service was horrible. My results were:

Monday AM drop off: Returned Thursday AM
Tuesday AM drop off: Returned Tuesday PM
Wednesday AM drop off: Returned Thursday AM
Thursday AM drop off: Returned Friday PM

I would not rely on their laundry service if it was important to have the items the next day; the staff confided in me that this is an ongoing problem with their dry cleaning vendor.

The laundry charges are posted to your folio and then manually wiped off at checkout so you can't do remote checkout unless you stop by the front desk in the morning to have them update your folio. The staff even had the nerve to post a laundry charge to my folio after I checked out; I had to call them back to get it reversed, Given how badly they failed to deliver the "same day service" I requested, the fact that they even put the charge on my folio was pretty galling.

As for the rooms; they are very small, even by NYC standards and if you are not staying alone, you'd better be intimately familiar with your travelling companion as there's no wall separating the bathroom area from the living area so there’s basically no privacy when showering or changing clothes.

My room was on the 11th floor and faced 4th Avenue. Rooms on the 10th and 11th floors have floor-to-ceiling windows. There is a fire station across the street on 13th Street so that is a source of sirens at all hours of the day. My nearby apartment is also on the 11th floor, so I am used to a lot of NYC traffic noise in our neighborhood and it doesn't bother me or my sleep.  But, I will suspect that won’t be the case for others, so bring quality earplugs if you want uninterrupted sleep. The soundproofing of the windows is better than my place but there's still a lot that gets through.
I had a few annoying issues with the technology; the first was that the digital thermostat doesn't keep the room at a constant temperature. I set it at 74 and when I woke up in the morning, the room was at 68. When I bumped it to 76, once the morning sun came up, the room heated to 80. So, it was constant adjusting to get the temperature a steady level.  I’m told the trick is to put the motion sensor on the thermostat into “VIP Mode” to disable it. More annoyingly, the Chromecast and HDMI inputs on my TV didn't work; this became problematic as I was working from the hotel all week using my 13" laptop and I normally connect it via an HDMI cable to a TV so I can use it as a larger monitor. I limped through most of one day before asking an engineer to come up and check my TV. I was told I was doing everything right, connection and input selection-wise and there wasn't anything else that could be done. On Day 2 I gave up and went down to the Front Desk around lunchtime and asked to see other rooms. To their credit, the manager on duty came out and took my complaint seriously. We looked at a King Courtyard across the hall and yes, that TV worked with my HDMI cable. That room was much smaller so it wasn't even offered as an option for me to move into. We then went one floor down and looked at two empty King City Views facing 4th Ave. The first had the same non-operational Chromecast and HDMI ports, but the second one did (HDMI only; the Chromecast still didn't work); it helped that the room had a newer-model LG LCD. So, I moved my belongings one floor down. This room was right outside of the elevator, but the outside noise was minimal.
 This property is so inconsistent; my 11th floor room was lacking water glasses. My 10th floor room lacked a luggage stand and a do not disturb sign, which I had to get from housekeeping. The complementary water in the 11th floor room were two one-liter boxes of Just Water; the new room has .5 liter bottles. My new room was missing the backlight around the TV enclosure, so my room was darker at night. Most egregiously, the heating in the new room didn't work; it only blew cold air, so it was very cold in the room at night (mid 60s) and the engineer that came by the next day said the unit appears to be broken. As a remedy, I was given a space heater that, by the looks of it, was taken from someone's office or breakroom. Thankfully. it was good enough to keep my room at 72 when it was sub-freezing outside. No effort was made to repair the unit for the remainder of my stay, nor did anyone ask me if any of my reported issues had been resolved.

I was so disappointed with my experience; I would love to put friends and family visiting us here, but the hard and soft product service hiccups and lack of follow-through are just too much to deal with. So, regretfully, I cannot recommend this property.

title: Recommend
text: Very clean and great location.  For downtown NYC, the bathroom was a good size.  We ate at the restaurant for breakfast and had pancakes and they were very good.  The staff was very nice.  The bed was comfortable.

title: Hidden Gem in Union Square!
text: Great location, close to everything downtown, easy access to the East Village and Union Square. The hotel itself is very clean and the staff was very welcoming. The rooms are modern and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud! I would stay here again.

title: Great stay with family for Christmas
text:
My family and I stayed at they Hyatt Union Square for 3 nights over the holidays and had a great experience. 

The single rooms are nice and functional. We got a suite with a living area and it was great for group / family activities. 

The restaurant / bar is nice and convenient and reasonably priced (especially for the area).  

The best thing, though, are the folks that work there. Lily was friendly and super competent when we needed help. Earl and Roger poured us champagne (!) on Christmas Eve. Also had good interactions with Donny, Tatyanna, Victoria, and Shelley. 

Good location and facility. Fairly priced. Excellent staff.

title: Great value in NYC
text:
Lovely Hotel in a safe, walkable area of New York City. At the restaurant, the meatballs are so delicious I went to to a “food coma”. 

Lily, the Concierge, is absolutely amazing. 

I would highly recommend this Hotel

title: Perfectly Located
text: Minutes from NYU campus and Washington Square.  Close walk to SOHO for shopping.  Great shops  also in Union Square.  Great restaurants in the area too.  Hotel restaurant - The Bowery - was decent but closes early.  Hotel is super cute and cozy. and they make great use of the space - rooms are bigger than you think!  And they have valet parking which is a must!

title: Amazing Hyatt Union Square Experience
text:
The staff at this Hyatt was out of this world.
Caring, attentative and very helpful

They helped me print, free drinks when they saw me troubled  and it had a gym.

The rooms were clean, quite from the AC or Heater and perfect temperature control
Especially their night shift desk manager Lily...thank you for everything

title: Hyatt stay in NYC
text:
Outstanding visit and great service
Karina, the manager, was exceptional in terms of checking me in ensuring my stay was perfect.
Highly recommend this hotel. Top notch. 
This area of Manhattan is also recommended. The Village is highly desirable

title: Wonderful and friendly staff
text: The hotel was very centrally located to shops, restaurants, and transportation. Dunarien, the bell man, always greeted us with a smile and a kind word. The entire front desk staff was courteous, helpful and a joy to work with - regardless of the time of day. The tile in the shower showed a bit of wear but, otherwise, the room was clean and comfortable. Lots of pillows on the beds and good quality amenities (soaps, coffee, slippers, robes). This was my second experience with this property. I would stay here again. Thanks!

title: Great staff, very attentive
text:
Staff was great. Always pleasant and helpful  
Our room was not ready  until 5:30pm. The staff was good about communicating when it would be available. 
They offered us complimentary breakfast the next day because of the delay.
The rooms were well appointed, however small.

title: Amazing Place to Stay
text: The most friendliest and professional Staff! ❤️…. I was able to make same day reservation.  Bed extremely comfortable.  Bathroom very chic. The room clean and spacious. … I would definitely come back and stay much longer.

title: Excellent staff
text: Lily, Karina and Jenny are all wonderful!  Extremely professional l! Also, Dunarien , the bell man was very helpful and accommodating! Great location! Love the boutique feel in this awesome hotel! We will be back! Excellent with our dog!

title: Good hotel good location
text:
This is normally my favorite hotel in New York especially due to the location 
During the pandemic and immediately thereafter, the hotel was poorly functioning but this time is was almost back to normal 
Of course, it is overpriced as compared to other Hyatt properties at the same level but for New York the price is within range 
The hallways are in need of a re-do but the room was clean quiet and very well maintained 
The toiletries were good quality albeit only sufficient for one person and not for two 
Sunday one of the elevators was broken for a few hours which made the process of getting to and from the room painful, but situation was fixed later on
At night the hotel is locked and one is supposed to be able to open the door to reception with the room key; the card reader at the entrance doesn’t work and we had to wait outside in cold weather until someone opened 
Anyway this way of night curfew is strange and not acceptable for a good hotel

title: Stay somewhere else; anywhere else.
text:
The one star is for the location - excellent - and for the pleasantness of the  (albeit incompetent) staff.  

The rest of the place is just awful.  And we paid almost $1600 for two nights.  

The room - minuscule, but that wasn't unexpected.  There's no place to lay a suitcase to unpack, no place to unpack into (2 tiny drawers, very small closet) and not enough light to see what you're doing.  No rugs or carpets on the floor which is fake wood (vinyl?) planks.  The refrigerator is unplugged with a note saying that if you want a refrigerator, you have to call the desk.  The room is blacks, greys and whites and feels like a 2-hr hotel.  The room safe did not work. 

The bathroom - horrible lighting (tiny, very recessed LEDs) make it impossible to put on makeup in the dark shadowy room.  No counter space at all; better have a hanging Dopp kit.  The shower controls are BEHIND the shower door, so you have to be in the shower to turn it on.  

The bed - not uncomfortable, but it's a platform bed on an unfortunately squeaky platform.  

The staff - very good natured but totally incompetent.  Some examples:  it took 2 calls to get some extra pillows; when they finally arrived they didn't have pillowcases on them.  We called twice for ice; it never showed up and the front desk finally admitted that they just send the request to housekeeping and housekeeping is obviously not paying any attention (explains the pillows).  We called about the non-working safe; no one came to check it out (we assumed it just needed a new battery).  When we checked out, the valet whispered to us that we'd be better off retrieving the car ourselves from the garage because it would take him almost an hour to get it because no one else was valeting.  The garage was just a couple of blocks away.  

We're Hyatt regulars and this is the worst experience we've ever had.  Never again.

title: Comfort in the heart of it all!
text: We have stayed several times at this hotel and have always found it clean, comfortable, and stylish.  The location is fantastic,  right in the center of the city.  It is easy to walk to everything. The staff very accommodating, and there is ample space.

title: Convenient
text: A hotel that is close to Union square, subway and shopping.  Clean and convenient.  Lobby is simple and minimalist.  Great bar and jazz entertainment on certain evenings.  A nice restaurant to get coffee or a meal.

title: Clearly a 5 star property, except
text:
This property is clearly 5 star when it comes to the room, the check in, the room service, the doormen and the check out.   Everyone is so helpful and on top of it.  The rooms have true black out curtains,  noise makers, and are serviced daily if you request it, which we didn't.  We did request service of each room once each during our 5 day stay and it was performed without interruption to our daily routines.  The staff goes out of the way to help you at every opportunity you give them. 

My exception is simple- the breakfast menu is uninspired, and frankly, both kitchen and service is spotty.  I suspect they are better at dinner and lunch, but given breakfast, we opted top eat elsewhere for those meals.

title: Great experience, beautiful hotel, great location!
text: This Hyatt property and staff exceeded all expectations.  The hotel is beautiful and spacious for a boutique hotel.  The staff are great and our experience was very enjoyable.  I stay in Hyatt properties around the world and this is one that I will definitely look forward to returning to!  Great experience overall!

title: Great stay in the big city!
text: Great location; close proximity to the subway and shops. The room and amenities felt like my home instantly. Was there for an extended stay (9 days) and it couldn't have been better. The staff were incredibly accommodating and helpful.

title: Enjoyed my Stay!
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Union Square New York. Lonnie and Chanel were awesome! They made my stay especially pleasant. My room was cozy and clean and the hotel was conveniently located in proximity to The Public Theater which was my purpose for being in New York.

title: Perfect choice for this trip
text: Great location. Room was spacious with a great view of the con Edison clock tower. Even though the clocks have stopped working the nice blue lighting at night is great. A special shout out to all the front desk help, esp Chanel for making sure everything during my stay was going great.

title: Very Nice Hotel Perfect for a Brief Stay
text:
I traveled to the Hyatt for a two-day business meeting with coworkers.

The check-in experience was great. Chanel was very helpful with check-in and offered great amenities and provided help and guidance that made the rest of my stay very smooth.

The room quality is very good, with chic decor and comfortable bedding. I was on a nice high floor which had a nice view of the buildings around Union Square. My one qualm with the room was some of the lighting switches did not respond immediately, showing some signs of age. Also, the room is a bit small, so longer stays may feel more cramped. However, all of the other items in the room (shower, toilet, TV, espresso-maker) looked new and clean.

The location on Union Square is great, as the park is nice to walk around in during the day, and the location is very close to numerous subway entrances allowing me to travel around the city with groups easily, especially when fitting in multiple activities around NYC.

My group was there for business meetings, and the hotel did have nice space as part of the on-site restaurant that we were able to use for our needs. The space may not be appropriate for large board-meeting type conferences, but the casual space for our group of about 20 made for productive sessions.

The hotel bar was a popular destination and the hotel did feel lively. There was always staff at the desk and front door if needed. As someone who travels to many hotels for business and pleasure, I was very pleased with the Hyatt Union Square and will be back when in town!

title: Relaxed and Comfortable Stay
text: Friendly, courteous and helpful staff throughout. Quiet room. Great location, nice restaurants close by. Easy access by UBER to Midtown Restaurants and designer stores. We spent a long weekend and enjoyed staying at this hotel very much.

title: small rooms for the price
text: Stayed there a week ago. Rooms are too small for the price they are asking for. Tried to check in a bit earlier, shantel at the front desk was very helpful and got us in the room early. Shes great and very sweet.

title: Amazing service with a few quirks.
text:
These days it is very rare to truly feel appreciated as a Globalist member at hotels.  My most recent stay here made me feel very valued as a guest.  At the check in process, Chanel took great care of us.  Unfortunately didnt get a chance to see her again after that great experience but Tatiana continued to take amazing care of us throughout our stay.

Aside from the amazing customer service we received, did have a few issues with room service.  Had to request a few times for the room to be made before it was finally done.  Requested the sofa bed to be made but was never done so had to do that ourselves.  

So the service was great, the room was very nice and the location is perfect. If you have business/leisure in Union Sq area, I would definitely recommend staying here.

title: Excellent Service
text: I enjoyed my stay. Solid room, Nespresso (thank you), and outstanding service by Lily at the front desk. Her friendliness elevated my stay from typical to memorable. The overall location and restaurant/bar services were great.

title: Excellent Stay in the Heart of NYC
text: From the check-in process, which was prompt, professional and friendly, to my beautiful and spacious corner room, everything about my two-night stay in NYC was excellent.  The hotel is in a great location, the staff is very welcoming and warm, the fitness center is clean and well-equipped, and the food and beverage options are very good.

title: Great Union Square Hotel Experience
text: Very friendly and helpful checkin.   We were early, and they allowed us to occupy room after short check to confirm it was ready.   Chanel was super helpful about several questions.  We had a great lunch in the restaurant.  Well located - short walk to many dinner spots.  Bar is terrific.  Rooms are slightly larger than typical NY hotel and well-appointed with Nespresso machine, plenty of power outlets, etc.   Well designed.  No complaints so far!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: The staff are fantastic. I get a corp discount and also corp was paying, so it was pretty reasonable for a NYC hotel for me, YMMV.  For a personal weekend getaway it'd be perfectly reasonable considering the quality of the hotel and location.  I think market is ~$600/night.  I was there for a week on a business trip and there was a daily farmers market in the park.  Fantastic bars/restaurants within walking distance.  All sorts of things to see and do...also a halloween parade.  NYC takes Halloween *seriously*.

title: Nice stay!
text: Hyatt Union Square was a great stay for us. Great central location.  Staff was friendly(Chanel at desk was great!)room was a little worn but clean.  Restaurant was nice. Great to have a restaurant on location! Bar was nice addition, but bartender didn’t look experienced. Bar top sticky, never wiped it off/had to ask for a cloth. Overall very nice. I would stay again and I’m pretty picky!

title: Friendly staff and central place to stay in Manhattan!
text: Staff goes above and beyond and is extremely friendly! Bar and restaurant on premises are so nice!  Easy to hop on subway or walk to restaurants. The gym is amazing and extremely clean. The wifi was a little slow in the room i was staying in.

title: Best hotel room with private terrace
text: The most amazing room with private terrace welcomed us. We felt like we were true New Yorkers during our stay with access to our own terrace. Union Square has everything one could need, great restaurants, Saturday street market, shops, wine store around the corner. Restaurant at the hotel, Bowery Road, had wonderful meals and great service. A definite must!

title: Good Stay
text: The stay was good. The room was clean. The bathroom was clean. The staff are supportive. The check in and check out was smooth. I did not try the food so do not have a review for it. The location is nice

title: Nice hotel with too-notch staff
text: I had a very nice Stu at the Hyatt Union Square. It’s a nice hotel with a good gym. But the highlight was clearly the staff, who were incredibly friendly and helpful. A special shout-out to Lily at the front desk, who was an absolute pleasure to talk to, always greeted me warmly and always called me by my name. While that may seem like a minor thing, it makes a huge difference when you’re on the road a lot — it makes you feel more at home. And she gave a great recommendation for a slice of NY pizza!

title: All Positive
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my brief stay at the Hyatt Union Square. From check in with the very pleasant, helpful and efficient Chanel, to the friendly bartenders and their sublime concoctions all the way to the express check out option, it was a smooth and lovely stay. High scores for a great bed, a better shower, subway proximity and the little extras granted as a new Hyatt Rewards member.

title: Good location, just avoid breakfast
text:
Great location, especially to walk around. Valet was amazing at check-in. Lobby is a little tight, but it is NYC. Room was well appointed and considerably spacious considering what we’re used to in Manhattan. I must say Chanel was a breath of fresh air- please hire more people like her! While they don’t have a proper “concierge,” she definitely filled those shoes!
If I have to say one thing though it’s avoid the breakfast at all costs. Our service was just meh which I can get over but the food (well the food we got- because we never even got all of what we ordered) was mediocre. I can give them a little slack if they are busy but we were one of maybe three or four tables and the staff were poking around most of the time. But this experience was not enough to avoid this hotel altogether- just maybe the breakfast.

title: Say yes to Hyatt Union Square
text: This was our first time staying at the Hyatt Union Square. Everything was perfect from the minute we were greeted by Chanel. The lobby is warm, intimate and inviting. Check-in was so smooth. Chanel was able to get us a ready room hours earlier than the check-in time. The entire staff was so helpful and friendly throughout our four night stay. The GM Marina is very hands on and has trained her staff well. Chanel, Lily and Tatiana were a few of the front desk staff that went out of their way to make our stay so much nicer than any other hotel we have stayed in the city. No matter how busy they were, they made it a point to notice guests in the lobby and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort and meet our needs. A few of the little touches I appreciated in the hotel include: device to easily request a taxi on the nicely decorated table by the front door; Halloween candy :); coffee bar and cucumber/mint water by the elevator; a warm comfy robe and slippers in the room; umbrella if needed; lighted magnifying make-up mirror in room; bikes available to ride around the area. Like most NYC hotels, the room is small. But the lay out is perfect. Nicely renovated and very comfortable. The icing on the cake was the complimentary breakfast voucher for the adjoining restaurant, Bowery Road, which I will also give a glowing review!!

title: Customer service at its best - few issues with the room and they went out of their ways to accommodate.
text: Some of the rooms need to be modernised , lift is slow - staff are amazing .Recommend picking a room away from the lift as it’s noisy , corner rooms are great. Bar is fun and convenient . Breakfast is a little pricey but good - can get a bagel and coffee opposite at 25% of the price of breakfast

title: Globalist Royal Treatment at Hyatt Union Square
text: I had an amazing experience as a Globalist at Hyatt Union Square NYC. Lilly who checked me in was so personable and helpful. On a three night awards stay, I received an upgrade room which had a private large for NY outdoor landscaped terrace. Received daily free breakfast at the Bowery Road restaurant downstairs and also complementary valet parking which is a huge perk and convenience in Manhattan. I used to live in NYC and this location is very central to get around like a local. These kinds of experiences is why I am a loyal World of Hyatt member. Been hard to keep my Globalist status during the pandemic and all but they do treat you right!

title: No heating
text: Our heating didn’t work and we weren’t given any other options so just had to sleep with our jackets on. Not what you’d expect staying at Hyatt or anywhere for that matter. It was freezing! We managed to get them to bring extra blankets at least but would have been nice to have been given other options or even a refund so we could find somewhere else to stay

title: The worst customer service experience of my life
text: Truly the worst check in + customer service experience of my life. Ciaka and his team were severely under-prepared, rude, and had no idea what they were doing. I came to this hotel for a night for a movie premiere and when I get there I didn't have a room ready for me for over 90 minutes. No apologies, nothing.

title: Friendly staff, great location
text: Loved my stay! Have stayed at 5+ different Hyatts and Marriotts in NYC in the last 2 months, and this one was by far the warmest and friendliest. From the moment I walked in, Lily at the front desk made me feel at home, and always had with a big smile and greeted me by name anytime she saw me later. Would absolutely recommend a stay here. Thanks, Lily!

title: Keycards down, no thermostat, no intercom, staff didn’t care
text: We weren’t given keycards when we arrived - had to be escorted by security every time. At night thermostat didn’t work, it was boiling hot. The intercom didn’t work at the time. When we tried to check out the lady said “it wasn’t on my watch” and couldn’t care less.

title: Fabulous
text: This hotel was great!! The staff was amazing!! Shout out to Chanel!! She was awesome! The entire staff was great! I will be staying here again!! Great location to Union square subway! The restaurant and bar turned out to be a hot spot!!

title: Chanel Is Awesome
text: Room was clean and comfy, Chanel at the front desk was an absolute rock star.  She made all the difference in making sure I was well accommodated. I would totally stay here again when traveling for business.

title: Uncomparable Excellence
text: Traveled NY from Atlanta for a one night stay to attend a funeral service.  The front desk agents were compassionate and caring.  I am grateful that Chanel was understanding and thoughtful, especially being a senior woman traveling alone during a time of bereavement. This short stay is an example of why I am a Hyatt customer member.

title: Great hotel and location
text: This hotel was top notch! The staff were all friendly and accommodating. The location was superb! We loved our room as well. The only thing that would have made it better would’ve been a refrigerator.

title: Great service, stellar location
text: Chanell ran the front desk with a sea of guest checking in/out, she was calm, efficient and friendly. Took care of my bags and gear while I waited for car to be available, made sure I had a late check out. Hyatt values their people and it shows in how they interact with guests.

title: Very clean and quiet room
text: First time I ever encountered a chainmail shower curtain, very nice.  The room, as requested, was very quiet except for the occasional fire truck siren outside.  I was recognized as a globalist member and received the appropriate awards.

title: A+ Customer Service
text: I travel to NYC for business quite a bit and Chanel literally made my stay the best one yet! She was super kind, warm and so very accommodating! She was such a breath of fresh air and whatever we needed she went above and beyond to provide it. Thanks to her I will be staying at the Hyatt again.

title: Nice balance of style and substance
text: Just spent a really nice night in NYC at this hotel. It has a great location with Union Sq Park next door and it is right on the edge of all the restaurants and shopping in the E Vliliage. We had a delicious breakfast at the restaurant int he hotel and the bar is very stylish with high ceilings and attracts lots of people from the street in addition to hotel guests. As for the rooms, they are very spacious for a Manhattan hotel and are done up in dark wood. Many of the rooms on the second floor have balconies. By far the best reason to go here though is the helpful staff. Chanel at the front desk in particular was extremely helpful both when we checked in and when we left.

title: Splendid stay!
text:
My boyfriend just flew in today and we wanted to stay in the city since it’s a beautiful day out. We want to especially thank Chanel from the front desk for making it a memorable stay! She was the sweetest!!!!!! Wonderful customer service and she made us feel super welcomed and special! Chanel made the check in process super easy as well and accommodated us. The rooms are super clean and nice and the view is spectacular! We would definitely be back :) 
Thank you!

title: Excellent hotel and locaiton
text:
Union Square is a nice area to stay in and the Hyatt location there is excellent.  All of the staff that I interacted with were great- very friendly and helpful.  I only got one of their names, but Lonnie at the front desk was a great person to deal with after a long flight and subsequent subway rides from JFK.
A minor note- I generally really dislike hotel pillows.  They're just too puffy.  But the pillows here are excellent.

title: Chanel was amazing
text: The hotel was great but it all starts with your first impression at the front desk and Chanel sets the bar for customer service. Love her energy. Could  not do enough for us. Keep it up!  We’ll be back! Great location and proximity to Union Square park.

title: Great service in NYC
text: Service is really good and the facility appears to be new. Bar had live music that was amazing vibe and the restaurant service was kind with a great space for business meetings. Shout out to Chanel for bringing the best checkin experience and service!

title: Amazing staff, clean spacious rooms. Get the King!
text: Lots of food choices and bars nearby - great, safe neighborhood. The front desk staff was friendly but not overbearing - and ACTUALLY helpful. I was happily surprised! There’s a restaurant and bar in the hotel with lots of choices nearby.

title: Aug 2022
text: Overall a nice property in a convenient location, especially for NYU. Very friendly staff. Lily was very friendly and always asked if we needed anything every time we saw each other. Chanel was also terrific, always acknowledged us in passing with a smile.

title: Wedding & Perfect location
text: We stayed here for a wedding at the Bowery Hotel. This hotel was convenient and beautiful. The staff was exceptional. The amenities were excellent. Restaurant, but no room service though. Staff exceptional. Amenities in the room g=good, shower - hot and full. Fast internet. Love the convenient location to everything. I highly recommend it.

title: Came For Business, Would Stay From Pleasure
text:
Overall great experience. My team and I came out for a business trip, we had a little trouble checking in at the beginning, but not to the fault of the Hotel. Our company forgot to send the Credit Card Authorization Form. We checked in on a Saturday and could not reach the office. Long story short, we had to put down our business or personal cards until Monday when the CCA could be sent. Which did happen and no one's card was charged.

The staff was always very helpful and polite. All requests and needs were accommodated. It was my first time in NYC and the rooms were bigger than I expected it to be. I had a rental, but the Subway was conveniently close by. When I come back, I will stay here again.

title: small rooms
text: Small rooms, tiny bathroom, way too little for way too much. If you are claustrophobic, this isn't the place for you.  Unfortunately, this appears to be typical for NYC.  Great location with lots to do.

title: Quick visit
text: Quick stay. NYC is overpriced which is why the value rating is average.  The location was good for our needs. I wish the bathroom vanity had more privacy. I will stay here again if given the opportunity.

title: Chanel is awesome!!!
text:
Me and my husband had a vacation in Hyatt union square hotel!
Hotel was very clean, system very organised! 
Service deserve 7 stars! 
Chanel made us feel very comfortable and special! She knows her job so well! All questions was answered, she did an amazing job from the beginning till the end of our trip! This is Professionalism! This is what calls SERVICE! This amazing lady has to be known! Chanel is the Face of Hotel!

title: 5 Stars for Chanel!
text: Chanel was AMAZING!  She made our Anniversary  a memorable one! She greeted us with her warm smile! And she was very professional! She was very attentive and made our stay very comfortable! We are greatful that we went to the Hyatt but our experience would not have been so memorable if it wasn't for Chanel!

title: Great NYC accommodations
text: Great location, friendly professional staff and nice restaurant!   Rooms are of an expected size for NYC with a very contemporary décor and excellent systems.   Small but diverse fitness center.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Warm welcome by Chanel
text: Had a very nice experience right from the moment we stepped in. Chanel was very welcoming, professional, confident and knowledgeable. She made sure that we were going to have a wonderful stay.  Would be really nice if all hotel stays are handled this way. Thank you Chanel!

title: Location/ Clean, Quiet and Modern
text: Great Location and Property with full amenities package. Room was clean, quiet and comfortable for the short 1 night stay. I did check out the bar and enjoyed the atmosphere and bourbon selection. Also had breakfast at the restaurant and found it satisfying.

title: think twice about staying here
text: We have two rooms for Sept 16-18, 2022. Lamps and electric sockets are broken in each and despite asking at 5:00 none of these were fixed by 11:00 pm. Also, the price had dropped significantly between making the reservation and the stay, but the hotel refused to adjust the rate.  While the size of the rooms is typical for NY, the layout is such that you often have to crawl over the bed to get from one side of the room to the other.  Not what I expect from a Hyatt and a reason why I’ll likely avoid the properties when possible.  My advice to others will be stay someplace else.

title: Chanel Mack
text: Chanel immediately greeted me with a beautiful smile and kind voice. I had be struggling around the city trying to find a place to print my boarding pass and she graciously took me in without any hesitation. She was so kind and patient with me. I’ll definitely be booking my next stay in NYC with the Hyatt after my experience with her. Thank you again Chanel!

title: You get what you pay for
text: I live in the area and have stated a lot of NYC hotels. The week before we stayed at Hyatt Union Square we stayed at a different hotel. While Hyatt was a little more expensive, the difference in room cleanliness, service, space, and location was extreme. The people at the front desk were all incredible and our corner room was full of light, amenities and a great view. You definitely get what you pay for and I will be coming back to Hyatt Union Square again.

title: Lovely staff and great location
text: In town for a wedding and always look for a hyatt - this one was no different from the high quality hyatts I’m used to! Staff, especially Chanel, was great, location was amazing and the rooms were clean and nice.

title: Great stay
text: Hotel is wonderful and conveniently located. The service was excellent, particularly the service at the front desk. Chanel and Tatiana were super helpful! Would definitely be staying again and I recommend this hotel to anyone in staying in the area!!

title: Loved it!
text: Exceeded expectations and great customer service- property was great! Enjoyed the Library and Bowery Road for cocktails and meals!  Room was great and super value for NYC! Would definitely stay here again!

title: One major flaw
text: This is a great facility if you are looking to stay in the Union Square area, but with one glaring exception...the mildew/mold in the shower was absolutely disgusting. To pay that kind of money for a hotel and have a shower in that condition is unacceptable. The housekeeping staff was wonderful and the mold/mildew was not the kind of issue that could be addressed with a daily cleaning...it needs a very deep bleaching, etc.

title: Excellent service from Chanel
text: Great hotel and excellent location. Checked in with Chanel who was an absolute pleasure. Was very friendly and welcoming and was able to provide a room upgrade. A+ customer service by Chanel. Would recommend staying here.

title: Amazing service
text: Thank you so much to the staff especially Chanel. She went above and beyond to make my staycation perfect! Very helpful and made me feel welcomed! Recommended restaurants and activities to do in the area during my stay! Will come back again!

title: Awesome service from Chanel
text: We stayed for 8 nights in this hotel. The service was great specially one of the receptionist Chanel. She was very helpful she always answered all our questions, provide fast service, very kind with us. We look forward to book this hotel in our next trip to NYC.

title: Hotel
text: Very nice hotel. Checked in with chanel. She was amazing! Very nice friendly and warm. We were able to upgrade to a terrace room for free! Amazing customer service! The hotel is very clean and in a great location in union square would highly recomend!

title: In NYC to move grandson into school
text: I stayed at the Hyatt with my daughter and grandson in August. The hotel and the hotel staff was very nice. Rooms were kind of  small. Shanel at the front desk was very nice and helpful. Gave my grandson very good train directions to harlem. Very sweet girl

title: Nie wieder!
text: Die Leistungen und der Service des Hotels stehen in keinem Verhältnis zu dem Zimmerpreis. Es war laut, da über unserem Zimmer das Kühlaggregat des Hotels installiert war. Das Zimmer war schmutzig, Kleiderschrank, Nachttisch, Radiowecker und Kosmetikspiegel trugen den Staub der letzten Wochen. Bei 7 Übernachtungen eine echte Herausforderung. Eine Reduzierung des Zimmerpreises lehnte man ab.

title: Delightful hotel near Union Square
text: My family stayed here for nearly 2 weeks and loved every moment.  Everyone we encountered at the hotel was very friendly and helpful and the reception staff were all wonderful and great ambassadors for the hotel but Lily and Mathura were particularly helpful for us.  Thanks!  The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the food delicious and the location great if you want to be near Union or Washington Squares or NYU.  Highly recommended.

title: Good Quality in Great Location
text: Good quality, very client and a convenient location at a good price. Much larger rooms than expected. Would stay again. Did not give the property 5 stars because have stayed at Hyatts with more extras.

title: Great service, convenient location
text: Chanel at the front desk was awesome! So friendly, went out of her way to make sure I had everything I needed. Hotel was convenient for subway access. Busy bc of NYU college move-in weekend but staff seemed to handle it beautifully.

title: Fantastic Experience in the City
text: My husband and I booked a room with a terrace last-minute just for a date night in the city and we were very pleased with the room itself and the excellent customer service. We got the to hotel a little early and had a delicious lunch at the restaurant, Bowery Road, while our room was being prepared. Chanel at the front desk checked us in amid a very busy crowd (happened to be move-in weekend at NYU) but was pleasant and professional despite the busy atmosphere. Our room was the perfect size for two people but the terrace is worth the extra money and we are so glad we decided to get this room - having morning coffee outside in the fresh air was so relaxing. Chanel also helped me out on Sunday morning by giving me some first aid supplies since my heels left me all blistered up after walking around the East Village on Saturday night. We are loyal Hyatt customers, Chanel and the rest of the staff are a great representation of the service you hope to receive when you’re traveling and of the Hyatt brand overall. Great experience, great hotel!

title: Overcharging my credit card
text: Blocked my credit card for USD 3900 for a stay of 15 nights (in addition to the room charges !!) and did not manage to reverse it till now (just have 2-3 days left to go !). Even after this mistake, they are further charging me a full day room charge for a 2 hour late checkout (I was willing to pay half room charge !)

title: Fantastic
text: I can't say enough good things about this location! I highly recommend it to anyone visiting New York as it is close to everything but not too busy where you cannot rest at night. I really enjoyed meeting everyone I encountered at the Hyatt!

title: Top notch hotel in a great location
text: The Hyatt at Union Square is a top notch hotel and very well located. Rooms are a bit crowded but well appointed with king size bed, two night tables, a desk, chair, closet, and mid-size table for glasses, drinks, etc.. Bathroom is larger than average for a NYC hotel. The Bowery Restaurant serves great food and the Library Bar is a must for a fab cocktail and ambiance. Tons of restaurants, bars, shops, and the world renowned Strand bookstore are steps away!

title: Comfortable, clean, and convenient stay
text: Really surprising stay for a business trip. Rooms were modern, everything was clean, it was a great location. I would definitely stay here again! Great value as well - I would recommend this hotel to friends and family!

title: Exceeded Expectations
text: I'm a bit of a hotel snob and this hotel exceeded expectations.  Room seemed recently updated and very clean.  Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  I had breakfast at the Bowery (restaurant on site) and it was fabulous - ordered the egg/avocado toast and not as expensive as typical hotel restaurants are.

title: No lights.
text: took two maintenance men an hour at 9 pm to come unwire the broken light by the bed that wouldnt turn off.  They knew this was a problem with theses fixtures...No light in half the room to get ready the next morning and the makeup mirror light was broken.  For $500+ a night would liked to have had lights....

title: Poor service, moldy showers, and broken fixtures
text:
Mobile check-in didn't work (check-in time passed and it still said my room wasn't ready), so we checked in at the front desk. They gave us our keys and we headed up to the room, where we discovered we had been given a street-side room next to the elevators instead of the quiet "courtyard view" room we had booked. When I called down to the front desk they seemed surprised I wasn't happy with being silently given a different room type, and told me that the room type I had booked wasn't available. After some back and forth they told me to come back down to the front desk to get a different room. Someone else was at the front desk, and they quickly gave me the type of room I had booked, so I guess the story about it being unavailable was bogus.

The new room was much quieter, but not in great condition. The shower had mold all over the tiles around the bottom of the walls, especially in the corners. The door stuck, and there were big gouges in the floor from it. The coffee machine didn't work, producing a few drops of coffee on each attempt. The machine didn't look like it had been cleaned out very often (if ever), so probably something inside was clogged with old coffee residue. The blinds were nearly impossible to operate. We were only in town for one night so we cut our losses and didn't roll the dice on a third room. The beds were clean and comfortable, at least.

We booked the "courtyard view" to avoid the street noise, but if we had been in it for the view, we would have been sorely disappointed. Like the rest of the hotel it didn't seem to have gotten any maintenance since it was built, complete with tiles of fake greenery falling off the fencing around it.

Mobile checkout was smooth, but one of the two tiny elevators was broken, so it took us quite a while to get out as we had to wait for there to be room for our bags in the remaining elevator as everyone else was trying to leave.

Overall quite disappointing for how expensive it was.

title: Disappointed
text: I usually stay at this hotel because it is conveniently located and quiet. This time the hotel staff seemed untrained and understaffed. Our room was not made one day, and the next day poorly made. ( Bed not well made and we were out of  toiletries. No apologies given. Breakfast was good though.

title: UNSECURE and Poor Service
text: The staff left our room door OPEN for hours while we were out during the day. Anything could have been stolen. Room was only cleaned once during our stay and when it finally was cleaned, they took our towels and did not replace them. I’ve never left a poor review on anything but our experience was appalling. Super concerning to come back to a hotel room that is open for anyone to walk into. Staff did not send up towels when we had NONE until our third call downstairs. For the price you would expect safety and good service and we received neither. All we got was a free breakfast for our “inconveniences” and told that they are “investigating” the room door being left open.

title: Fun location
text: Perfect location for visiting my daughter studying at Parsons.  So close to Union Square Park but just far enough away that it feels less busy.  Comfortable and quiet room with good A/C and nice hot shower plus plenty of outlets for all the electronics.  Well-priced for location and friendly staff.

title: Hyatt Union Square a win!
text: I love to stay in Union Square, and the new Hyatt Union Square did not disappoint! The reception staff was cheerful and helpful, the rooms very nice (yes, brand new!) and bed so comfortable. The rooms have true black out curtains and are soundproof. Easy access to metro a block away, with a straight shot to GCT or Times Square, near good shopping and restaurants. We ate in the restaurant and it was excellent food with same great service as in lobby. Very happy with my choice. Well done, Hyatt! I’ll be back for sure.

title: Business Stay
text: Loved my stay at the hotel. Very comfortable! The staff was very helpful, the rooms were always clean. The location of the hotel was very convenient for me personally. The food at the restaurants below was also very nice.

title: Avoid this Hotel at all Costs
text: We booked a block of rooms at this hotel for the weekend of my son's wedding, and based upon the rates that they charged, we expected a wonderful experience.  We were sadly disappointed.  One of the rooms we booked was a terrace suite, which had a large outdoor terrace where we hoped to be able to host our family.  The terrace had a number of planter boxes, which had overgrown plants and weeds and had not been tended to for months.  There were cigarette butts on the ground, which my grandchildren were picking up.  The outdoor furniture was incredibly dirty and even changed the color of my wife’s nail polish.  The outdoor area was totally filthy.  When we reached out to the hotel to have someone clean it up, they never sent anyone up to our room.  Anytime we called for anything, no one ever came to help.  To add insult to injury, after we checked out the hotel claimed that we damaged the room, and without our knowledge or consent, put thru a "damage fee" on our credit card.  When we spoke to the manager and asked for pictures of the damage and receipts for any repairs, etc., she said she was under no obligation to provide them to us.  We spent a fortune to stay in this hotel, and had nothing but disappointment.  Run do not walk.

title: Excellent Stay!
text: Really felt comfortable at this Hyatt.  It's nice to walk into the lobby and the staff remembers your name!  Coffee and newspapers every morning,  clean spacious room and bath,  great night's sleep, on site restaurant with delicious healthy meal choices and very attentive wait staff.  Convenient to the Strand Bookstore around the corner, ten city blocks to the Harry Potter Store,  a quick cab ride to a Broadway play,  easy Valet Parking,  Close to NYU.  We want to stay here on our next trip to NYC. It's five minutes from the Holland Tunnel if your are driving into the city from the New Jersey Turnpike or Newark Airport. Rated a 4 Star hotel by AAA.

title: Great, clean, modern hotel in a fantastic location with excellent guest service.
text: We stayed on the 11th (top) floor in a standard room with two beds. Very cozy for New York, tight space but I expected tighter. Modern lighting and outstanding bathroom. Very clean room and guest services kept it clean as well. We had three children and they did fantastic in the room. Blackout curtains were a must and worked very well blocking the wall to wall windows which were beautiful during the day. The staff was very helpful and pleasant on every interaction.

title: Great Stay !
text: This is our new favorite hotel in Manhattan! The staff is so friendly and caring in addition to being most professional! Valet parking could not be easier! Spacious room, on site restaurant, very clean and quiet!We will definitely return in the future!

title: Great Union Square Experience
text:
Dropped our daughter off for a summer program close to the hotel. 

Staff was attentive and friendly. 

The jazz bar in the lobby was very nice along with the craft cocktails. So, too, was the complementary breakfasts. Yummy!   

We enjoyed our stay and will return.

title: Anniversary Weekend
text: Clean, friendly, and very convenient.  The rooms were very comfortable and we never felt cramped. We all know how tight NYC hotel rooms can be.  They had 3 elevators which meant we never had to wait over a couple of minutes to get to our room, which was on the 11th floor. I enjoyed my stay and plan to stay again when I come back.

title: NYC is back and Hyatt Union Sq. is where you should stay
text: Amazing, friendly and welcoming staff, great restaurant and chill Library bar, perfect location. Room as cozy, tastefully furnished, bathrooms looks recently renovated. Have stayed in many NYC hotels and this was the best value I've experienced since pandemic.

title: Disgusting experience. Stay elsewhere.
text:
Room was filthy upon arrival, brown water/substance on the counter and a used sports bra in the closet. Was told there was nothing they could do and staff didn’t even seem to care. The next day we requested the room be cleaned twice and finally returned to an unmade up room with fresh sheets left on the bed for us. 

Definitely stay elsewhere.

title: Hyatt hotel union square awful service
text: I have stayed in many hotels. I don't think I ever experienced such poor qulity service from hotel staff as i did in the hyatt union square hotel. . Just last week I stayed at the james hotel nomad. Not to compare. Staff there is accommodating,  aiming to please. The contrary is true for the hyatt union square.  Do not recommend it at all.

title: Great location,customer service could be improved
text: I booked a 2 night stay and extended for a 3rd night. Stephen at check-in was wonderful. My gripe was that staff seemed to have a crappy attitude when asked to bring up a Doordash order. Also was overbilled for water and there was no response to any of my inquiries.

title: Good location, poor service, small rooms
text: The location in Union square is great. The hotel service if pretty poor - amenities not replaced, laundry not delivered, inconsistent reception staff. Breakfast is poor of stay for more than one night. Rooms are ok. Very small, but it’s NYC. Inward facing rooms are dark, city view rooms are smaller.

title: Horrendous customer service
text: My car was damaged in the valet service. The front office manager and receptionists promised to interface with the garage to handle the repairs. Instead, they were condescending, rude, and repeatedly miscommunicated, thereby making a bad situation worse. I’m appalled at how unprofessionally I was treated.

title: Tiny, noisy room
text: This tiny room was noisy due to being next to an elevator or dumbwaiter that started early every morning.  Our room was not made up our last night and we had to call for towels.  We were supposed to have a special rate for our group, but had a message on the website that rooms were not available for that date.  But when I went on the regular website we were able to book a room for double the price.

title: Good bed and functional but customer service could be better
text: The pros are: great location, swift check-in, and a very comfortable bed. The cons are: housekeeping staff does not replenish supplies, so you will have to ask for lotion, tea bags, etc. And this review needs to be 200 characters, so I'm just adding filler text.

title: Location, location, location
text:
A perfectly situated hotel, with an attached restaurant, close to Union Square. 

Staff were friendly and accommodating. 

We didn’t use the restaurant but it looked well-attended. 

Housekeeping was a bit ‘minimal’ and the suite was a little random in terms of furnishings and storage, but overall clean and comfortable. 

Most importantly, you could not wish for a better location for accessing the subway.

title: Not great
text:
The rooms are nice and the staff are friendly. However, we had multiple pretty large issues when we last stayed. Dry cleaning is available here, but what you aren’t told is that the express services, overnight services are not actually available, the collection paper is outdated. This led my husband and I to have to purchase all new outfits for a wedding we were attending mere hours before it started because our dry cleaning, that should have been ready and returned to us that morning, had not only not yet returned but had just been picked up. The staff were apologetic but not helpful, offering little more than a shrug when I asked them what I was meant to do. 
Additionally, I suppose there was a miscommunication but at one point we left the room to get food and we came back to two men in our room trying to fix something on the tv?! Our stuff was scattered all over the room, I was unprepared to have anyone in there given my private things were strewn about. I honestly felt really uncomfortable that staff were allowed to access my room without my knowledge or consent. Because of this, the supervisor offered to comp a meal for us-which I realized was just charged to my credit card anyway… lol thanks. Hyatt usually delivers an excellent stay but I have to say this was a pretty dismal experience.

title: Horrible hotel!
text: Beware ! Horrible hotel! Incompetent staff! Do not stay here ! This is the worst hotel that I’ve ever stayed at. Mistake after mistake.  Terrible! They appear hospitable however cannot get information correctly. The rooms are very dark and hard to see.  My room was flooded and they didn’t even offer anything. I had to insist on an upgrade.

title: Location is terrific, everything else subpar
text:
My family recently booked a few rooms at the Hyatt Union Square on a weekend. Having read all the reviews, I really wanted to avoid staying at this property, but the family event we were attending was just around the corner, and this is a part of Manhattan with very little choice of hotels. So, I reluctantly ponied up 25K Hyatt points/night for my stay. At least that was way less painful than shelling out more than $500/night, including tax, for such subpar accommodation. 

Having been primed by all the negative reviews to lower my expectations, I wasn't too bitterly disappointed by my stay. The lobby is indeed tiny and crowded, front desk service is perfunctory, and the front entrance was boarded up with plywood during my stay. But, I did manage to check in without a long wait, so it could have been worse. My room, as expected, was small and dark, with outdated decor, and showed quite a bit of wear and tear. It faced the interior courtyard, so had no view to speak of, but the upside was an absence of traffic noise, so my sleep was undisturbed. One nice, unexpected amenity in my room was the mini-fridge, which allowed me to keep drinks and snacks chilled. The bathroom was clean and spacious enough, but the towels were thin and scratchy--the kind I'd expect in a budget motel. However, I was pleasantly surprised that when I texted the hotel asking for a bathrobe and extra toiletries, these items were delivered within five minutes. 

It's a shame that the hotel's owners don't seem to have spent a dime on upkeep, maintenance, and service at this hotel, instead relying on its prime location to keep the rooms occupied. If I hadn't absolutely needed to stay right at this location, I would have been much happier spending my 25K Hyatt points per night at a much nicer hotel elsewhere in Manhattan, like the Thompson Central Park.

title: Pésima resolución de problemas y malos cobros
text: Pésimo el servicio, llegué el día 25 de Mayo al hotel, hice el check-in por la aplicación, al llegar al counter me dijeron que estaba ok, y me asignaron mi habitación, al día siguiente, me encuentro con que no puedo ingresar a la habitación, voy a preguntar y resulta que me dejaron como "no show" generando un problema tremendo, me cobraron una multa de 800 dólares, me volvieron a cobrar el seguro y me cobraron nuevamente la habitación, ese mismo día pedí la reversa de los cargos y a la fecha todavía no desaparecen los cargos de la habitación ni los de garantía que me cobraron 2 veces. Ya van dos días desde el checkout y todavía no son reversados los cobros.

title: Ruidoso, faltantes y caro
text: Había un ruido en el piso 6 que se escuchaba cada 5 minutos insoportable. En mi habitación no había pantuflas como así tampoco frigobar. En la recepción tuve que pagar varios dormitorios y el precio que me querían cobrar era distinto entre la primer reserva y la segunda

title: Union sq Hyatt
text: In one week received no service one day.  Staff told us that the maids were now busy with other rooms and would not get to our room, despite us being out all day from 7.45 am to 6pm.  Towels are old and rag like.  Staff entered the room unannounced at 11.57pm, and awakened my wife and me.

title: Appalling,
text: After we missed our connecting flight we had to stay over in NYC - it was 1am when I booked the room and past 3am when I finally was given my room card. There No sheets on bed and told one price when booking over the phone to be charges 300% more. I was quoted $189 (which I thought was low as did the other 4 people that were checking in at the same time) minute booking and charged over $500 per room when the email came through. Junior staff left to fend for themselves, management should be embarrassed.

title: Not worth the Hyatt name
text: The lobby is tiny. Room is very small too. It's not worth the price or the Hyatt brand. While it is in a very good location there are several other choices of hotels at the same price level but with much better values.

title: very dirty room
text: room was very dirty, broken window..window was repaired after, but room was not cleaned..sheets were changed a they were all stained with blood..floor was dirty, chair was dirty, no surfaces were clean..bath also very dirty

title: No customer service
text: Overcharged, room not available, inaccurate description of room given. No response from customer services even though have given them time before this review was written. The hotel is positioned in a noisy location and if you want a nights sleep ask for a high courtyard room that is in fact just a dirty internal view of other buildings.

title: No hot water Hyatt, Paul Acosta saves the day
text: Tried this hotel for the first time. Great location, beautifully appointed. The restaurant inside is decent, although the food is salty! Unfortunately, the hotel did not have hot water in the morning and I had morning meetings in our local office. When I called the front desk, the woman just said "we know" with no estimate of timing of the fix. I had to "shower" in the sink with cold water and even shave my legs in the sink, which was no party. Thank goodness for Paul Acosta, the director of the front office.  He was very understanding and professional. He comped my lunch and gave me additional points to my membership. I hope Hyatt knows what a gem they have in Paul!

title: Used to be our place in NYC
text: This has always been our go to place in New York City because the location is convenient and hotel was adequate.  Not this time!  The lights in our hotel room came on repeatedly Spontaneously throughout the night. We were there for three nights. Every morning we complained to the manager. The problem was not fixed. The manager claimed that nothing was wrong and refused to believe us. I’ve never had such an exasperating experience in any hotel.  In addition our room hotel was very well worn and needs a complete renovation. The bathroom door for example did not even have a handle. See photo.  We expect better from a Hyatt hotel.

title: I would stay again if I needed accommodation in that immediate area.
text: Pretty good for our purposes and compared with other NY locations that we have stayed, however for the money I expected more.  Great location for our visit to NYU.  Good size room, plenty of towels and hot water.  The reception was under-staffed, and the staff seemed somewhat stressed.  I was a little disappointed with the service and attitude of the wait staff in the Bowery Rd restaurant.  I did the fast check-out and was charged for bottled water that we never drank.  I would stay again if I needed accommodation in that immediate area.

title: Great Hotel.
text: We loved this hotel.  We had never been to New York so I was not 100% sure when we booked this hotel.  It exceeded our expectations.   The location was perfect.  The room was very nice with just some really cool features. The bar downstairs was very unique and we took pictures and shared with several people who lived in New York and had never been there and are now going to visit it!

title: Awful
text:
Probably one of the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. I stayed there because of the location. We were laughing and comparing it to the Howard Johnson.
No room daily room cleaning, only every 4 days. 
Super small rooms and bathroom.
No amenities. 👎

title: For a Hyatt the property should be a little tighter
text: I've stayed at this hotel a few times since it is near my office. Each time was ok but something off each time. One time the room wasn't clean, another time I wasn't able to check in until 10:00pm, and another time the water in the shower was only scolding hot.

title: Beautiful Location, Amazing Staff!
text: When visiting NY, this is the hotel to stay at!  Great price, great location and wonderful staff!  I stayed here for the first time in March 2022.  A little late on the review but I seem to review places when its a poor experience.  I reviewed this location on google and it just did not measure up to the experience I HAD which is why I need to be more vigilant and review when VISITS ARE GREAT!  Upon arrival, I was blown away by the ambiance.  I arrived late and wanted to go right up to my room and sleep.  The room was very cold.  I called the front desk and they immediately sent up Engineer Sheldon Lawrence.  He was professionally dressed, pleasant with a smile and determined to get us heat.  While working, he let me know exactly what he was doing which was promising he knew what he was doing.  Getting in late - you just want to sleep, you don't want to have to sleep in the arctic cold nor have to change rooms.  Within minutes of troubleshooting, getting proper tools we felt warm air!  What a relief.  Sheldon gave it a few more minutes to make sure it stayed blowing warm air and assured us it was fixed.  I was very pleased with how he took ownership of the situation, was driven to fix it quickly and was so very pleasant in the process.  It hurts when you go somewhere, an employee takes their sweet old  time or has an attitude like you disturbed them to do THEIR JOB - THIS WAS NOT THE CASE!  Sheldon Lawrence, you are the reason my family enjoyed their stay.  You were our first, memorable seamless employee interaction that was not forced or "part of the job."  You went above and beyond our request in such a pleasant and quick way that I trust in your establishment and trust that when we return - we continue to get this type of service.  Thank you for your hard work, and pleasant service you provided.  We cannot wait to return, hopefully in the summer!

title: Wonderful hotel and staff
text: Every staff person that I met during my stay at the Hyatt was friendly and helpful. My room was well appointed, clean and comfortable. The restaurant was excellent. The location was great for my needs

title: Great Location!!
text: Comfortable and quiet hotel.  Rooms are compact, but nice. The main reason that I stayed there was to be near my son's apartment.  The location is great because it is within walking distance of so many residential neighborhoods. On the expensive side, but that's New York!!

title: Welcome Back to New York!
text: This was our first trip back to NYC in two years. I'm glad to see the city starting to rebound. We've stayed at this Hyatt before and everything was in perfect working order. The staff was friendly and courteous. Hotel was very clean. We look forward to returning again in the future.

title: I'm a Hyatt Globalist and won't stay here again.
text: We were arriving early on a red-eye flight, so we paid to check in the day before to get to our rooms and sleep. We called the day before to confirm our check in. Katie assured us we were set and, upon arrival, could show our IDs and they would give us room keys. However, upon arrival, the lady at the desk seemed to have no knowledge about this. She worked in super slow motion to check us in and asked us to give her (not show, but give) our IDs and Hyatt credit card. Once in the rooms she eventually assigned to us, she had placed my wife and me in the smaller of the 2 rooms and assigned our son the larger one! 2 days later, we got a fraud notification from the bank that issued our Hyatt credit card. A fraudulent charge was placed in New Jersey. We called the Hyatt General Manager to inform her that the ONLY time we had used this card in the last 4 months was when we checked in to her hotel. The GM was superficially polite but repeated to insist we contact the bank card issuer to resolve the issue - we had already done that. She completely missed the point. Our concern was that one of Hyatt’s employees had most likely stolen our information and committed a crime. We specifically asked the GM what she intended to do about this possibility. She made a rather bland statement about conducting an internal investigation. Her nonchalance did not convince us of her sincerity, so we have subsequently escalated this to the attention of both our credit card issuer and Hyatt corporate.

title: Not a four star hotel
text: Poor value for the money. Floors in bedroom and bathroom were dirty and dusty with the grime sticking to the bottom of my feet and socks. Corners had accumulated grey dirt in the corners. Used my towels to clean the floors which should never have to be done in any hotel. The sink was inadequately cleaned but the shower appeared ok. Paper cups and tiny toiletries with very poor quality hand towels ( not satisfactory for any hotel let alone a four star property) led to disappointment in my $500/ night stay. The terrace was very nice but the furniture was dirty, both chairs and tables. The one above average item was the bed. Comfortable.

title: Quality of service has declined
text:
My business partners and I (usually around 8 rooms) pass thru NYC 4 or 5 times a year for 3 to 4 nights. This hotel was always our "go to". I think we will move on. 

The rooms are small which is absolutely fine but not when management refuses to clean the rooms.  A small room not made up, not refreshed with clean towels, not swept... toilet and sink left dirty for multiple days with garbage accumulated in shopping bags and no replaced coffee or creamers... simply, makes me feel disgusting. I even offered to pay extra for a room refresh and staff said no. After complaining again they said they would do me a favor and put me on the to clean list but I came back to a room that hadn't been serviced.

A few other annoyances to briefly mention:
-Seems to be understaffed as compared to previous trips. I never had the time to wait at front desk for service.
-Only one elevator out of two working on more than one visit. 15 min backup to get into a packed elevator.

On a good note staff is generally very nice. This is a management issue. Staff does their best.

I am a seasoned business traveler and never expect perfection, just functionality. This experience was unacceptable and below even that reasonable expectation.

title: okay
text: not worth the money. for the price it is just not great. the staff seems uninterested. I probably willl not eb staying again. I didnt get the room that I wanted and the fact that the rooms get cleaned every 4 days is pitiful

title: Great location, but the hotel needs to pay  attention to service
text: The hotel location is excellent, the decor is not really what I would have chosen for a hotel that aims to be high quality but that is a matter of taste. The room and the bathroom were clean and in good shape. But what made this a disappointing experience was the poor service. They didn't clean the room, the phone didn't work, so to order room service I had to go to the lobby, they sent the food (expensive food from the restaurant) in cardboard boxes, without cutlery so I had to go to the lobby again to claim them. The restaurant is good, I would recommend it. But I doubt that I will come back to this hotel. The person in the front desk tried to help, at least.

title: stay here every time
text: I stay here every time I come to New York. It is clean and dependable, The service was not the best like I had in the past. They would not let me put use my loyalty card for points. I will stay here again, but hopefully let me use my loyalty card.

title: Cleaning every 4 days?!
text:
Room rates are $400+ for one person per night in a no frills room. $35 amenity fee, in addition to rate.   Zero COVID restrictions in all of NYC. Only after you check in do you get a piece of paper stating that, due to COVID, housekeeping provided once every 4 days. They’ll drop towels outside the room if you need them, or you can go to the front desk to get the 2 bottles of water included in the $35 daily fee.  Room service, which is (as with every hotel) very expensive, is available. Anything that brings additional revenue to the hotel is apparently immune from concern about COVID. Any services traditionally included in the room rate or mandatory fees? Sorry, no can do.  Seriously?  

This is nothing but greed and the choice not to be transparent with guests during the reservation process is deceptive.

title: Overall a Nice Property
text: Rooms were clean and the breakfast served on site was very good. Our only problem was that our room wasn't cleaned/serviced as we had requested.  Towels were provided after a call and, the next morning, same for coffee. Staff at the front desk were nice/professional.

title: What a dump!
text: I was fully appalled at how…janky this room was for over $500 a night! Zero attention to detail, cheap furnishings, worn and shabby, terrible products…it felt more like a motel than an expensive hotel.

title: Union Square Satisfaction
text: This hotel and all of its amenities make a trip to NYC worth every penny. The front desk staff are helpful and kind and the bar and restaurant are exquisite. Stay here and explore the local flavors or just stroll around the corner to The Strand Bookstore. Right in the heart of NYC without the pretentiousness of Times Square.

title: The worst hotel I have ever dealt with anywhere.
text: I was charged $1360 by this hotel even though I did not stay there. They charged me for 2 rooms when I reserved one room. They would not discuss their error but insisted they be paid. You cannot trust the manager at this hotel. If the owner of this hotel endorses the manager I warn you not to stay there. There are much better hotels in the same neighborhood with much better service and staff.

title: Hyatt Union Square
text: We had a fantastic stay at Hyatt Union Square , excellent location and the hotel was in excellent condition, very nice staff, reception, concierge , Highly recommend Hyatt Union Square to any travelers to NYC

title: Under staffed, under maintained
text: I want to love this hotel because the location is perfect, but management doesn't seem to understand how much they are damaging this hotels reputation. They are painfully understaffed, and I've never stayed here without a significant maintenance issue. I come back because of the location although I am searching for new options. I'd really look for other options it's not what you'd expect from a Hyatt.

title: Friendly abs accommodating
text: Everyone was very accommodating and friendly from reservation to check in to check out. My only negative thoughts are confusion related to the fees that are on top of the room rate and taxes. But the rooms were clean and lovely and the staff was great!

title: Great location, good staff
text:
It's hard to beat the Union Square location! The hotel is convenient, beds are comfortable. Staff is always very friendly and helpful (but they don't have a concierge and sometimes are not very knowledgeable). It's relatively quiet on the courtyard side even if neighbours can be a very noisy.
I find the adjacent restaurant, Bowery road, isn't as good as it used to be.
Gym is also a bit outdated.
Overall, still a good experience!

title: Go somewhere else, horrible
text:
One of the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Started from check in with unpleasant and unresponsive staff then continued with a freezing room with no working heat when outside temperatures were in the 20s, no response to several requests for toilet paper,  no room cleaning for 4 nights ("COVID" excuse when the pandemic is no longer at it's peak but about to be classified as endemic and the mask mandate expired in NYC) to guest services not answering the phone.
Oh, and wait until you see the small room size and weird bathroom that has no separation from the room and therefore offers no privacy.
I will never stay in this facility again especially since there are significantly better hotels who are cheaper and better located in the vicinity.

title: Great location with very welcoming staff. very clean
text:
Great hotel with nice sized rooms - we appreciated how clean everything was and how nice and accommodating the staff was. The valet parking cost was very reasonable for the city. 

Easy walk to department stores and shops. Centrally located to both the East and West Village - Union Square is beautiful!

title: Great hotel, friendly staff
text: This is a solid hotel in a great Union Square location. The staff is always very friendly and accommodating. There's a restaurant and a bar right onsite, but there are also plenty of dining options nearby.

title: Glass In the Bed
text: I went to my room to find make-up on my sheets (which I do not wear) and glass in the bed. The front desk was so polite and accommodating and did everything in their power to try and make right on the issues I faced. The person who called me was (not front desk I believe they were head of housekeeping was obnoxious and accused me of making up everything while yelling at me over the phone. WILL never stay at a Hyatt again which is a shame considering how sweet the front desk workers were.

title: Do not trust this property.
text: This hotel made an error in making the reservation. This hotel is very rigid and not willing to correct the error. The main office of Hyatt could nor help me because this hotel is a franchise. You have no protection in dealing with  this unreasonable management at this hotel.

title: Weekend stay in Union Sq
text: Personal trip for the weekend with a friend.  The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating but our room did not have any heat when we arrived.
