We had put in a request and we’re told it would be fixed within the hour while we were out.  When we came back that night 8 hours later we had to change rooms after being told it was fixed but it was not at 3:00 am.

title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
text:
The hotel is located on Fourth Ave and 13th street so close to the East Village and also Chelsea, Grammercy and Greenwich Village. The Union Sq subway is a block away.

The front desk staff and bartender were great.  Super helpful and friendly.  

Also this hotel has a restaurant and bar that is open unlike the W or other hotels in the area.

title: Nice place
text:
Rooms are pretty. Windows open a few inches for fresh air & city noises. No seperated bathroom. Toilet has a door, but thin. Water pressure not great. No ice machines. Had requested a mini fridge when I booked on-line, wasn't there on arrival. Was told it would be brought up but never was. Hours later when I asked the front desk they said I could switch rooms if I wanted one, which is weird... Why not just bring it to the room I was in? Ended up getting  a bucket of ice instead. They give you a card with a # on it to text if you need anything, but I was just trying to ask while I was already standing there. 
Also, wasn't told about the 3rd party, $65/day valet fee. Word to the wise, there's a parking garage across the street, probably much cheaper to do it yourself & have access to your car...& Not wait a half hour for valet at checkout. Would still go back again though. Was my 2nd stay there. Stayed in room 812 & could see the top of the empire state building.

title: decline of Hyatt
text: maybe it's a COVID staff shortage issue but our recent stay at the Hyatt on Union Square in NYC was lacking  -  1) check in delay of several hours, 2) lack of cleanliness - wastebaskets were not emptied and floors were dirty, 3) absent light fixtures in room (we compared as we booked two rooms), 4) overcharge - double charge on credit card we are disputing.

title: Exceptional
text: Love the rooms in this hotel. Very chic design making excellent use of available space. Bed was heavenly. Homedic white noise device near bed. Coffee maker stored under nightstand. Refrigerator discreetly enclosed by the stand alone dresser. Separate toilet from shower/bath and vanity area. Desk had SEVERAL ports and electrical sockets. Loved it. WILL DEFINITELY RETURN.

title: Nice stay!
text:
I needed to visit NYC for a followup appointment for a surgery that I received last summer. I arrived at the property on Monday the week before Christmas and stayed for two nights.

The room was indeed small as others pointed out, but nicely equipped. I arrived off of a red eye from LAX and after a baggage fiasco, didn't get to the hotel until around noon. The did have a room available for me at this time, which was amazing. I instantly attempted to take a shower, but after about 30 seconds, the fire alarm started blaring. I assumed it was some building-wide event, but it was actually only in my room, and brought on by the steam from the shower! Kind of crazy. I was happy that they were able to move me to a different room, but I was warned that this is a problem the hotel has in general. Luckily, this didn't re-occur in the second room I was given. Besides for the shower fire alarm, my only other criticism that the hotel could somewhat easily address is the TV situation. The TVs seemed on the small side and the TV / entertainment console was this weird plastic material. It looked like it was taken from a Carnival cruise ship from 2002, definitely in need of an upgrade. Only other gripe is that Delta lost one of my bags. Unbeknownst to me, it was delivered at 9:00 pm on my second night. Since it had my name on it, it would've been easy for the staff to look up my reservation and give me a ring, but no such effort was made.

I really appreciated the fact that the hotel had a hot tea and coffee stand setup in the lobby. Additionally, my Globalist status awarded me breakfast coupons that I could use in the restaurant. It was so nice to be able to wake up and have a fresh, hot breakfast and tasty coffee in the onsite restaurant. After two nights at this hotel, I moved to what was supposed to be a more luxe hotel uptown (Conrad Midtown) and even they couldn't provide these things for me! Bravo Hyatt! I didn't get the chance to checkout the cool bar / distillery attached to the hotel, but I'd like to in the future. And of course, the hotel's location in Union Square is fabulous. I paid around $250/night and for the quality and location of the hotel, I thought that was very fair. I'd definitely return!

title: Great location and wonderful staff
text: The hotel was very nice.  It has a terrific location in NYC.  What really makes the hotel great is the attentive and friendly staff.  Really helpful and friendly!  I would highly recommend the Hyatt Union Square for your next visit to NYC.  There is a fun Christmas market in Union Square (in spring and summer there are other stands set up on the weekends), and there are lots of great restaurants in the area.

title: Standards dropped drastically
text: We visit this hotel several times each year and this time we noticed standards in several areas much lower. For example cleanliness in room specifically dusty corners and edges, bedding barely fit the bed and we had ine sheet that was stained and another that was ripped.

title: Don't go to this hotel.
text:
tiny room near the elevator shaft couldn't sleep,   
tiny hanging closet not sufficient for 2 people. shower didn't look clean. 
overpriced, for $500 dollars a night there is better value in union square area.

title: Great full service hotel neat union square
text: We’ve stayed at the Hyatt union square twice and enjoyed our stay both times. Fantastic location. Rooms are clean, good sized, and comfortable. I ate at the outdoor restaurant once and the food was delicious,

title: Meh
text: Initially when we arrived the room appeared clean and we were pleased.  then multiple things happened.  The phone didn't work to call front desk, under the coffee pot was filthy from spilled coffee, the refrigerator didn't seem to work, the lighted makeup mirror didn't work, the handle to the shower fell off when my husband turned the water on and there was only one tissue in the tissue box.  All of these things were not a big deal if it was the only item, but collectively made us frustrated.  We were there for 5 days beginning Dec 1 to see our son.  We had upgraded the room to a city view and the total cost of our room was $3277.  When we approached the front desk to correct the items they were apologetic and quick to have the items resolved.  The crew that fixed or brought items were helpful and polite.  All and all the stay was good but I think that better attention to detail should be made.  In addition to all of this, I had checked in on line which i liked.  However, my requests were not met and front desk addressed those.  Also for some reason they checked me in twice and so funds on my card were doubled resulting in a declined payment at a restaurant.  I didn't realize this error until checking out and they asked about my second room.  We did not receive a discount on our room.  However, they refunded us in points. We generally don't stay at a Hyatt affiliated hotel (usually Hilton) so I'm not sure those points will be used.  Gave 3 stars because everything was addressed quickly and efficiently.  Staff is very friendly.

title: Overpriced, dated, and dumpy
text:
I really hate to ever write a bad review but this property was so disappointing, I feel it is justified. I stay in 15 or so  hotels a year and to be blunt, this was among the worst experiences I've had in quite some time. I infrequently stay in Hyatt-branded properties so as a "new customer", this place definitely left me with a bad impression of the brand.

I will admit, the location of this hotel is excellent, one of the best in the whole city, but that's where most of my praise begins and ends. I arrived around 4 pm to a long check-in line and a front desk that would sit completely unmanned for the first 20 minutes of my wait. After finally getting to the front, I was told ny the agent that  the hotel double-charged me for tax and I had to wait another 20 minutes while she had to remove the excess charge. Why this would take that long was not explained but ok whatever, it happens. For my troubles, I was offered a very generous (not) bottle of water.

For this one-night December weekend stay, I paid just about $700 for a "Junior Suite" which was admittedly a generously-sized room with a comfortable bed and separate seating area but was otherwise pretty run-down and neither adequately cleaned nor maintained. Worn furniture, dusty fixtures and general grime were present all over the room and the condition of the bathroom wasn't much better. The toilet handle was broken, the grout in various areas was a color it should not have been, and the vanity was in quite rough shape. Not to mention, this 3rd floor room (which was the "best [they] could do" despite me checking in just about on-time), offered no view and was incredibly loud, both of which are not dealbreakers, it is New York, but again, at this price point...

I very much feel for the staff here as everyone I interacted with were clearly trying their best, and I recognize the present labor difficulties, but the issues at this property were well-beyond what has become the norm. Calls to front desk went unanswered, in-person requests to desk, including waiting in line to speak to staff, not fulfilled, and messages to the "text line" were responded to with more of the same (not). Just one example, I needed an extra blanket which took me asking in person at the desk twice, a text to the text line, an attempt of a call to the desk (unanswered), another in-person visit to the desk, until finally I found a maintenance crew member in the hallway and he fulfilled my request. This is unacceptable at any price point, but $700 it is beyond so.

I could go on, but in sum I'd be incredibly disappointed with my stay, regardless of price, but considering the exorbitant cost I paid to stay here, I feel totally ripped off. This whole experience definitely has soured my taste for the whole Hyatt brand.

title: overpriced
text: Good location but small overpriced room to the point that the bathroom was not separated. It was inside the bedroom with the sink looking over the bed. It would be impossible to fit 2 people in that room. Yet costs $600 before taxes.

title: Hotel Room Clean - Issues with Non-Masking
text: The room was very clean.  The front desk personnel were very helpful. The only issues I had was the lobby was heavily packed with most not wearing masks - even if not mandatory, it made us uncomfortable. The valet man was sneezing without a mask as he handed our keys to us, and then sneezed again following us outside.

title: Welcome home!
text:
I have stayed at this hotel many times before, and I plan to stay with them in the future. When you first walk into the lobby, you feel you are home. Let me explain. 

The young lady who assisted me was very friendly, polite, and professional. She welcomed me, smiled quite a lot, and chatted with me like I just got home from work. And so, I felt the warmth and peaceful from her. Just like I just walked in my front door. 

The upgrade I got because of being an “Explorist”, one of their 3-tier memberships, was very nice. Instead of the view of the surrounding buildings, I got the city view. 

I was there for three nights, and I did get a lot of rest after walking around the city in the daytime. Their housekeeping was great too.

title: Easy, wonderful stay
text:
Wonderful stay, again! Easy process, CoVid “safe”, appreciated the staff wearing their masks. 

Only concern is the shower water is extremely hot—it is too hot and a potential danger to children. 
Location is excellent. Valet parking worked beautifully.

title: Great Location....  Not a great experienc
text:
Were there for 5 nights for fun over Thanksgiving.   Great location, easy to get around, room clean, would agree a bit understaffed but that's pretty much what you get these days so no real beef there.

One  sizeable issue..  3 of the 5 nights our lights in our room just came on for no reason..  All the lights.. One night 3 am then again at 7 am.  Another night once at 2 am.   Another night 5 am..   Literally, sound asleep and the entire room lit up.

Obviously went and complained..  Didn't happen one night after the first two so thought they had fixed..  Nope..  4th night on they came again..  

No explanation.    Pretty much sucked.

Second issue was the bar..   Looked great, has lots of fancy liquor on fancy shelves.  Should be great.    Had probably the two worst mixed cocktails I've ever had one night so didn't go back.  Really slow, bartenders standing around talking to each other but not doing a lot.

So..  Great location, clean, would have had zero issues (and probably will stay there again because of the location) if the lights hadn't keep coming on for no reason.  

As mentioned, they didn't fix it.  I called Expedia who I booked through.  They called the hotel and said they weren't treated very well on the phone.  Hotel offered to remove the destination fee from my bill..  I asked for a free night out of the five nights..  They won.

title: Hyatt union square
text: Good location and good service at a reasonable price. My visit was 3 nights and I found it to be very comfortable at a reasonable price. Very efficient and friendly staff. I enjoyed the morning coffee in my room.

title: Great stay!
text: Small room but expected this in NY. Not a fan of the “open bathroom” concept but the shower had great water pressure! Location is excellent! Subway stop 2 minute walk. Would definitely come back to this hotel!

title: Understaffed and Overpriced
text: The hotel is nice enough and we’ll located, but it is chronically understaffed leading to extremely long lines in the lobby during check-in and check-out hours. Our room wasn’t ready for check-in until after 6pm. We waited 20+ Minutes for the hotel valet parking for both drop off and pickup. The room rate isn’t justified even without all these compromises.

title: Nice property and nice room
text: Not my favorite bathroom design - no counter to put things on, but otherwise a nice hotel stay. Hotel and room were very clean and roomy. I would stay here again. Did not eat at the hotel, so cannot rate the food.

title: STAY AWAY
text: An absolutely horrific experience from beginning to end. Never again. No staff to be found anywhere. Staff that had no clue what they were doing. Phones not working. Wi-Fi down. Nobody ever present at the front desk. No Covid restrictions being enforced. Security only present once in a while and not attending to the elevator as is their job. No valet as advertised. A COMPLETE CIRCUS SHOW of fumbling, inadequate ridiculous experiences.  NEVER AGAIN will I stay at this Hyatt and maybe not any Hyatts again.

title: weekend stay
text:
Front desk employee who checked us in was rude and practically ignored us, not helpful.
The sheets were stained and we could not get a hold of housekeeping, room service or front desk the entire trip.

title: Location location location
text:
Comfortable and safe hotel in a great location of NYC close to Union Square.
Meets and exceeds all Hyatt standards with a nice local "boutiquey" feel.
We stayed three nights in a King room on an upper floor with a city view. Quiet and comfortable.
Price is reasonable during the week. However, a little pricey for a weekend stay....
Easy access to all NYC has to offer. Overall, reasonable stay if they keep the prices affordable.

title: Rude staff.
text: The hotel accommodations were fine, but there was an employee in the lobby who was condescending and rude. The person who checked me in at the desk was courteous, but the doorman (whomever was hovering in the lobby) was very disrespectful to my friends who came to meet me in the lobby and who were trying to ask him a couple of questions.

title: Very good stay
text:
Had a very good stay last weekend with pleasant and helpful staff. Room and service exceeded expectations and strongly suggest this hotel.
The location was even better due to proximity to many things in the city.

title: We were up in the city for some shopping - this hotel was very convenient to our stops.
text: The hotel was very quiet for being in the middle of such a busy area.  We didn't hear any street noise from our room.  We had a great view of the city.  The room was large enough and clean.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  The hotel was modern in its appointments in the lobby and the room, but it wasn't one of those hotels people over 50 can't see in due to bad lighting.  I've stayed in plenty of them!

title: Hotel suffers from deferred maintenance!
text: I have stayed at this hotel previously and used to enjoy my stays.  My most recent stay has convinced me that it is time to find a new hotel in New York. My first night, I was awakened by a dripping noise and discovered water dripping from the ceiling onto the floor.  The engineer identified two leaks coming from pipes in the ceiling but was unable to fix them, so I requested another room. The second night, I was awakened by the toilet running intermittently all night. When I mentioned it the next morning, the front desk clerk just said that she would make a note of the running toilet.

title: NO HOUSEKEEPING service!!!!
text:
Checked in yesterday. Just got back to our room. NO HOUSEKEEPING - bed undone as we left it. Asked front desk they forgot to tell me at check in that due to COVID housekeeping was scaled  down. You get room cleaned at 3rd day. I was not warned at the time I reserved. I am paying  a FULL RATE. Asked front desk -
Housekeeping is done for the day, nothing they can do for me. I would accept this had I been warned at time I reserved or checked in. COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE   Called HYATT main number - keeps getting disconnected. Considering moving to another hotel tomorrow AM. This hotel is not worth the amount of money it charges a night.

title: Poor room quality for price
text: The room was tired & dirty. Additionally, we needed the sofa bed made up which they didn’t do until the 2nd night despite multiple requests. At one point they actually asked if we brought our own sheets. The staff is nice, but seem over their head. Definitely not worth the price. There are much nicer hotels in their range. The location is excellent, but that’s its best feature. Would not recommend.

title: Bait and switch with the parking
text: We were told by the reservation phone number at Hyatt to park at a certain garage.  When we checked in, the check in person told us that our garage would be taken care of but when we checked out, they told us we would have to pay for the parking.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: We had an absolutely amazing experience at this hotel. The staff went above and beyond, our room was perfect, the hotel is in great condition, the location was super. The restaurant and bar connected to this hotel were also incredible. We felt like we were home and the staff felt like family. Also - having valet parking was dreamy. Thank you so very much! We will be back.

title: Severely understaffed
text: Great location. Fairly priced. Always a wait at the front desk. Uneven housekeeping. Never refilled coffee pods. Rooms are well-equipped with ample charging outlets, storage and a fridge. Friendly staff. Carolyn is a star!

title: Lousy Service / Over priced
text: The hotel skimped on cleaning citing Covid and wanted to clean the room every 3 days - requested for alternate day at least - that was agreed but they did not stick to that either. When I requested they point blank refused. The room is severely over priced small little hole in the wall no amenities and cramped. The only positive was the location. But experience was terrible.

title: Terrible guest response, but still a nice hotel
text:
I stayed here for a weekend vacation in early October. I booked the hotel because I was going to a concert two nights in a row (Fri & Sat) at Webster Hall, and the hotel was right around the corner. The artist I was going to see tore his vocal chords a week before the shows and had to cancel his remaining concerts for 2021.

I called the hotel as soon as I found out to see if I could cancel the reservation, but it turns out I booked a non-refundable rate. I explained the situation and offered to pay a cancelation fee. They said it would be up to the GM and he/she would get in touch with me. I NEVER HEARD BACK FROM THE GM, even though they confirmed my contact info (email & cell) before the call ended.

They stuck to their policy of not refunding a non-refundable rate, which is understandable, but at least give me the courtesy of responding if you say you are going to get back in touch with me. The following info was also shared during my conversation with the hotel. I'm a single father with two kids and I try to budget out for both adult and family vacations. This trip was a birthday gift to myself and I was traveling by myself. I was going to see one of my favorite artists, I had never seen him live, and there was no chance I was going to try to cancel had he been healthy. Given all these circumstances, I thought they would at least try to work with me to resolve the matter, but I never heard back from the GM.

It's NYC, so of course I still had an amazing time, and my experience with the hotel and it's staff during my stay was superb. I just wish the hotel/GM would have worked with me so I could have saved the money and used it for the next time he is touring, because that was the primary reason for my trip.

title: Big disappointment
text:
No security. Watched patrons of lounge sneaking onto elevator while staff had backs turned. No amenities. Hyatt loyalist but really missed the mark on this stay. No cups. 
Poorly designed bathroom, no where to put belongings.
Not much drawer or closet space.
Birthday celebration, really disappointed.
View was of Walgreens.

title: Tiny and loud rooms, inadequate cleaning service, but friendly staff
text: The rooms are very small even by New York City standards. Also, you could hear the subway and a strange beeping all night long. They don't change linens or clean the room until the third night "because of Covid," but every other hotel I've stayed at in New York recently does, so this policy is outdated and annoying. We asked for our room to be cleaned and for new linen after the second night but they didn't accommodate. The staff was very friendly however. Even so, stay elsewhere.

title: One of the best
text:
It was so nice to come back to this hotel after an involuntary break that lasted far longer than anticipated. It was so nice to see a few familiar faces as well as happy new ones and once again stay at one of my favorite hotels on this planet. 

The location is great, the staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Couldn’t ask for moreZ

title: Best staff ever, especially Lea
text: We stayed here for 3 weeks in September during move-in for our boys to college. Before we even got here, Lea helped arrange transportation pick up from/to the airport and was super friendly, making it easy to feel comfortable as we checked in, like we already knew her. The location was the best! Very close to my son's dorm and lots of places to eat. Next door is a great drop off laundry that we used quite frequently during our 3 weeks. The room was a bit small but despite that we managed to be comfortable. Both Lea and Anton were extremely helpful with everything, from getting us ice every day, to suggesting great restaurants, helping with directions, etc.  On our last night, we found out our flight got cancelled, we were stressing with re-booking and Lea was so helpful to reassure that there was room to stay another night.  We felt very safe here, so much that I'm coming back alone next month and can't imagine staying anywhere else.  Thank you so much Lea for making our stay special. Her friendly, upbeat, can-do attitude was a warm welcome. The only thing I was disappointed in was the restaurant did not have much selection nor any good vegetarian options.

title: Just a quick visit
text: Great location. The Strand book store is around the corner. Public transit is near. And multiple restaurants were relatively nearby. Even though the hotel is on a busy street our room was quiet. The staff were very helpful.

title: Outstanding service
text:
We stayed a week at the end of August to move our son into college.  The room was very comfortable.  The location was great, central to many places and subways.  At night, your room key is required to get into the main entrance after a certain time.  We appreciated that security feature.

The best part was the staff.  Carolyn and Lea happened to be on shift whenever we needed assistance.  They went up and beyond what was needed to help us with some very unusual situations.  We had a number of packages shipped to the hotel prior to and during our stay.  Carolyn dug them out from the storage room for us each time.  When we needed to return some of the items, Carolyn and Lea found the original box we discarded, and gave us some stuffing and packing tape to use without me having to ask.  Everyday, Carolyn, Lea and the other 2 front desk staff kept us well-stocked with bottle of water whenever we needed it.  They were always pleasant and patient.  We would definitely stay at Hyatt Union Square in the future.

title: Will always stay here!
text: I stayed at the Hyatt in Union Square for many nights while I helped my daughter move. The staff was always very helpful! It was so great coming back each night to a clean room! This will continue to be my ‘home away from home’.

title: The staff...
text:
Okay, so this is my second review of this property this year and I'm a bit late with the review since our visit was a couple of weeks ago..  The mid-town location near NYU is prefect for us.  The rooms are small but nice and have sound machines to hide 3rd traffic, true black out blinds to let you sleep in, and are updated. 

But, the real reason to visit this property is the staff.  I can't say enough about them, they are the real deal when it comes to making you're stay as enjoyable as it can be.

title: Positive review mainly for location
text: If you need to be located between East and West Greenwich Village, this hotel location is perfect.  Alas, front desk service lacking.  After full day of travel arrived to check in at 3.30PM Blond lady at front desk said room not ready, would send a text when available. We left to walk around in very hot and humid weather until 5PM and still no text. We returned to hotel to find out that previous guests had late 4PM checkout and room was still not ready. Our entire first day was shot.  We would have happily accepted another room if we had been told about the late checkout so that we could have checked in upon arrival. We were not told that housekeeping was not automatic but had to be requested. We were not told that coffee was available every morning in the lobby. Last, but not least, we paid extra for a high floor room only to find that it came with a bathroom sink and faucet that barely had enough room to fit your hands under the faucet before hitting the bottom of the sink. Comical.TV had no access to major network channels.  Luckily we only stayed four nights; the additional fees and taxes almost doubled the room cost.

title: Overall Okay
text: The room was pretty nice overall and the location is great. The pillowcases in the room were badly stained when I arrived however. Also, the two advertised bottles of water upon arrival were never given or offered to me.

title: Perfect Location in NYC
text: I stayed here while moving my daughter into her Gramercy Place apartment. It’s the perfect location close to shopping (Container Store, Bed Bath Beyond) and Gramercy/East Village. Room was very clean and staff was most helpful and welcoming. I was traveling solo and felt very safe at the hotel. I will definitely stay here again for future visits!

title: Great Location, Great Service
text: Beautiful Part of NYC.  Solid Hotel.  Great Location.  When we first arrived, we were concerned that the AC was not cooling properly.  Guest services immediately sent an Engineer named Sheldon.  He was professional and efficient.  Solved the problem and contacted us to make sure everything was working properly.  This was a common experience with the staff.  Very friendly and responsive to any question or need.  The hotel is next to Union Square and University Hall at NYU.  I would stay here again.

title: It is great
text:
I spend one week every year in this beautiful hotel. the rooms are perfect and very clean. As per NYC standards are above the average. The restaurant is perfect, and the staff is just AMAZING. 

See you again soon.
A presto, Luca

title: What a gem in a great location!
text: Stayed here primarily to move my daughter into her dorm but ended up absolutely loving this hotel. It’s in an excellent location close to union square park and many subway lines. Lots of restaurants, drugstores and grocery stores steps away. The room was clean, comfortable and modern. The staff were friendly and welcoming and treated you like VIP. Especially really appreciated Anton who was kind and so helpful with anything you may need. It just really felt like home here. We will definitely be back.

title: Great Customer Service these folks always say "yes we can"
text:
We stayed 4 nights and with every request we had immediate response and quick action by the staff.  Carolyn at the front desk was exceptional from our initial greeting and check in all the way through our stay!   
We had a great stay and since we dropped off our student at Parsons we will certainly be coming back again over the years.  Nice to know we have a great place to stay near the campus.
Love NYC!

title: Great hotel in great location.
text: While this may be a bit pricey, you will stay in a clean hotel that is well maintained and staffed by people who understand customer service.  High-up rooms have nice views. I would stay here again if in the area.

title: Our new fave go-to in NYC!
text: Damn, what can I say, my wife and pup Dwight tried this place out for what started as a 3-night stay that ended uo being almost 3 weeks. We have stayed all over this great city...But This Is our new fave spot, in our favroite area to boot! First off...Lea & Anton?! Can you say any more? These two (and others we'll shout out soon) welcomed us with such genuine warmth and friendliness  it was incredible. This place became our new home, we had so much fun and the accomodations were spot-on . Plus, Carolyn & Daniel and everyone were great we already have plans to return in November.

title: Clean & Enjoyable
text: Checking in and checking out was a breeze. Good customer service. Felt very safe and employees were very helpful - overall a good experience. Very good location. Easy to get around. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Back to NYC !
text: Great location with nice rooms, very helpful staff and more. From the front desk help who clued me into the water stash, to the ease of adding Hyatt Rewards to the bar staff with their excellent cocktails (thanks for the Green Spot and Yellow Spot recommendations, as well as for the old school bartender who kept my glass full and put up with the noise of me telling stories to an old friend) this was a great step back towards normal. Thank you !

title: Great Service!
text: The hotel common areas and room was very nice and clean. Was also centrally located! Carolyn at the front desk was so accommodating and went above and beyond to make our stay great. We will definitely be back :)

title: great location with excellent service
text: Very pleased with the location of the hotel, the size of the view, and the friendliness of the staff. Our room had a king-size bed and a lovely view of the city. It was clean and quiet. The staff at the front desk went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. In particular, Daniel and Carolyn were the best. I didn't catch the bartenders' names at the in-house distillery spot, but they were also very accomodating. There are many things right outside the hotel such as the subway, Walgreens, shopping, and excellent food. We loved Ruby's, just a few blocks away.

title: manhattan stay
text: very good location and good value for the money.  Location was close to attractions, transit and apartment of family i was visiting.  The bar was little bit overrated and little disappointed.  I didn't try the restuarant

title: New York Overnight
text: The Hyatt at Union Square is our go to hotel when we come to Manhattan. The staff is friendly and professional. The hotel is very well situated for walks to shops, restaurants, and parks. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Best hotel for seeing everything in Lower Manhattan
text: This is the second time I have stayed here and I liked it even more this time. Perfect location to explore Soho, East and West Village, Chinatown etc. Convenient to subways to explore all of New York.  The staff really makes this hotel. The front office  managers Lea and Anton are so friendly and caring. They both go out of their way to make the guests feel comfortable, and safe. true professionals…don’t let these two leave!

title: Overall great hotel
text:
The hotel was all that we expected and more. The staff is very accommodating and responsive.  Rooms are cozy but you have to expect that in NYC. 
 The location is perfect for walkability to so much.  We found so many great restaurants within a 15 minute walk.  Being close to Union Square on a weekend was a bonus - farmer's market on Saturday and great music ensemble on Sunday.

title: Lovely NYC Hotel
text: This is a great hotel—first-class accommodations great restaurant and bar, and helpful, friendly staff (Carolyn was the best).  The location is even better for exploring NYC!  Will definitely stay here whenever we return to the city.  Thank you Hyatt Union Square for making our trip amazing.

title: Excellent Stay at Hyatt Union Square New York
text: My stay at the Hyatt Union Square New York was very pleasant.  Terrific customer service.  The attendant covering the front desk each morning was helpful and addressed all my questions offering directions and alternative restaurants for breakfast.  My room was very comfortable .  Hyatt has implemented procedures to address safety during Covid.  I felt safe at at all times.  I recommend  Hyatt Union Square.

title: A weekend away
text:
Very nice boutique style chain hotel. We were surprised. Small, very welcoming lobby with terrific staff.
The elevators didn't gong on every floor, nice touch.
The hallways were clean and quiet.
The room was small but very boutique-like and comfortable.
Bathroom is small and is part of the room, not separated by a door, but had everything we needed.
Room was very clean and we had the room cleaned and fresh towels daily, unlike other hotels.
Very satisfied, we will stay there again.

title: Not worth the price right now!!!!
text: NYC is not fully open and functioning like it was before COVID, but I was traveling with a pet so my choices of places to stay were limited. Despite the fact, the Hyatt did not reach out to me before my stay to tell me that there amenities (Restaurants, food service, valet-parking) which is listed on there website as available WAS NOT available at all, So why am I paying to stay where I am and not compensated for there short-comings on the situation, simply to just be understanding for the inconvenience. I am an easy going person and understand the Pandemic has changed things everywhere but obviously corporate America doesn’t see it that way. The staff was as nice as they could be despite seeing the same concerns. Maybe in a year I can come back with a 5-star rating but for now, be advised.

title: For the price - an absolute rip off!
text:
The hotel is in a great location and the staff were friendly - other than that this is a very basic hostel-type hotel; fine if your a kid accustomed to staying in hostels or cheap hotels.
Booking the hotel, via phone, took more that 45 minutes.  It seems that Hyatt does not offer to call you back if you'd prefer not to wait 45 minutes.  And they refuse to say why not.
After a long difficult drive we arrived at the hotel to be told - for the first time - that the hotel had no on-site parking and no valet parking. They told us that the "service" they offered was "self parking" three blocks away and half a block down.
A night cap was not an option after dining out.  The bar closed at 10:00 and they no longer offer in room mini-bar. And they refuse to say why.
What happens at the hotel looks good only when compared by the shoddy response offered by the corporate head office whose philosophy can best be summed up as "ignore them - they'll go away".  And go away we will.  Never to return to any Hyatt property.  An absolute rip off!

title: Fantastic service
text: Carolyn and Lea were an absolute delight and went absolutely above and beyond during our stay. They were so attentive and helpful; Carolyn often provided us with complimentary gifts of food and consistently asked us about how she could improve our stay. We came to move my daughter out of the city and they helped us get a car that could fit all of her luggage to the airport, and loaded it into the car for us!! We had an amazing stay with them and highly recommend anyone else to stay here!

title: Amazing hotel in a great location
text: Exceptionally clean hotel, great location, options to walk for food and tourist attractions, access to public transportation, fitness room has top-notch equipment, staff is friendly and helpful 24/7, would stay here again.

title: Mediocre hotel
text: This is strictly a hotel for younger travelers, guys, or budget travelers. The decor is cheesy and everything is gray or cork. It's very masculine. My room was dusty and the hallway carpets were vile.The front desk help was disorganized and the computer was down. There was an overall sense from staff of being overwhelmed.

title: Clean, but limited service hotel
text: Although the hotel was in a decent location, walking distance Little Italy and shopping, the majority of the lobby was closed, the restaurant was only open for dinner until 845pm & breakfast was a muffin  and grocery store yogurt in a box delivered without utensils.. Based on the pricey $500/night price, I would have expected more premium options for better service as NYC is now open.

title: Summer Trip to NYC
text: The staff at this hotel are excellent and very attentive.  The room was very functional, modern, and clean. The location is hard to beat.  While it would have been great to have daily housekeeping, we understood the need to keep contacts down.  Housekeeping was only on Saturdays.

title: Comfortable, convenient
text: Staff was amazing, location was great, room was a little small for myself and my teenage kids but it was clean.  I would definitely stay there again but get 2 separate rooms.  No room service due to Covid so I missed that.  Overall excellent stay.  Would book it again because the staff was just amazing!

title: Excellent hotel!
text: Stayed here for 3 nights while visiting NYC. Rooms were super comfortable, nice and clean. They were also pretty quiet. Staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. This hotel is in a great location, close to so much stuff, subway is conveniently right around the corner. Hotel offered discounted parking at a parking garage just a couple of blocks away. Definitely will be staying here again and will recommend to others!

title: Perfect Short Stay
text: Stayed last minute at the Hyatt Union Square and it was absolutely ideal.  Everything from check-in to the room itself was seamless and perfect.  Staff couldn't be more accommodating.  One of my party is an extremely light sleeper so we requested a quiet room and it was as if we were in the country it was so quiet!

title: the best hotel experience in New York!
text:
I have never taken the time to review a hotel experience, but the Hyatt Union Square in New York was so unique and superb that I am posting a review on Trip Advisor. 

I also wanted to make sure that you were aware of the extraordinary team at this hotel, so here is my review: 

I have stayed in many fine hotels all over the world, but the Hyatt Union Square exceeded my expectations in every possible way. The location was safe and convenient, the lobby was spacious and comfortable, rooms were clean, my calls to the concierge were always answered promptly, the room layout was perfect, everything worked, the morning coffee was delicious, room service was prompt, hot and delicious, but most of all, the personal attention of everyone at the front desk was extraordinary. 
From Anton rushing out in the rain to hail a taxi for me, to Daniel patiently working on my reservation to Lea recommending the best restaurants in the area, it was clear that this staff knows how to run a hotel so that guests will want to come back. 
In fact, I renewed my Hyatt Membership upon leaving because I will always stay here whenever I visit New York, and my husband and I look forward to trying your other properties.

title: A Nice Hotel
text: We fell in love with this hotel, with its convenient location and pleasant environment, when we visited here four years ago. As soon as the city reopened, we redeemed all our Hyatt points for a one night stay to relive that experience. Our checkin last Sunday coincided with the pride parade. Nearby streets were closed to car traffic and jam packed with high spirited, boisterous celebrants. Tents lined the street fronting the hotel entrance making access to the lobby somewhat challenging. Our compact room was clean and comfortable.  However the overall stay experience was different this time as some hotel services and many nearby shops were not in full operation yet. To their credit, the hotel provided bottled water in our room and there was freshly brewed coffee in the lobby in the morning (something the Marriott Marquis where we stayed the previous 3 nights failed to do).

title: Exceeds Expectations!
text: Had an awesome experience. Welcoming and friendly staff who go the extra mile to make your stay better! Room was clean and modern! Would highly recommend this hotel if you’re looking for quality, and semi-budget friendly (NY standards at least) place to stay!

title: Great customer service!
text:
During my latest visit to this hotel, there was a disturbance around midnight involving a pet in the room next door to mine. I called the front desk and they assured me they would speak to the guest asap and resolve the situation.  They did just that!

The next morning, I awoke to a friendly and apologetic email and text from Daniel L. (front desk) and later had a nice conversation with him at the front desk. A few hours later, I also received a call from George G. (Housekeeping) apologizing and offering support for a future stay.  Both gentleman were customer-focused, helpful and worked to assure me that my business was appreciated and the incident was handled as well as possible. I appreciated their proactive manner and graciousness.

Previous to this incident, I had a great experience at the front desk when I was helped by Anton H..  He was also incredibly pleasant, efficient and ready to assist with any need. 

I will definitely continue to stay at this hotel and location.

title: Best updated rooms
text: This hotel has the beat customer service around!!! Yes even in NYC!! This hotel is accommodating near so many great restaurants and attractions. The bed is very comfortable and I love the bathroom with the partition giving you a studio vibe.

title: Awesome location.
text: We had a great stay at Hyatt Union Square.  We loved the location, since we prefer Lower Manhattan over Midtown.  The rooms are pretty small, but they make good use of the space.  There was no daily housekeeping.

title: Not what it used to be - management cheapening the experience
text: It's sad to see a classic deterioration of the guest experience here. The Hyatt Union Square is often charging higher rates than pre-covid right now, but delivering less and using covid as an excuse. Expecting breakfast as a hotel amenity? Well the restaurant isn't open for breakfast. Sorry, were you expecting that as a loyalty member? Nope, globalists won't eat here, but you'll be referred to Starbucks! What a treat. At least expecting a fully cleaned room? Well, they haven't restarted full housekeeping services either. Because covid. Hotel management clearly things they can just charge higher rates and provide fewer services with no consequences, but I'll be voting with my wallet and taking my future stays elsewhere.

title: Excellent Service, great location
text: Great location, comfortable & clean room. Room on 9th floor great view everything in room was in working order.  Daniel L. couldn't be more helpful from the minute we arrived till check out arranging for taxi. He went above & beyond from upgrade to accommodating an early check-in. Wife was having surgery that morning we were able to settle in before leaving for hosp.  Was very grateful, one less thing to worry about. Requested late check out if needed for post-op appt. Anton accommodated that request. Hyatt's lucky to have such caring employees they made a stressful time much easier to handle. Highly recommend.

title: Terrific property in a convenient location
text: Easy access to subway with many restaurants and shops within walking distance.  The Union Square area is very clean and attractive.  The restaurant on property had limited hours but there are many other options close by.  The subway station is literally on the same corner with trains leading directly to Central Park and Yankee Stadium.

title: Great location but hotel is nothing special
text: We stayed in the Union Square Hyatt hotel in June 2021. The location is superb but that is about it. The lobby is non existent. The hotel infrastructure feels old. For example, the toilets did not flush properly, the front door did not close automatically and the shower door had to be forced in. We had room on the top floor (11th) and the view was nice. The room was quite small but it is NYC. Due to COVID, there was no room cleaning or valet parking of bell person, which I understand. However, I was disappointed that no one even held the door opened as i was trying to get the bell car inside the lobby or tried to help my wife with a broken foot in a cast. Basically, we had 0 service.

title: Hyatt Union Square OK Not Great
text: I found this Hyatt property not up to the standards of the many other Hyatt hotels at which I have stayed.  I appreciate that some guests would not want housekeeping services; I do, and it was not clear when I checked in that such service would be provided only every three days IF I REQUESTED IT.  The concept of the request was either not conveyed or could not be heard behind the glass and the noise in the lobby.

title: Memorial Day Weekend Stay
text: First of all, I’ll remember this hotel because the lobby smells good like expensive  men’s cologne. I checked in late on a Friday. Since my reserved room was not ready, the hotel gave me a FREE upgrade whooo! This room was super clean. The way the lights are installed is über convenient - there is a master switch, so you don’t have to get out of bed to turn all the lights out. My check out was seamless. Definitely recommend this place!

title: BROWN WATER with no explanation
text: Completely BROWN water came out of sink and shower covering my daughter in brown residue in her shower.  Staff could not (or would not) explain what the brown stuff was....sediment, dirt, minerals, fecal matter...) They just told us to keep running water for a few minutes (we ran for hours and it didnt help) My daughters boyfriend walked several blocks,  to buy and carry 3 heavy cases of bottled water to rinse her off. So when still brown the next a.m., we checked out yet they refuse to refund us anything....just want to give us points...no thanks!!

title: Comfy and lovely staff
text: Hyatt union square has lovely staff and accomodations. Truly enjoyed being there for my wedding elopement. My first night I went to Bowery Road as I was too tired to venture out and the food was delicious. Had cocktails a few days later in the bar to be greeted by a lovely man who helped me decide on something fancy to enjoy as well as my husbands drink. I would definitely come back again. Only thing to warn people of who are of the larger variety like myself is the jr suite's bathroom closet is very tiny to move around in. Showers on the other hand are very well designed.

title: Excellent service on Union Square
text: Fantastic location and service. The hotel is so central to everything we wanted to visit. Room was very comfortable. Dan in particular is terrific. He really went out of his way to accommodate our requests. We will absolutely return. Thank you for a wonderful getaway.

title: Three days at Hyatt Union Square in New York City
text: Excellent hotel and staff, modern up to date rooms with plenty of electrical outlets for phones and computers. Room was very clean and appeared to be recently re-decorated.  However, no daily maid service, clean towels or garbage removal, which was a turn-off.

title: Another Amazing Stay
text: I love Union Square Park as I attended Baruch when I was younger and that park holds a special place in my heart. I chose to stay at the Hyatt US because of that reason and I continue to go back year after year. Even during a pandemic, they always surpass my expectations. I felt safe there and had no problems at all. Will be returning again as soon as I get the chance.

title: Awesome staff and great location!!
text: We’ve stayed here over the last 4 years while our daughter attended NYU. Happily we will continue to stay here as our daughter will be working in Manhattan. This location is a 1 minute walk to Union Square and right near the subway. The staff is super helpful and friendly! This is our home in NY!

title: Expected more from Hyatt
text: Hotel staff did not support us with an issue with their parking vendor!! They use some sort of voucher system and never mentioned it to us.  When we asked for assistance they said there nothing we can do.

title: Great location and nice staff
text: Walkable to so many places. The woman at the front desk was so very nice and welcoming (I wish I’d gotten her name). King room was comfy and clean with nice view. Mattress however was too hard. I could tell it was super old and they tried to make it plush with blankets under the sheets but nope. Also the restaurant has weird hours, no breakfast, nor room service. Plenty of places nearby but would’ve loved to not leave hotel for a quick bite.

title: A glorified Hampton inn!
text:
This hotel stay caused me to leave my high tier globalist status.   Room was not cleaned for covid concerns.   The sanctuary terrace suite, their highest suite in hotel, not only had damages, but was also a hodgepodge of horrendous decoration.   Curtains didn’t work, bathroom sink did not work.   Terrace table was even dirty when checked in.

No breakfast service offered at hotel. The list goes on and on.  No valet, no housekeeping and no management!

Although I love staying at Thompson hotels, I must end that at this time.   Hyatt treats you like a second class citizen after staying 68 nights in 2021!

I will move on to present poor stays with the Park Hyatt st Kitts and Park Hyatt New York!   Sorry Hyatt, your portfolio is not as strong as SPG and Hilton.   It is now time to move on!

title: Management of this location sucks!!
text:
We decided to splurge for a luxe hotel for my bday. Ordered some food upon check in  - it was cold, soggy, undercooked and enedible.
We told the restaurant manager and they promised to take it off the bill. But wait there's more... We requested a late checkout for 1pm. Imagine you are laying in a strange hotel room and at 7am you hear the door unlocking and someone entered our room!! We were unclothed and I could only scream at the top of my lungs. Turns out it was a hotel employee. The manager refused to refund our money despite nearly giving us a heart attack - she had the gall to tell us that the employee was upset and was sorry!!!! The manager said they could only take off the resort fee which they never did!!! WTF???

title: Nice property near NYU
text: This is a nice property near NYU.  There is no food service on Sunday or Monday but plenty of options nearby.  There is also no room service fr short stays.  Covid restrictions are posted and enforced and for the most part everyone seemed to comply.

title: So close to NYU / Staff are exceptional!!!
text: What sets this hotel apart aside from the beautiful architecture and proximity to NYU are the staff.  Jen and Daniel in reception and Ryan the engineer were outstanding! We felt like part of the family.

title: Very clean place we have use many hotels in Newy York city and although we have been staying in more expensive
text: We have use many hotels in New York city and although we have been staying in more expensive hotels this one is for us the best in cleanliness. The front desk staff are very friendly and happy to answer you many questions. they treat you with respect. But most of the hotels in New York are very friendly staff.

title: Outstanding service at an outstanding location!
text: Front desk staff is always helpful, friendly and responsive to any issues!  Great to see the restaurant opened and look forward to having the bar area open soon! Location is one block to Union Square, Broadway and close to NYU!

title: Overnight to visit family
text: This was our first overnight stay in NYC since COVID, and we felt very safe. The hotel was clean, with contactless check in and out. The room was very comfortable and quiet. The location is terrific. Would highly recommend.

title: Home Away From Home
text: From our first visit, we found the Hyatt-Union Square staff to be friendly, helpful and very accommodating.  Now we return to Hyatt every 4-6 weeks to visit our daughter who attends NYU.  They provide complimentary water at check-in and even offered Valentine candy at our recent visit. Our room is always clean, and well maintained. The location is perfect for spending time with our daughter, good food and shopping. We've been able to walk to a new amazing restaurant at each visit and there's a wonderful Nordstrom Rack and Traders Joe’s just a few blocks from the hotel! Jennifer, a hotel staff, is especially sweet and welcomes us back like family. During a recent visit, we decided at the last minute to extend our stay and she was able to accommodate us at an excellent rate. When searching for hotels, we had hoped to find a clean, conveniently located hotel, but found so much more at Hyatt-Union Square.  We’re already planning our next visit.

title: Exceptional service
text: The staff at Hyatt Union Square was outstanding in every respect. Helpful, kind, friendly. They made a great hotel exceptional. We will definitely stay there again. The hotel was clean, convenient and great.

title: Sat night
text: Terrible check-in, took nearly 30-min and is unsafe (no way to distance and kids without masks).  As a Globalist, loyal to Hyatt, I expect better. No breakfast... small rooms. Far better options available.

title: maintenance problems
text: I requested a repair for a running toilet & faulty flusher, Twice! never got a follow-up or status of my request. I don't believe someone ever came to the room to check it out. Also, the mixer value in the shower needs replacement. There was no cold water. All we had was an extremely hot shower.

title: Horrible stay!!!
text: Got the room king with terrace room is super small nowhere to go terrace was bigger found tissue in the toilet as well as a piece of the closet on the floor as I walked in maintenance was forced to come up took him 20 min to fix overall not worth the money stay away

title: Unclean
text: Old Chinese food container in fridge and old band aid on curtain.  I Expect more during covid times.  You would think with the way everyone is keeping stuff extra clean that they would really follow through with cleanliness.

title: Not great at all for price
text:
Booked a king room with private terrace. Staff was nice and welcoming but all downhill from there. Enter room sticky substance on bathroom door. Went to have a drink out on the terrace pitch black no light so terrace unuseful in the evening I guess also furniture was wet as well as tables. Noone took time to wipe anything down so we could use before arriving. I guess they don't miss the business that much. Took a shower went to use magnifying mirror NOT also didn't work.
If the room was $150 bucks I get it but it wasn't. Never again !!!

title: Great stay at Hyatt Union Square NYC
text:
I had an excellent stay at Hyatt Union Square.  The hotel is in a great location.  I enjoy walking so I parked my car just across the street and was able to walk to the locations I wanted to go to in Midtown, the Village, Soho and Chelsea.  It was easy to get an Uber back to the hotel at the end of the day.

I was so pleased to be able to order room service at the end of a long day.  The food was excellent and safely delivered.

title: Never felt so at home in a hotel stay
text: In these COVID-19 days, it is exceptionally heart-warming to come across a team of people like the one in this hotel. I never felt so taken care of in hotel experience. from food to extended stay. Well done!

title: Great  Place To Stay!
text: The Hyatt Union Square was a perfect choice for me. My wife was in surgery at NYU, and it was within walking distance from the hospital. I was greeted by staff member Jen, who was professional, courteous, and friendly. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet! I would absolutely stay there again!

title: Phenomenal Fitness Room! Great Location!
text: The fitness room is great here. It has everything you need and more.  Lot's of cardio machines, equipment, free weights, etc.  The staff are super nice and accommodating.  I would stay here again for sure.

title: Comfortable and clean hotel
text: I am pleased with Hyatt Union Square service, from the reception staff to the bell staff. They provide good clear instructions and were helpful. My overall experience was good. The room was very clean and everything was working as expected.

title: Very Safe Hotel and Clean
text: I just stayed two days.  Service was great, rooms very clean and sanitary.  Hotel Staff very friendly. The attached Bowery Restaurant Very Clean and Great Food.   Wait staff very mindful of Covid-19 Precautions.

title: Hyatt Union Square Always Delivers an Exceptional Experience
text: Hyatt Union Square is a great location and an exceptional property.   The service and accommodations are 2nd to none in lower Manhattan. I love the rooms with balconies.  The front desk staff are always at the ready to provide excellent service.

title: Poor hotel and bad management
text:
Black mold in the bathroom. Wet dog smell everywhere. Dust everywhere. Black mark on bedsheets. Dust and dirt in every corner of the room. Exposed electric wiring. Leaking shower.

Called down at 11pm and 11:30pm to complain about party, violence, smacking, thumping, running, wall punching, and screaming in the room adjoining. It’s also a 200 floor studio and at least 5 different people were heard in there. Kept us awake all night after repeated attempts to call down to solve.”

Then emailed this morning ad well.

Attendant Anthony was rude, curt, and chippy on the phone with an attitude. Requested a manager get in contact with us via email repeatedly to which he responded - “I’ll try sure.

Poor management.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Just stayed here for 3 nights and loved it!  Will be even better once their restaurants are fully open again.  Excellent location in East village near union square and so many great restaurants.  Walking distance to shopping and other attractions.  Great discount with parking garage nearby.  Rooms were super quiet and good size for nyc.

title: Nice stay!
text:
This is a well kept Hyatt property in a good location. Due to the pandemic, they are unable to provide breakfast options and have limited side-walk seating in front of the lobby level restaurant, Bowery Road. 
I wanted to commend Keona and Tanya at the Front Desk who went out of their way to find another room option for me as the Terrace room I had booked was not as expected. They were terrific!  Thank you both!

title: Customer Service at the Hyatt Union Service
text:
We are not from the US and was traveling for medical during COVID-19 and we found are self staying at Hyatt Union Hotel and the front Office Supervisor - Tanya Richards made are stayed feel like we was at home. Because of the Ms Richards’s and the front desk staff we will be back and we tell all are friends about how they treated us.   
Customer Service is hard to find but Tanya Richards has some excellent customer service she went over and above her responsibilities.
I hope she will be at the Hyatt when we return, we will be looking for her friendly smile and personality.
Thanks , Ms. Tanya Richards and front desk staff.

title: Below average stay in a nice part of town
text: I am a frequent business traveler staying in 30-40 hotels across US/APAC/LATAM in the past 6 years, so my standards are quite high when it comes to hotel stays. That said my experience was below average and I would not recommend staying there. I staying in a terraced suite, which is on the second floor, so dont expect to be blown away by any views of NYC. The room was nicely decorated and the terrace had some outdoor furniture. The hotel interior is nicely decorated and the hotel was doing its best to adhere to COVID requirements. I was surprised to find out that standard toiletries (toothbrush/paste, cotton ear swabs, etc) were provided in the room but rather had to be requested, possibly due to COVID restrictions. My room rate included breakfast for two, but was surprised to find out breakfast was not provided upon checking in, and instead of breakfast i could be provided a "to-go" box. I found it strange considering the next morning the hotel restaurant on the first floor was serving patrons outdoors. The following morning i was given a small disposable lunchbox with a half frozen banana, a cup of yogurt and a small orange juice as a breakfast. I found this kind of laughable but maybe a mistake was made and management accidentally gave me their toddler's kindergarten snack instead of an actual breakfast. All I know is i will not stay again to test if my theory is correct. I digress - at the end of the day the hotel product i purchased was below average.

title: Missed Opportunity To Be Great
text: Hotel was practically empty but they still put me in a substandard room in bad part of hotel. Room was not cleaned well and leftovers from prior guest remained in bathroom. Poor amenities (none).  I was shocked. It was so bad I was more interested in getting out of there than complaining and interacting with staff.

title: Great people and service during a tough time!
text: We stay in a lot of Hyatt Hotels and this one was definitely up there as one of the best in the middle of a city! The location was very central, staff was amazing (thank you Anton, Brock, Rick and Victor) and the room was clean and nicely appointed. Added to this, we were staying there at the beginning of the COVID19 outbreak and their occupancy, like everywhere elses, was low.  They were still friendly, helpful and upbeat.  My daughter and I were so impressed and felt safe  to spend our time there even though it was a scary time to be in the middle of NYC.  Even our dinner recommendation was amazing... YUMMMM... and thank you for that Anton!  We will be back again another time...

title: College visit
text: The hotel was convenient to the NYU campus. Parking was right across the street. The staff was friendly and professional, especially Charlene. Rooms size was bigger than expected for New York. Modern and updated.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: I've stayed in a quite a few hotels in Manhattan. At this price range, there typically not great, even the so-called boutique hotels. But the Hyatt in Union Square is outstanding. It's beautiful, clean, efficient, the service is excellent, the breakfast is really good, the rooms while small (it's Manhattan!) are very comfortable and brilliantly designed - in short, it;s my favorite in NYC and will only ever stay there now.

title: Very nice.
text:
Very nice. Great staff! Front desk was kind, caring and helpful. Bar was great. Drinks are very expensive but it’s New York. 
Rooms are small but new. Beds are very comfortable. 
Restaurant food is good but not great. Breakfast was excellent.

title: Great space in a great place
text: It’s the go to place for me in Manhattan. Not exactly cheap, however for the money I do highly recommend! It’s in the best location union square, close to subway, close to the tunnels, close to everything. Most importantly they have a Restauraunt on site and an area for break fast, along with a nice bar. Have an amazing gym which is always empty love it, yes has more than enough weights for you to get a pump. Like I said if you’re looking for luxury like the mandarin or 4 seasons then go there, but for work and leisure, whe you don’t want to spend a 700$/ night, stay here! The staff is great, the facility is amazing and well kept the room size is a little above normal for the city.

title: The BEST experience in NYC
text: I had an extremely pleasant stay at Hyatt Union Square this past weekend. Aside from the amazing location, the staff was kind, professional, and made the entire stay as enjoyable as possible. I want to give a special thank you to Elle, Anton, Brock, and Evelina for making the stay memorable! Elle especially is one of the many reasons I will be booking again in the very near future!

title: Expensive and not that good
text: But the location is excellent if you want to stay in Union Square, but the service is okay and the room’s are a little bit dark and got nothing special. AND the water bottles are NOT for free... PRANK

title: The Staff is the Reason Why You Should Stay Here!
text: Wow - this is my first time staying at the Hyatt Union Square New York and I must say this place is the definition of white glove service. Anton goes above and beyond with every detail to ensure your stay is a wonderful one. I was greeted by Anton with a big smile as my taxi pulled up to the hotel - he opened the door, helped me with my bag and checked me in while offering me an upgrade after sensing that I had had a long trip. He not only helped me understand that I was a World of Hyatt member already (I had forgotten and was happy to get the points) but when asking where I could print some materials for my meeting this week, he so graciously offered to print them for me and bring them directly to my room. My printed materials arrived right away - he even organized each copy so I didn't have to lift a finger! This is my first time at the Hyatt and I've never received such unbelievable service and staff at a hotel. Il be sure to choose Hyatt every time I return to New York. Thank you so much Anton for demonstrating the true definition of hospitality and professionalism to guests! Ill be back!

title: A little noisy, but can’t beat the location
text:
The halls/outside were a little more noisy than where I stayed last time in NYC, but a great place to stay.

Pros
- super comfy bed
- large room
- great location so much nearby!
- restaurant had AMAZING dessert and great breakfast 
- city view

Cons
- noisy
- no fridge

title: Great stay!
text: Stayed for three days.  Hotel was clean, staff was great and professional.  Keona was very helpful and helped getting a nicer room.  The hotel is in an ideal location too.  Will surely stay there in the future.  Thanks!

title: Valentines Weekend Getaway!
text:
A beautiful boutique style Hyatt right in Union Square. We loved everything about our weekend getaway...welcomed by the happy staff in the lobby, enjoyed a cocktail in the library bar with a cool vibe and just love the location to restaurants and shopping. 
When you travel frequently, you appreciate a comfy hotel mattress! 
Everything was perfect, we will definitely be back!

title: A home away from home
text: I have stayed at the hotel several times recently because my apartment which is nearby is being worked on.  The staff has been exceptionally pleasant, helpful, and cordial. The beds are very comfortable. The layout of the room is adequate.  I have enjoyed being there.

title: Beautiful, comfy room and great location
text: Our king bed room was wonderfully prepared, extremely clean and fairly sizable by NYC standards. The bed was THE most comfortable we’ve ever slept in. The hotel is just one block from Union Square so there are plenty of subway options. We tried the hotel’s “library” bar one evening with friends. The small plate appetizers were absolutely delicious but pretty pricey

title: A small(er), quieter, full service City hotel.
text: Two years ago it became my go-to place to stay regardless of the reason for my trip or proximity to my destinations. I can always get where I need to be on-time and friends and family are always happy to meet me here. We all like the vibe of this hotel

title: Clean and neat hotel located in the center of it all
text: great finishes and comfy stay, loved the amenities in the room, the heater worked great, the location was marvelous, the bar was nice but drinks a tad bit pricey, nice meal options around the area and close to train stations, Down the street from Webster Hall

title: Great Hotel, Great Customer Service!
text: I stay at this hotel fairly regularly because I have a client in the area. They always greet me warmly, and this time, after I checked out, I remembered that I left an expensive pen in the room -- a recent Christmas gift from my husband. Upon calling, someone retrieved the pen from my room and saved it in the hotel safe for me -- great customer service all around!

title: gave me a room near elevator, very loud
text:
I was given a room right by the elevator, which is very loud. The noise of the elevator should not be a new problem, but they told me "we have chosen a very nice room for you! Enjoy your stay!". I did not sleep well the first night wondering what that noise was, but too lazy to pack everything and call front desk to change room at late night. The second night I called the front desk to change room, she was surprised how loud it was since she could hear the noise even from the phone. I think the right thing to do is: if that was the only room left, they should have told me about this condition, instead of hoping I wouldn't notice. If this was not the only room left, then an alternative room should have been prioritized. Since this was not what happended, I can only infer that either the person who checked me in didn't know the situation of the elevator, which makes him not a professional employee, or he did this on purpose to get rid of a bad room, which is even more unacceptable. 
I thank the person who changed my room very efficiently.

title: Home away from home in NYC
text: I love the Hyatt Union Square. This last visit, I came to help my son who is studying at NYU recovery from surgery. The staff was incredible. Keona and Tanya upgraded my room the first night so I would not have to change rooms after my son got out of surgery. The room we stayed in had two king beds and an incredible terrace. All the staff are wonderful - a thank you to Anton who was always there at the right times to open the door for us! Would highly recommend this hotel for the staff, location, rooms and food. Love!

title: Great service!
text: As soon as I walked in, service was off the charts! They helped me with my bags, checked me in a little earlier (my international flight landed before check in time) Sharlene was awesome! So nice, even helped me with an upgrade of my room. Thank you so much!

title: Business Trip to NYC
text: Hyatt Union Square fits what we need for a Business trip in NYC, it is walking distance of most corporate business offices and good restaurants. Its amenities are comfortable and better than its competitors in general.

title: Favorite in NYC
text: This is one of my favorite hotels in Manhattan.  Rooms are clean and spacious.  The shower is excellent with great water pressure. Service is exceptional. Lea, Anton, and Victor were all  extremely helpful at the front desk.

title: Amazing Hotel And location!!!
text:
My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt Union Sq. NYC this weekend. From the moment we checked in and throughout our entire stay we where met with friendly professional staff. A special thank you to Terrill for his kindness and understanding as my boyfriend is in the Army and only had Limited time off. 
The location is fantastic right near the metro and walking distance to shops and attractions.
Thank you to the entire staff at Hyatt Union Sq. we will definitely be back to your modernclean and welcoming hotel.

title: Go to NY Hotel.
text: This is just a great hotel. Excellent location, clean, well priced and exceptional staff. Short of the Park Hyatt this is my favorite New York hotel. Room is a little funky design, but for a New York hotel it’s large. Food is also superior. Taking the price into consideration you couldn’t do better

title: 위치적으로 아주 만족!
text: 위치만 생각하고 이곳을 골랐는데 전체적으로 아주 만족스러웠습니다. 바로 지하철이 있어서 다른 곳으로 이동하기에 아주 편했고 좋았습니다. 룸의 청소상태 또한 좋았습니다. 먼지 알러지가 있어서 먼지가 조금만 있어도 바로 간지럽고 그런데 이곳에서는 그런게 없어서 아주 만족스러웠습니다.

title: Great location and hotel stay
text: This was my second stay at this hotel and the proximity to all the major subway lines as well as fun eating spots plus Union Square is fantastic. Staff is very helpful with a comfortable lobby to sit, read, meet people.  Room was very good

title: Always happy to stay here
text: Each time I come to New York for business my company books my travel and I always ask for the Hyatt at Union Square when possible. It is usually the roomiest and cleanest of my choices and it has a desk to work at, which I appreciate. The staff is excellent and always super friendly welcoming me when I come in and wishing me a safe trip when I go out.  In addition it’s very close to all kinds of restaurants coffee shops and shopping which makes it a nice area to walk around in in the evenings and I feel safe.

title: Great boutique hotel with a very convenient location
text: I was invited for a lecture so they put me up in this hotel. It was just two blocks from the venue. I then ended up staying a couple of extra days to visit family. It was a great base of operations since it was close to the Union Square subway station. The service was great and the rooms were nice and clean and the bed was comfortable. Only pet peeve is the fact that all of the light switches were illuminated with blue LEDs so the room was not pitch black at night. Did not take advantage of the dining or bar so can't speak to those but the latter was packed at night so seemed to be a popular spot.

title: nice convenient efficient hotel
text: Room was bigger than expected. Very clean and quiet. A nice efficient hotel.All requests were acted upon in a timely manner.Highly recommend this Hotel if you have business in the Union Square area. It is convenient to shopping and food.

title: Very central and wonderful staff
text: This hotel is in a fabulous area and right next to the subway. Union square has a farmers’ market three times a week. There are top notch restaurants and bars in the area. I would definitely return. Thanks

title: boutique hotel in Union Square area
text: I stayed in this hotel because my husband was having surgery in a nearby hospital.  It's in a lively fun area close to subways.  I love the decor and ambience of the rooms and the boutique feel of the hotel.  It's an easy walk to many attractions.  The staff is so welcoming and friendly.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent lodging in a wonderful neighborhood.
text: New York's Union Square neighborhood is a bustling center of restaurants and other great experiences. The Hyatt is a very reasonably priced option less than a block off the square. The rooms are small but well designed. They include a small refrigerator and a good sized bathroom with very good quality towels. The hotel has a great bar and restaurant on site as well. As a business traveler I appreciated the number of power outlets at the desk and options not only for television but the incorporation of Chromecast into the system so you can stream video from personal devices. A very well thought out hotel.

title: Another Great Stay at Hyatt Union Square
text: Whenever I come to NYC, I prefer to stay at Hyatt Union Square. The location of the hotel is great, the hotel rooms are clean, nicely furnished, and well-equipped. The people at the registration desk are warm and welcoming. On my most recent stay, the person who checked me in was Victor, and he was very helpful, even upgraded me to a nicer larger room with a terrace. I look forward to my next stay at Hyatt Union Square and highly recommend this hotel because of its convenient location, smaller, boutique style, and great guest service.

title: Awesome stay
text: We had an amazing stay at Hyatt Union Square.  Our whole stay was great from check in to check out.  We were greeted by Keana at the front desk who made sure that we got the best room available, and that our stay will be the best possible by going over all details about the hotel.   She is really a great receptionist.  Our room was excellent for a nyc hotel.   Our family of three had plenty of room.. The area is so cool, many excellent shops and restaurants within walking distance.    The breakfast next morning was amazing..   Steak, eggs, pancakes, french toast; everything was at the level of a top 10 nyc restaurant.  Simpy amazing.  Strongly recommended.  We felt so welcomed during our whole stay.

title: Room requests are not honored at check-in
text:
Over the phone at check-in, we requested a high floor for less noise. We could have chosen a cheaper room but the reservation agent assured us we would get one. We called the day of check-in and were told we had a room on the 10th floor.  At check-in they assigned us a room on the 3rd floor and we were told there was no note and nothing we could do about it.  Then we asked for the smaller room on the high floor and got it, but only got refunded a small amount. At check-out they never even refunded us.

The smaller room on the high floor had a great view and we were happy with it, but soured by the uncaring service experience.  Also the sheets are not 100% cotton, which, if that is important to you, I wanted to mention.

The housekeeping folks were terrific, bartender was very nice and location is good.  Just don't make a room request and expect to have it honored, even after they assure you it will be AND after calling to confirm!

title: Great Place to stay in NYC
