text: We came into manhattan from CT to have dinner with friends and decided to stay at the Hyatt.  It was a great experience.  Everyone was helpful and friendly, the room was clean and modern and the valet service for my car reasonable and prompt.

title: Friendly staff and great boutique hotel in the city with great location
text: Really enjoyed my stay at The Hyatt as a small hotel in the city on Union Square so very central from Soho and Mid town and clean and comfortable rooms which were big. Food at the restaurant was great and the staff very helpful and friendly.

title: Excellent location, great staff
text: Can’t beat the location. Room with two queens was bigger than expected. Clean. Blackout curtains were amazing- slept until 9:30 and I’m a super early riser. Staff brought fan and extra robes. Room rate not bad. Hotel bar- the Library- has a great vibe- excellent cocktails. Would definitely recommend. Only downside- takes a while for them to bring your car around. Call ahead.

title: Great Staff - Great Stay
text: My family and I had a wonderful time at this hotel and the following people were particulary helpful to us: Keyona, Bianca, Julita, Cash, Victor and Jen. We've been to many hotels, but here at the Hyatt Union Square, the frendliness, helpfullness and professionalism of the staff were high above most places we stay. We were very impressed with these folks.  Many thanks - we'll be back.

title: Great Stay
text: I had a great 4-night stay at this Hyatt. I flew in very early and Sharlene at the front desk got me in a room ASAP. Room was comfortable, low noise level, room service was quick, and food in restaurant was good. Centrally located in NYC.

title: Amazing Service in the Big Apple
text: If you're looking for a hotel in New York, bypass Time Square and head over to Hyatt Union Square! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, always there to greet you with a smile and an offer of assistance. The room was amazing and environmentally friendly. Not only is the hotel amazing, but it is located right in the center of EVERYTHING you need and want to enjoy your stay within walking distance!

title: Hospitality
text:
We had great moment thanks to KEONA and her professionalism also her hospitality highly appreciated. 
The room is ok sometimes we didn't have a coffee and mini bar missing ita a bit annoying to go out for grap drinks

title: Great service
text: Tisha and Terrill went above and beyond to assist with every need. This has helped to make my business stay more convenient and efficient.  Good service is priceless and I highly appreciated their assistance.

title: Amazing staff!!
text: The Hyatt Union Square staff once again went way above and beyond! They were friendly, helpful and kind! The food was delicious and the bar is always fun and convenient. I’ve always enjoyed staying in this hotel!

title: Just a Great Experience
text: Everything was great. My wife and I stayed for two nights at the Hyatt Union Square Hotel. We have stayed here previously. The hotel check-in and check-out were simple and quick, the employees were friendly and accommodating, and the room was clean and in perfect condition. We even received a free room upgrade thanks to the hotel clerk Sharlene Quesni (unsure of name spelling) and because we are Hyatt Members. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. Location is great because the hotel is essentially in the middle of Manhattan. The hotel is two blocks from Union Square, very close to a lot of public transportation, and it is very easy to hail a cab at the front of the hotel. Employees offered to assist us in hailing a cab, but we didn't need their help.

title: Great location, nice rooms and very attentive staff
text: We stayed in Hyatt for 2 nights right before Christmas this year (2019) and had a wonderful experience. It’s right next to Union Square holiday market, great restaurants (must try Max Brenner's and Momofuku milk bar). Staff is very attentive

title: Great staff and location
text: Hyatt union square is located in a great part of town, easy to get anywhere. Staff is super-helpful and friendly, especially Sharlene-really appreciate her willingness to make my stay more comfortable.

title: Keona and Anthon Provided Impeccable Service
text: Had the pleasure of being welcomed by Keona and Anthon on Christmas Day. We were welcomed with warm smiles, brilliant service and genuine care by both of them. The hotels service is only heightened by them with an all round brilliant experience at the hotel. Highly recommend.

title: good stay
text: Enjoyed our stay there. Receptionists are friendly, and check-in and check-out are fast and easyit. It is an excellent and convenient location, easy to go all other places. Restaurant and bar very good. WIFI is slow and easy to get off.

title: NOT 4 STAR BY ANY MEANS
text:
I should have known there would be problems when I tried to book a room directly and got hung up on 6 times, they were having phone trouble. 
My Phone in my room didn’t work 
Heat a/c unit didn’t work
Shower didn’t work. Scalding water only. Had to move rooms which is a big hassle. This is not a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. The staff was very friendly and tried to get things fixed. They can’t help it if nothing works. This was my Christmas vacation to see my kids in  New York City.

title: Great Location, Staff, and Rooms
text:
Come here all the time for work and its a great spot close to work as well as the subway.  Rooms are great and staff is always helpful.

For example, my work recently bungled a reservation that was charged to my card and then accidentally auto-cancelled.  Policy stated that it was non-refundable and I was going to deal with a lot of paperwork.  However, I called up the Hyatt front desk and Sharlene was able to help me out and get everything figured out.

title: Charlene is very helpful
text: Charlene was professional and courteous when I called to ask about some policies. She noted in our account that we needed to be in earlier than the 3:00pm time, and she didn't charge extra for this. Great job, Charlene!

title: Great location, excellent staff, above average rooms
text: Stayed here week before Christmas to visit friends. I’m a solo adult traveler who used to live in New York so I can’t speak from a true tourist perspective. But I think the location is excellent. You’re south of the midtown connection, but shopping and conveniences is only around the corner (DSW, Nordstrom Rack, MAC, Whole Foods a block away, higher end only a few more).  Subway station is both local and express stop so easy to get around). And taxis are about as plentiful there as you’re going to get most times of day). I usually prefer something in Soho or Tribeca like Soho Grand or Sixty Thompson but I found this hotel have a cozier more personal feel than you’d associate with a big chain. I liked the fact there was enough space in the lobby to meet a friend or sit for a moment plus a full restaurant and bar. The room was not particularly remarkable with regard to decor, but I still thought definitely better than average. Love that you can still get a coffee maker in the room. Tiny niggling thing was I wish they’d update outlets to have more USB ports.  Pharmacopia amenities were great, bed was comfortable, room size was pretty good for New York, I’ve definitely, definitely, paid more for smaller. Room service burger and fries were very good. Far and away the front desk staff was great. I wish I had caught their names. (Whoever was on desk from 13-19 December.). I don’t write trip advisor reviews as much as I should but felt compelled this time.

title: Nice Hotel
text:
The hotel is very clean and rooms are small but larger than the a average room in NYC 
The staff was very welcoming and helpful during the rest of my stay
The cost was expensive but it was a deal compare to other options in the area
In summary I won’t hesitate to get back and would recommend it every time

title: Small but mighty
text:
New York hotel rooms are small regardless of price, this is a fact. This Hyatt has been very clever with their limited space and created what feels like a spacious room through streamlined, efficient design. My king room featured a robe and slippers, and an umbrella just in case. The "closet" is actually an in-room wardrobe with space to hang but no drawers to store smaller things, so I folded and piled my non-hangables on the taller part of the closet that held the safe and a smaller drawer below that (drawer-height, minus the drawers). Wall hooks by the door were a nice place to store my coat and purse. There are a lot of outlets in all the right places, the stand-up shower was spacious and modern with ok pressure and consistent temperature control. There is a sideboard-type table that holds a fridge on one side and the coffee maker on the other (mine was broken but they sent up a free pot in the morning and got me a replacement the next day). Real glass glasses (two sizes plus two wine glasses), a wine opener, and a nice desk setup helped make the space feel pretty cozy. There aren't a lot of surfaces to set things without clutter quickly taking over, but there is a bench seat as well as a desk chair and a carry-on stows nicely in the area under the TV.

Cons: The blackout curtain didn't lay flush with the walls so my east-facing window bled sunshine on my last morning (fortunately, it had been cloudy most of the trip). The pillows are down and a little too firm for my taste, and the HVAC doesn't run constantly so if you are a light sleeper, BRING A NOISE MACHINE OR AN APP because NYC is loud all the time. The hotel knows this, so earplugs are provided in the valet kit on the sink. Not much neighbor noise at all but the street is always going. My noise machine worked like a charm.

I was alone on business but I can't imagine trying to stay here with another person. There's exactly enough room for one person's stuff for a short amount of time. This hotel is not for long stays, in my opinion. I will stay here again when I travel back to NYC though, it was perfect for me.

Close to all public transit, a block from Union Square, and perfectly located for nice long walks to Midtown and the Village. Also, points for both a Trader Joe's and a Whole Foods mere blocks away.

title: My stay at Hyatt Union Square
text:
I am having a great experience at the Hyatt hotel at the Union Square.
The rooms are clean, silent and comfortable, well located.
I was well hosted by Sharlene and Victor who helped me on different matters. Thanks!

title: Dirty and fire alarm goes off all the time.
text: Hyatt reward member: do not stay here. Super dirty, few amenities and the fire alarm goes off with steam from people’s showers! Very loud hotel with uncomfortable beds and zero mini bar. Pathetic experience.

title: I would return!
text: This hotel has much to recommend!  Excellent staff; friendly, professional and most helpful.  Room was comfortable, quiet and well equipted!  Great location in beautiful Union Square that's offers easy access for going uptown, downtown or all about the town.  Fine dining and shopping near by.  Also you will find a well equipted and clean fitness room.

title: Great customer service prevails!
text:
I chose Hyatt Union Square for its location.  Close to my meeting and family at the same time.
I had just completed a transcontinental flight that started out at 2:45 AM.  I finally arrived at the hotel at 3:40 PM and was ready to wash up to go to my meeting.   I'm sure you can understand my frustration when I was informed that my room was still not ready.  However, the manager on duty was able to set me up in another room, so I can get ready for my meeting and expedite my originally booked room to be ready.  When I finally came into my room after the meeting, this particular room's bathroom was still needing some work.  Night manager Ty, once again was so helpful in switching to a clean room where I was able to stay for the remainder of my 5 nights stay at the hotel.
Much appreciation to all the people who worked hard to make my stay a great experience. 
Thank you.

title: Superlative!
text: The Hyatt staff was wonderful and very accommodating. The location of the property was perfect for my needs. Staff from housekeeping to management made me feel like a queen. Can’t wait to go back for my next visit. Ask for Lea at the front desk and you’ll be sure to have a great stay!

title: Great experience
text: We appreciated the staff for their friendliness and helpfulness throughout our stay. The room was clean and met our expectations. Union square is a great area to be around with the park and Wholefoods walking distance.

title: Excelente opção em NYC !
text: Quartos confortáveis e limpos ! Café da manhã impecável. Funcionários da recepção atenciosos e eficientes. Check in e out rápidos. Localização perfeita, no coração do Village, acesso fácil a todos os lugares. Metrô no quarteirão. Recomendo ficar nesse hotel para conhecer a verdadeira NYC (abaixo do Midtown) !

title: Beautiful, Convenient and Comfortable
text: We were here for a business trip and this hotel was very convenient to so much in the city. The rooms were small but nice, the beds were comfortable, great shower and great restaurant. The staff was wonderful, very helpful and made the stay memorable.

title: Bom
text: boa localização e  confortável ,com boa academia 24h ,  restaurante agradável e com bom cafe da manhã e boa comida no geral.o acesso aos quartos pelo elevador sem precisar usar a chave do quarto me deixou um pouco preocupado.

title: Comfortable stay, convenient to NYU.
text: We enjoyed our stay here.  Lea, the receptionist, was delightful.  Our room was comfortable and clean.  It was conveniently located to NYU.  Decor modern with clean lines.  Bed comfortable.  Nice linens.   Enjoyed the Manhattans in the library type bar - a good warm up in the middle of a cold front.    Tompkins Bagels  a few blocks over was a great breakfast choice.  Wonderful bagels.  Crumb cake good too.

title: Great place in a great location
text: Great experience - room was clean, comfortable and in excellent condition with great technology and amenities. Ate dinner in hotel restaurant which was tasty and high quality food. Attended hotel bar late night and it has a great cocktail menu. Crowded and upbeat with both locals and guests.

title: 15年ぶり
text: 宿泊はしませんが、15年ぶりにロビーを利用しました。15年前は隣接するブロックがとっても危険なゾーンでしたが、危険なゾーンは1ブロック遠くになっていました。ハイアット自体はそんなに変わった印象はありませんでした。

Bien placé pour les personnes qui aiment plutôt le down town:
pas loin des clubs de jazz, soho, east side,  et même en marchant un peu vers Chelsea
Petit déjeuner correct
Services complets pour passer un bon séjour

title: Nice hotel near NYU
text: Nice, new hotel with a good location.  Visiting family in NYC and picked this one.  Have never spent time in that part of town but it was convenient for what I needed.  Unwary very close and walk to midtown was fine.   Pricing was ok, rooms compact but well appointed.  More modern style, small lobby. Just 2 elevators but they moved reasonably quickly.  Didn’t eat in attached restaurant.  Bar had a nice feel and was busy around midnight.  Would stay there again.

title: Awesome Service
text: Great staff, hotel bar and clean rooms.  Close to everything and really a centralized location.  We had a work meeting there and everyone was very happy w/the hotel.  So glad we stayed there and definitely would stay there again

title: Very spacious rooms
text: The place had easy access to shopping, restaurants and transportation! I was able to take the train to and from without many issues. The rooms very very spacious which was a nice surprise, other hotel rooms are normally tiny, and the place was very clean, facility looked pretty well maintained, like new

title: Not so clean.
text: Room was not clean. Our stay was overpriced and underwhelming. For a modern room it was dated. There was no service to our room on the second day.  There was a cigarette but on the terrace and chewing gum in the planter.

title: Don't waste your money
text: Chose this hotel for its excellent location. Was terribly disappointed in the front desk staff, housekeeping staff (left broken glass on the furniture and floor), and room service (tried to charge us for wine we didn't order and didn't bring the wine glasses we did request).  We asked to extend the reservation of a 2nd hotel room and were told "no problem" and then learned the day of check in that no room was available. We also were not told of a daily per person property credit of $20 - a waste of over $500.  Will not be staying at this Hyatt or any other again.

title: Top notch hotel
text: I loved my stay at Hyatt Union Square. It was nearby many shops and restaurants. The staff was friendly and it was quiet unlike other hotels I have stayed at in NYC where I could hear all the traffic.

title: Nice stay and great location
text:
I had a nice stay;  this hotel was very clean and well appointed;  The hotel is fantastic;  The bar and restaurant were very good and received good service;  Staff was friendly and responsive;

My room was on 11th floor, and I could hear some machinery being operated at night;  perhaps washing machine/dryer;  so a Little bit noisy;  I would stay again but perhaps lower floor;

title: Hyatt Perfect
text: Smaller, clean modern room.  Quiet and everything worked well.  On site restaurant excellent, very good gym in the lower floor.   Would stay there again.   Easy to get cabs etc. and subways one block away in Union Square.   Excellent location.

title: Great space and great location!
text: Very convenient for Midtown business needs. Lots of amenities both on-site and in the immediate area! I have stayed here and several other local properties multiple times now and the Hyatt Union Square isnow my 1st choice!

title: Our favorite hotel in New York City
text: We enjoy staying at the Hyatt Union Square on our trips to New York City.  The location is ideal for us,  The staff is congenial and helpful.  The facilities are up-to-date and kept clean.  Many good restaurants in the area.  Excellent shopping within reasonable walking distance.  Union Square has delightful markets.

title: Hyatt Union Square, NY
text:
Great hotel in
Premium location. Service is always excellent. We stay there frequently and are always remembered by the staff and treated very well. One of the best hotels in the area. Will definitely be returning

title: Poorly Managed
text: We stayed here traveling with family for a wedding. We had reserved two rooms, one of which was a junior suite. We were advised that the suites were overbooked and offered a smaller room at a discount. This was not satisfactory to us but had we no choice. We were placed in an “accessible” room.. When reviewing the bill, the next morning the rate was not discounted. Throughout the process of resolving the issues we encountered, the front desk staff displayed a lack of training and organization. We had to explain our situation to 5 different staff members as there was no communication amongst them. In addition, the servers in the bar were inattentive and unfriendly. We’ve stayed here a few times in the past and will not again as the level of service has deteriorated significantly.

title: Great location, modern and clean room, very comfortable
text: I never stay at Hyatt hotels... so was pleasantly surprised. The location is great. The staff are friendly. The lobby bar and restaurant next door have nice atmospheres. The rooms are modern, clean, and spacious (for NYC). Overall, if you need to be in this area, I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Very nice
text: The room was clean.  It  had a simple but cool aethstetic.  The staff was pleasant and accommodating.  I received an unusual housekeeping visit at 8am but whatever.  Shower was slightly lacking in cleanliness but over all well kept.  Would recommend.

title: Best of Hyatt
text: When comparing the Hyatt Hotels (leaving out the Park Hyatt) in NYC, the Union Square is the best of all of them, including the tired and overrated Grand Hyatt...good location, exlcellent breakfast choices in the Bowery Road Restaurant...like all rooms in the City, they are small, but the corner suite offered sufficient space to not seem too  crowded.  Staff was cordial and helpful.

title: Hyatt Union Square
text: Enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Staff were courteous and attentive. Hotel is perfectly situated in Union Square.  Room is large for NYC.  Hotel was clean and rooms were well appointed.  I would stay at this Hotel again.

title: Perfect hotel for a weekend wedding
text:
The Hyatt is around the corner from the venue of a family wedding.  We stayed in the very generous sized King Sanctuary Suite  (1300+ Sq ft with a major terrace that wrapped around the room). 

The room is beautiful, as expected, with high end finishes, very nice toiletries, and the biggest shower I have ever used.  The staff were super helpful.  We were there for the wedding of my son, and the staff handed out gift bags, helped our guests find our suite. Nothing was too small to attend to and they responded quickly.

We have hosted family gatherings at other hotels and this experience we have ever had.  Well done Hyatt Union Square with a shout out to Anton!

title: Great location
text: The Hyatt Union Square is located near Broadway.  The hotel is not only close to Union Square, it is also close to the NYU Greenwich Village campus. Rooms are modern and the associated bar and restaurant are popular!

title: Great boutique style hotel centrally located!
text:
Came here with family. Staff is very friendly and courteous. Very clean. Room is small but what nyc hotel is not! 

The restaurant next door is great. Ask for Mayte. This server is fantastic! 

The bar behind the registration desk is amazing too.

title: Great hotel!!
text:
Stayed here for two nights!
Very nice modern hotel with a great location. I got upgraded to a small suite that was perfect for me!
Staff was very professional and nice. The hotel is connected to a good restaurant that serves the breakfast that is good.
Very highly recommended!!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: This is a wonderful hotel close to Union Square. Very nice rooms and a fabulous bar/lounge area to unwind. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the fitness room is great too. I highly recommend this hotel and location if you want to be a little ways away from the craziness of Times Square.

title: trip to move into dorm
text: It was nice that since I had to take my vehicle, the hotel had valet parking.  Customer service was great.  Room was clean and roomy.  only reason for Very Good vs. Excellent is price.  Kind of expensive but that is NYC for you.  Great  location and nice bar and restaurant.  Workout facility was wonderful too.

title: Well situated Hotel
text: Clean rooms ..moderate size rooms for a New York hotel..restaurants & food could be a lot better. Very close to Union Square & colleges if your kids are going to Parsons or NYU. lots of stores & conveniences within walking distance

title: Fabulos Hotel in East Village
text: We loved our stay and in particular the stellar service. Staff was on point throughout our stay. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city who does not have small children. Our room was clean, the towels were plush, and the modern aesthetic was inviting and not excessive or overplayed.

title: Lovely hotel-attentive staff
text: Prior to this visit, I have never stayed at this hotel and was quite pleased.  I was warmly welcomed at check in, found the room to be well appointed and clean and the overall ambiance of the hotel was pleasant.  Excellent location at Union Square Park as well.

title: Great place to stay near Union Square Station!
text: Wonderful location with a zillion shops, restaurants and more. Conveniently located near Union Square Station. Rooms are comfortable and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The restaurant food is delicious with appetizers big enough for a meal!

title: Best hotel in NYC by do717
text: Best location and top notch staff who are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.  Great amenities, restaurant and bar on site.  Very comfortable lobby to people watch.  Stayed 4 nights and everything was all positive not negatives.  Hotel staff will hail a cab for you.  Uber rides all arrived within minutes.  Hotel uses a car service to take you to the airport at a cost that was less than the taxi.

title: Kleine, laute Zimmer, aber trotzdem gut
text: Es ist zwar nicht das schönste oder bequemste Hotel in der Stadt, aber der Standort ist perfekt. Ich bin gerne in East Village, deshalb finde ich dieses Hotel genau richtig, denn ich kann überall hin, zu Fuss. Und wenn ich weiter weg muss, ist die Subway eine Strasse weiter. Die Zimmer sind sehr klein und einiges im Zimmer und im Flur ist laut, aber dafür sind die Angestellten sehr höflich. Der mini-fridge hat keinen Platz für eigene Sachen und die meisten Zimmer haben Dusche und Waschbecken quasi im Zimmer, aber das Bett ist bequem.

title: Incredibly noisy
text: I would have rated the hotel VERY GOOD but for the NOISE.  Our courtyard rooms were quiet in terms of external noise and room to room BUT the noise that came in from the hallway, doors being unlocked, opening and closing was AWFUL.  So loud I kept thinking someone was opening MY door...UGH...truly spoiled the experience.

title: Midwest hospitality in a large city
text: I travel a lot. If you don't, or have never been to NY, this is a great hotel as the staff is super accommodating. This is an easy walk to NYU, Parsons, or the New School, so if you are visiting your kids, this is the place to stay. The couple bucks more you might spend will be forgotten quickly.

title: Love this place!
text: The bartenders were funny and polite. The location was perfect for me and I got to 4 meetings in all on time. Great food in and around the hotel. This will be my NYC homebase for all future visits to NYC.

title: centrally located, lovely design, clean rooms with view. awesome hotel bar.
text: Stayed here on our first trip to NYC. The staff were great and the place couldn't be more centrally located. Also the hotel bar is gorgeous and had a great crowd of locals and hotel guest. Made a few friends!

title: Best location for Parsons student drop off
text: Front desk is staffed, most helpful and efficient of any I have seen in quite a while.  Location was good excellent as it was close to my daughters dorm at Parsons.  Shopping all around.  Shower steam extremely sensitive and set off Hotel fire alarm just from turing on water.  Had not even gotten in shower.

title: Great location  - amazing food - outstanding staff
text:
A very good hotel with friendly and very helpful staff. Great location close to everything. Great restaurant and bar (so, great room service). Quiet, nice and clean.
A lot a healthy eateries all around, Union Square farmer's market, NYU and The New School (and residences). Close to Soho too! Ideal!

title: Hyatt Hub
text: Great neighborhood location close to many cool restaurants, bars and subway stop. Lobby is modern. Bowery bar is really nice with good drinks.Staff are nice. Rooms are clean and not too small. Good value.

title: Great location in Union Square
text: All I can say is WOW! Great location and really nice neighborhood. The hotel staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. I loved the whole experience. This will be my requested location when I’m in the city for work or vacation.  There are lots of places to grab a bite to eat and get drinks that are just minutes away from 5th Ave and all other great locations in city. Not to mention the room was amazing. Window view was not the best but the nice location made up for that.

title: Hyatt Stay
text: I was staying at the DoubleTree by Hilton Times Square South but had multiple safety issues come up. I switched to Hyatt last minute and they were great. I felt safe here and that's what matters most.

title: Great Location
text: The Hyatt Union Square is perfectly located for easy access to Uptown and Downtown and Union Square is a lively eclectic area - safe but with a little edge.  I loved it!  The Hotel itself is quirky, clean and comfortable.  the only slight criticism I have is the menu was lack-lustre and a bit boring and limited.  The staff are absolutely wonderful.  Nothing was too much trouble!

title: Hospitality Win in NYC
text: I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for several days while traveling for work. Hyatt Union Square has been one of the most accommodating hotels I’ve stayed at in New York City. The rooms are very well equipped with everything you could need for a stay in the city (including umbrellas to borrow which definitely  came in handy this week). The bed was incredibly comfortable, blackout shades for privacy and light blocking. I usually can’t sleep in the city with all of the noise, but given the location of Hyatt Union Square I didn’t hear a thing while sleeping. There are also white noise devices in the room, comfortable fleece bathrobes, and the alarm clocks are now Bluetooth speakers with wireless charging capabilities. The Hyatt staff was warm and accommodating each time I interacted with them and had excellent advice for directions or recommending places to eat in the area. Bowery Restaurant and Library of Distilled Spirits were also terrific options and the staff was fantastic at each establishment. Union Square is so central to everything in Manhattan I would definitely recommend staying here for work or pleasure - you can take the subway across the street, enjoy the park and farmers market and catching a cab was simple given the location. Thank you again from a very satisfied traveler!!!

title: Location Location Location
text: This is a great hotel in a fabulous location. The staff was welcoming and friendly and available to answer any questions we had. We were greeted enthusiastically by the door man who valeted our car and ushered us into the front desk area which was manned by helpful and personable staff.

title: Awesome, awesome experience at the Hyatt Union Square
text: Classy, classy but warm and comfortable.  The staff is fantastic - clearly care about your experience.  I recommend taking their cars to LGA - not very pricey and their drivers fantastic.  Food is excellent. My home away from home in NYC...I'll be back!

title: Very comfortable, but beware of fees
text: This hotel was very comfortable.  Room was small, but that is typical of New York City.  Bed very comfortable and room was quiet, but bring a light bulb if you plan to read.  Lamp on desk was dim.  Beware of a "destination fee".  The hotel added $25/night to my bill for that fee.  When I told the staff member that it was not mentioned in my reservation (through hotwire) and that I used none of the facilities they removed the fee.  It is sad that even a class organization like Hyatt chooses to nickel/dime their customer with silly fees.  Not that airlines are any paragon of customer service, but they tell you, up front. to the penny, what a trip will cost.  Hotels should do the same.

title: Beautiful hotel in the perfect location
text: Hyatt Union Sq is a beautiful Boutique gem hidden in the business of NYC. Its located just meters away from union sq and offers great rooms, service. The restaurant there offers great food with lunch and dinner packages with great prices and excellent service

title: Only one thing comes to mind which is Overpriced
text:
First Time I show at the Hotel, the staff looks at me like I am in a wrong place. Then the room was tiny, hardly the kind of amenities you would expect for the sky high prices they are demanding. No breakfast included, hell they even charge for drinking water. I expect Towels to be cleaned everyday, but I saw the same towel was their as I left it.

Wifi was extremely poor, I mean you would a good wifi for business suite thats what I thought. Elevators are run down, please update or change them. The best thing about Hyatt is they leave the alarm set for Midnight so that when you come tired from a long flight and sleeping, it would go off at the right time and you stay up all the time. I am not asking much but just give me something equivalent to the price I am paying ? Is it that hard ?

title: Be careful about what you're charged!!!
text:
The hotel has a great location. My room was clean, and spacious for NY. My view was the wall of an adjoining building. Wifi was slow and almost unusable on my laptop.
My stay was completely spoiled by what I was charged, and the unwillingness of the hotel to recognize my distress. The reservation for 3 nights was made by a local non-profit company, with me paying the first night. I had looked online to see what the room charge would be, and saw that rooms were going for the low $300s through their website. OK, I thought, it's NY, that's OK.
And then I was charged almost $500 for one night in an ordinary room. And then they refused to do anything to make me a happier customer.
No more Hyatts for me.

title: Don’t Leave Anything of any value in you room!! Lock Everything!!
text: Went in to wash my hands and brush teeth before I checked out. Left my ring and toothbrush by the sink. Called a few hours later and claimed not to find them. Very sad. It’s the principle of the matter.

title: Great stay
text: Stayed here for business but was also traveling with my husband and 16mo old in tow. The rooms were clean and spacious and it was super easy to jump on the near by subway to explore. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Week Long Stay
text: This was an excellent place for lodging, with helpful and friendly staff.  The room was always cleaned in a timely manner, and the bed was comfortable. My only complaint is that the walls are very thin.

title: Great hotel
text: An amazing hotel.  Great staff.  Great location near Union Square, on many subway lines.  If you are looking for a great hotel in a great location, this hotel is perfect.   Hotel is quiet even though its on 4th Avenue.

title: Very good indeed
text:
Excellent location, very good atmosphere, the bar is exceptional and it feels good having a drink there any time after 4:pm
Service is good and easy 
I recommend this place if you need to stop in Manhattan

title: Hyatt Union Square
text: This hotel is on the expensive side but the rooms are large and modern.  The staff is very helpful and assisted me very well when asked to help.  The location is convenient to shops and to the many restaurants in the East Village. I  am a repeat guest.

title: Very good option in Union Square
text: Very nice lobby, my room was small (to be expected in NYC), especially for two people but seemed recently renovated and was well laid out and nice. Bathroom was a a bit odd in that water from shower pretty much guaranteed to get all over the bathroom. That was my biggest issue. A clear design flaw. A two-minute walk off Union Square. I was on 11th floor street side and had no noise issues.

title: Comfort in all places
text: From the staff, to the rooms, to the additional privileges given by Hyatt my first experience staying in the city was worth it. Enjoyed my stay with a clean modern room and my requests met. The staff was spectacular and on top of providing the best service to their clients. Will repeat my stay.

title: Not the best option in the area
text: Victor at the front desk was great and apologetic about all that went wrong but he was the highlight...Awkward rooms needing a refresh, no Prosecco despite 4 Spritzes on the menu at 4 in the afternoon, dark, water issues when sharing an an alarm testing system that went on for too long. As a loyalty member have stayed here before and the location is great...but not likely to recommend to others...

title: Great service, location and new build
text:
We stay in a lot of hotels around this area, and are now going to be loyal to the Hyatt Union Square. The people are fantastic. 

I had a really curious experience at the front desk that showed their talent and commitment to service. Alisha, at the front desk, had apparently drawn the shortest straw, and was patiently taking in a woman’s unhinged rant about her treatment. She wasn’t a guest mind you. Just how the world has been treating her. Paranoid and wounded, she kept up a relentless barrage. Alisha remained patient, fair and firm with her, giving her the space to unburden herself. Things changed when the woman decided that I had made a crack about her smoking. Uh, what? And all of a sudden she was making comments about me as I waited to be checked in. This is when I saw an interesting shift in Alisha. She got very stern with the woman, and said she was not to bother our guests. The woman protested, and Alisha was having none of the fake “what? Me?”.

I wasn’t exactly bothered as I understood that this woman had something going on. But Alisha made sure that the drama didn’t spill into my experience. To me, in addition to the deft people skills, it showed Alisha’s strength in personality and commitment to ensure things go smoothly for guests. It could have easily been an eye-rolling experience. Jennifer Post runs the front, and clearly does a great job, as everyone to a person, was lovely. 

It’s a very nicely appointed and designed hotel that fits with the neighborhood. Close to Union Square as the name suggests. Great restaurant in the building. Think Coffee across the street is excellent as well. 

Book with confidence. 

Michael Dezso

title: Do NOT stay if you have to VPN into work / THEFT
text:
While the location is fantastic, the stay was a continued nightmare. The wired Internet doesn't work, and the WiFi was Terrible.  I had to forgo part of my trip to be in my room on the phone with their tech support, and they finally admitted that their equipment was insufficient (after many hours).  They offer upgraded Internet speeds, which I was given for free as a comp, but that brought me from 1 MBPS to 4 or 5 MBPS download, and from 0 upload to 0.09 upload speed per speedtest.net. I had to go elsewhere to work, and in NYC coffee shops there is no comfort/privacy to concentrate. Just awful.  Thanks for stealing time off my trip to spend time on the phone with support in my room to finally admit that your equipment is not good enough.

Issue 2:  Maid STOLE money I had in a change cup...they would not let me fill out a security incident saying she thought it was a tip.  Um...no.  I don't like that I was denied my right to a security incident, and I never thought that I should have to lock up change...guess I do.  Sad.

title: 1 king bedroom
text:
Hotel was really clean. Location in NY couldnt be better. Room was extremely clean, but a bit noisy at night. Other than that, the whole
experience was great. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting.

title: Phenomenal!!!
text:
Beautiful hotel in a great location. Staff at Hyatt Union Square are the best I’ve ever encountered, and I’ve lived in hotels for a year. We arrived late with a large amount of boxes for an event. The staff were accommodating, friendly and went above and beyond to assist us. 

The rooms are large for NYC and really quiet. If you can snag one on the 11th floor you can capture some views across the city. In any case, you will truly enjoy your stay here. 

The restaurant and bar are top notch. We spent hours one night enjoying the depth of experience that the bartender had and he even mad a special drink that wasn’t on the menu. 

By all means, if you are looking for a hotel, this should be your choice.

title: Brilliant hotel!
text: Outstanding location. One block south of Union Square. Can easily walk to some of the best entertainment and restaurants in NYC. Staff goes beyond excellent to assist and make guests feel welcome. Do not overlook the trendy Library Bar with delicious drinks and appetizers. I also had breakfast at Bpwery Road every day. Again, delicious food and lovely staff. My favorite hotel in NYC.

title: Conference Stay in June 2019
text: The bed was extremely comfortable. We stayed in a handicapped accessible and found the layout and design to be intelligent as well as aesthetically pleasing. The soaps, shampoos, and conditioners were of a high quality. The room was small, but this was New York City, so that came as no surprise. Every Tuesday the hotel bar offers a free drink. Don't miss that. I wish the rooftop had been open for guests. That was a disappointment. Also, the hotel lacks a conference room and quiet reading area. The staff was friendly and professional. The Thinking Coffee House across the street was a nice discovery.

title: Hyatt union square
text: My stay at the Hyatt Union Square was ok, the room was small but comfortable for my daughter and me. There was no view and that was a bit disappointing for OUR very 1st time in NY but fine. The room has a slight odor hard to describe what it was but it hit you in the face when you walked into the room. The check in was slow but there were in two people there working this small lobby desk. The clerk was nice enough with a generic smile if you asked me. There was an issue with the canceling of my car from the airport, after finding out it would cost me $95 one way, I canceled the car with the HYATT but the customer agent didn’t cancel and didn’t really offer an reason why other than miscommunication. WHAT MISCOMMUNICATIONS? I Asked BRIANNA to cancel the car because I found other transportation cheaper. So, I was out of $200 for transportation and no one seemed to care. Ms. Brianna did say she called the air link transportation company and they said they would give me a partial refund but I won’t hold my breath. Ms. Brianna was a lot nicer than the young lady that checked me in though. I never got her name. The trip to NY was overwhelming too expensive and too many people. If I EVER stepped foot back into NY I would probably give the Hyatt another chance it’s close to everything and I would like a bigger room with a view. My daughter wanted to see the Statue of Liberty and was accomplished that so all is good. She’s 7 and will probably remember this forever.

title: good value hotel in good location
text: The Hyatt is conveniently located near Union Square and the subway.  The area has many resturants and a youthful vibe.  The staff was efficient and helpful.  We stayed on the 11th floor and found the room to be quiet despite facing the street.

title: Great hotel and service
text:
Hyatt Union Square offers great service and dining for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  The workout facility is clean and up to date. 

It's location near Union Square is the best for walking to good restaurants and shopping.

title: So accommodating!
text: The hotel was beautiful and the staff couldn’t have been more helpful. The front desk allowed us early check in and kept our bags for us at the end of our stay to accommodate our later flight. The bartenders made wonderful drinks and had suggestions for activities in the city. Everyone we encountered was friendly and eager to help. Such a great experience.

title: Nice, clean, quiet, friendly service
text: Those are not usually adjectives you use for a NYC hotel. This lives up the Hyatt name. I also appreciated the wood floors in the room that you could smell had just been cleaned--no dirty carpet, which is really what you usually get even in more expensive hotels in NYC. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Nice Hotel, not so good with the cleaning
text:
Had one of the more expensive rooms with a terrace.
Room was dark and smelled of damp.
clean towels every day bed made but didnt sweep floors  in the room or bathrrom
Staff very nice but not really interested, I gave up complaining beause everday of our 8 night stay was the same.

title: Good No-Nonsense Hotel in Downtown Manhattan
text:
Recently stayed at the Hyatt Union Square NYC for six nights and was overall quite happy with it. Located right at Union Square and close to the Flatiron district, the hotel location is the greatest plus - convenience stores such as Walgreen's are just steps away and there are all kinds of great restaurants within walking distance. Maison Kaiser, an all-day breakfast and pastries eatery, is just a block away. There's a Starbucks about two blocks away and an all-day Chinese dim-sum restaurant, Tim Ho Wan just half a block away. Reputable restaurants such as Gramercy Tavern, East 15th and the Union Square Cafe are all within walking distance.
The hotel's restaurant The Bowery Club did not have good breakfast (limited menu and bad coffee) but the Cobb Salad during dinner time was very good and reasonably priced. The hotel bar is actually quite beautiful and exotic during quiet times, but for most evenings, the bar was extremely noisy particularly during weeknights. The bar does not take reservations and good luck with finding a table. Drinks were good but very expensive!
At about USD$400 per night, the room was good value for money for a Manhattan Hotel. There's free Premium Wi-Fi (maybe because I'm a World of Hyatt member) everywhere for up to three devices anywhere in the hotel. I also had 2 free bottles of Evian water every day. I opted for the King-Bed room facing the Courtyard and the backs of other nearby buildings because the hotel is located near a fire station and I wanted to be free from sirens of fire trucks. The room was small but quite well equipped with sufficient closet space and drawers even with a big hotel umbrella inside the closet. The bathroom shower offered good water pressure but the water often overflowed beyond the shower stall if the door was not closed tightly. I particularly liked the edgy bathrobe with a hood - very nicely designed and hip! The King bed was comfortable but I missed my mini-fridge where I could have put my purchased fruits from Walgreen's. There was no doorman and no washroom in the lobby but front desk staff were always helpful and friendly.
My only complaint was that housekeeping staff, though conscientious, did not speak English well enough to understand my specific needs. The hotel also needs to change the duvets as I've discovered a blood stain on mine one night. A renovation might also be timely as my room looked quite tired and overall lighting was too dark.
Hyatt has recently changed its policy that making local calls from the room is no longer free. I never received any email about this policy change from the World of Hyatt and when I called reception, they told me it's still free. When I checked my bill prior to check-out, all my calls were charged $1 each plus telecommunications tax. When I complained that reception had told me a different story and they immediately apologized and took all those charges away from my bill.
Location location location was the biggest attribute of this hotel. Overall I was quite happy with my stay and would definitely consider going back on my next trip.

title: Nice and quiet room
text: After a poor Airbnb experience we transferred to Hyatt Union Square. Price comparable to the Airbnb. Location was great! Easy walking distance to many attractions, restaurants. Room had great shower and comfortable bed. Great place to relax.

title: Clean, comfy and convenient.
text: We have been staying here for 6 years. Great location for parents of NYU students. Very convenient to Union Square subway and weekend open air market. Avoid the overcrowding of Times Square. Great bar in lobby. Rooms available with courtyard. A gem in Union Square!

title: Very nice for 1 tiny person
text: Clean, well appointed, very up to date, plenty of outlets but ridiculously small for the price. My spouse and I were stumbling over each other. For the price we paid, I expect a bit more room. Would likely not choose again.

title: Nice except crummy wifi
text: Nice hotel, friendly front desk.  Crummy almost unusable free wifi.   Used my cell phone to connect to the  internet.   Otherwise the hotel was fine.  Decent wifi could be obtained but for a cost.  Sort of a bait and switch.

title: Extremely ill-prepared for any kind of problem solving
text:
This is my second stay here and I have to say if you experience any kind of issue in the hotel expect extremely poor customer service. In our case it was a broken A/C and fan noise outside the room that couldn’t be turned off. Btw I was also told the fan speed in the room can’t be adjusted on the top floors (over a period of 24 hrs received various versions) and while I was “parked” in another room for 4hrs the speed was easily adjustable. So either full blowing A/C in your face while you sleep or turning it off are the only two options supposedly for the top floor. Very disappointed how staff handled solutions. Only one manger from maintenance  was somewhat helpful after we can back to a 90 degree room with heat running full speed (after I was supposedly fixed). 
One star for location and one start for rooms being clean. 
Will certainly not come back here.

title: Another great Hyatt hotel
text: Believe me, folks, this is the time to work your World of Hyatt membership...Hyatt has bought so many new hotels that there is one almost everywhere you look. They are all clean and pleasant, and I enjoyed my first stay at Hyatt Union Square. Superb location--the subway at Union Square can take you anywhere...and a really good restaurant. The customer service is very good and the bed are comfortable. One thing: in common with almost all the Hyatt Hotels in which I've stayed recently, the rooms are very, very small (especially if you are paying with points only) and the furniture is shabby. Not dirty just utilitarian to begin with and then used for too many years. There things are true throughout the chain, from Hyatt Place to Hyatt Regency. Still, our perks as Globalists generally make up for it.

title: Great front desk staff
text:
Front desk staff were outstanding!  Victor, Tenzing, and others whose names we did not catch.  Friendly and helpful, specifically re our inquiries re restaurants, theater, and getting around.  

Our room was pleasant but small, and closet space was sparse for our 4 night stay.

title: Graduation visit
text: Our stay was subpar from previous times. Front desk at check in forgot to change my checkout date. Luckily I was not charged for another night. The boiler went out so we had no hot water for half a day. Food was okay. Rooms are always clean. Just an average stay for the price.

title: Do not stay under any circumstance
text: Had to change rooms 2 times and 3 room had a horrible mattress with cleaning woman's hair on the sheets. Complained and got no help at all. Paid $419+ tax per night for a completely horrible experience. Paper thin walls, staff that does not care about guest comfort.

title: Superb hidden gem in the heart of NYC
text: Outstanding service and ideal location in the heart of it all. Steps from Union Square and all the public transport you need. Restaurants, bars and venues of the Lowe East Side are all accessible. Perfect for families and couples looking for easy access and excitement

title: Long Weekend in New York City
text: My wife and I visited our son recently in NYC. We picked this hotel because of its location. It was not the least expensive hotel, but it was perfect for our stay. Our room was small but well appointed. Hotel staff was very friendly. Library Bar at the hotel was outstanding and very comfortable. We plan on staying there at our next trip to NYC.

title: Great location; small rooms, be prepared to spend money
text: Overall a solid hotel. Clean and efficient stay. Rooms are small but so is everything in NYC due to space. Food not included with stay so be prepared to spend money on breakfast; that said there are plenty of local options available.

title: A Clean and Modern Hotel
text: This was our second stay with the Hyatt Union Square. Rooms are pricey and small but very modern and clean. It's very rare that I find a hotel as clean and comfortable as this one. It's always my top pick when visiting NYC.

title: New York hospitality at its finest
text:
Could not have enjoyed the City any more thanks to the staff,
location, attentiveness and helpfulness.  Would recommend 
the Hyatt for anyone visiting NYC for any reason. A special
mention for Tisch, just a great person and super helpful.

title: It's Improving
text:
I've written before about this hotel - I stopped going because of too many poor experiences. Since I'm a World of Hyatt member and the location is close to my office, I tried it once again after not visiting for a year. The experience was better, but I still had problems. Staff was courteous and overall service was good. F&B is provided by a 3rd party contractor that does only a mediocre job. This is a drawback to this hotel because the contractor does not have "Hyatt standards". 

The problem I had was trusting the 4-hour Express dry cleaning service. I double-checked with Guest Services that 4 hours was "in play" before submitting slacks I needed for that evening. I was assured I would receive the order in 4 hours. I did not receive the dry cleaning in 4 hours, or 5 hours, or even that entire evening. They were brought to me the next morning a 6.30am  - knocking on my door and waking me up despite my "do not disturb" sign. That was very frustrating as nothing annoys me more than being promised something that can't be delivered. It would have been better to tell me 4 hours was not available. I could have then pressed the slacks myself. But in making a promise to me and breaking it, I had to cancel my plans that evening. It was very inconsiderate.

title: Overall nice stay
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed many aspects of the hotel and plan on staying here next time, just maybe would like to try a different room.  The location of the hotel was fantastic for us; very convenient to the subway, many food/morning coffee options, and shopping.  The room was the size you expect and what we've seen before in NYC.  The bed was very comfortable and overall the room and bathroom were clean. We were on a high floor and could definitely hear every noise on the street below, but the street noise was quiet enough after midnight to get a good night of sleep.   

Our only real issues with the room were some issues with the bathroom features and overall room lighting.  Our bathroom did not have any counter space - at all.  It was all sink, so while getting ready in the morning, everything had to go in the sink.  There also wasn't anywhere to hang the hand towel near the sink.  The lighting in the room was very minimal to begin with and one of the main lights in our room was broken during the duration of our stay which made the entire room very dark.  The light in the bathroom was also minimal which made it very difficult to even put makeup on.  

Overall, we liked the hotel and location and would like to try to stay again with the hopes of getting a room with a little better lighting and bathroom sink situation.

title: Hyatt Union Square —  NYC
text: The staff members at the Hyatt Union Square, NYC, are truly outstanding. This hotel’s location, condition, service, and value all are excellent. We stay at this hotel regularly and are always delighted.

title: Clean welcoming boutique hotel
text: Hyatt Union Square is a small, comfortable hotel where you are greeted with a smile. The location is fantastic - just a brief walk to Union Square, subway stops, The Strand, a movie theater and plenty of coffee shops and food options. The rooms are quiet, well-planned and have everything you need.  Highly recommend.

title: Good location, nice rooms, but expensive..
text: Great location, right at the Union Square, but the rooms are small and bathrooms are even smaller. There are some operational issues like WiFi, phones not working, etc. Overall, OK if you want to stay in NYC..

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel has impeccable service and great location!  The design is contemporary and trendy, however there are issues in the bathrooms such as missing door nobs, loose fixtures and loud garbage cans.  Could also use a better quality and variety of pillows. These are all minor fixable problems that shouldn't keep you from staying.

title: Excellent
text: Les chambres sont agréables et bien pensées. Très propre. Machine à café, fer à repasser, parapluie à disposition. Personnel très gentil et souriant. Bien placé, à 2 minutes à pied du métro. Quartier vivant. J'ai testé un des 2 restaurants dont les plats étaient délicieux.

title: Great location and modern hotel but poor service and loud
text: First the positives...  it's one of the best locations you can get in NYC if you want convenience. Union Square subways and tons of restaurants right outside the door. And the hotel is pretty modern. I was placed in a small room (about average for NYC) on the top floor (top 2 floors have larger windows than the rest and get considerably more light). The wifi was quite poor (worked better in the hallway) and the phone didn't work. Obviously a telecom problem in the room, but the lady at the front desk seemed determined to get it to work. After some back and forth (and several trips to the lobby since the phone didn't work), I requested a room change. What I got was a downgraded room (disappointing given the problem was with the hotel) on a lower floor that is much louder than the previous room, but hey the wifi works well...  But of course there's a loud family with a crying baby in the next room with a connecting door located next to the bed that isn't blocking much noise at all.  Between the loud street noise and poor sound control within the hotel, I would suggest people sensitive to noise not stay here.

title: Good location but that's it
text: Not worth the money, customer service was lackluster. Wasn't allowed to check in till 4:45 and almost missed our dinner reservations because a "rewards member" checked out late. Room was disappointingly worn down. Breakfast was good though and lobby was nice.

title: Great base for a New York Visit
text: A great site at Union square very easy to get around. Facilities are excellent with a good restaurant and bar, Gym was better than expectations with a good range of equipment. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful.

title: Cool hotel in great neighborhood
text: Room was pricey but this is NYC.  Room was small but this is NYC.  Overall the hotel is nice, clean with really cool decor. Room was in front of elevator bank but not noisy at all.  Didn't check out the restaurant but looked nice.

title: Excellent Hotel in Convenient Location
text: On a recent trip to another city, I was so disappointed by the hotels. So I was very pleased with my stay at the Hyatt Union Square New York. While the rooms were New York-small, everything was updated, fresh and clean. The staff were very kind and helpful. The fitness center was a decent sizer and clean, and the location provided easy access to anywhere in Manhattan. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Favorite Hotel in New York
text: Exceptional hotel in a great location! I always stay at the Hyatt because the staff is so accommodating! The complimentary coffee in the morning is delicious. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable!!

title: Awesome Hyatt
text: Best Hyatt in NYC. I’ve stayed at them all and this one by far beats the rest!! The staff was friendly & accommodating. The smell when u walk through the hotel is so pleasant & clean! I can’t wait to stay at this one again!!

title: Warm friendly hotel on a cold weekend
text: I booked this hotel at the last minute when another hotel messed up my reservation.  I expected a large corporate hotel and this place was not that at all.  Place definitely has a small boutique hotel feel to it.  I had brought my Mom to New York to celebrate her birthday which happened to fall during a polar vortex event.  At first I was thinking the trip was going to be a disaster.  Room wasn't ready when we checked in at around 7 pm (due to late check outs) and when we got to the room it was a little cozier than I had expected but still very nice.  The cool whisky bar was closed since it was so cold etc. That said, I was blown away by the good service and friendly upbeat attitude of everyone working at this hotel and at the neighboring restaurant.  Made a call to request a bucket of ice and it was at the room in what seemed like seconds. Great food and cocktails in the restaurant and by day 2 we were welcomed as repeat customers.  All of the hotel staff went above and beyond. Staff were even  addressing me by name by the time we moved to the Park Hyatt on day 3.  Place has a fun energy. The crowd skews youngish but we felt very welcome and I would stay here again without hesitation.   Cool part of the city to explore as well.

title: Stylish And central!
text:
Stayed to visit family in the city.
Staff was so friendly and courteous and helpful! Each and every day!
Felt like a boutique hotel!
Room had King bed and a patio outside. Couldn’t really use it given weather was rainy. Would be wonderful for springtime and summer!
Room was quite small but had lots of useful amenities. It made the most of limited space.
Bed was so comfortable as was the AC- which is usually not the case in hotels.
Room darkening curtains did a great job! 
And there wasn’t too much outside noise either. There is a sound machine that can be set for soothing or relaxing sounds to drown any outside noise but we didn’t need to use it.
Water temps were good also.
Only issue was the over styled sink faucet!!!! Didn’t ever think such a problem would occur LOLOLOL!!!! It was barely 4” above the sink and made it extremely difficult to wash hands! Have no idea who came up with that silly design!!!!! It wasn’t possible to put both hands under at the same time and made it difficult to wash contact lenses. Quite annoying! 
Hotel is a good spot for a short stay vs long stay, given rooms are quite small.

title: Family trip
text: Came to see my son in NYC. Hotel was very convenient to the Union Square trains,east and west village restaurants.  Rooms are NYC small but they make the most of the space.  Nice gym and restaurant on the premises and many others nearby. Will stay again. Staff helpful and friendly

title: Nice hotel
text:
Pulling up can sometimes be a challenge but the staff handles it very well. Everyone is very friendly and accommodating.

We had a delay checking in as our reservation was lost, it was eventually rectified. 

The room is comfortable and modern, typical city hotel size. It may seem small compared to any other hotel outside of a city if it’s your first time. The bed was firm and the pillows were awesome. Don’t expect privacy in the room, the toilet had a door, but the sink and shower was open to the rest of the room.

The food is very good. Prices are what you would expect for the area. The breakfast is exceptional, my wife had a Canadian ham omelette and I had a sandwich. The burger for dinner is really good. 

All in all, it was nice and in a great location.

title: Best sleep I ever got!
text: Quietest room in union square! Terrace and library of spirits are a must try. Paloma did an excellent job finding a room of my preference since it did not show up online. The food in room or at Bowery Rd is excellent.

title: Another inviting Hyatt property in NYC
text: Having stayed at, and enjoyed,  the Hyatt Centric on several past trips I chose to try this Hyatt to explore the Union Square and Chelsea areas. The staff was excellent and the room size was very good by NYC standards. Will definitely consider on the next visit!

title: Excelente
text: Excelente ubicación. Hotel impecable Las habitaciones que no dan a la calle son oscuras, parece siempre de noche, pero NY es una ciudad para salir y recorrer!!!! De todos modos, si tienen un dinero extra pidan con vista a la calle.

title: DONT STAY AT THIS HYATT!
text: Twice Ive stayed at this Hyatt-  Twice Ive had horrible experience with the front desk.  They were rude, disrespectful and un-trained.  My first stay I was told the room wasnt ready and I needed to wait an additional 30minutes.  I came back to check the status of the room 5 times, we finally were allowed acess at 5:50pm.  My second visit, the front desk told us that due to guests not checking out on time, we had to wait for our room to be ready.  Then, when the room was finally cleaned at 5:00, we had to wait an additional 30 minutes for it to be inspected.  When I asked for a different room, the woman was very rude and said they were fully booked.  I am a Hyatt member, and will not be returning to this hotel ever again.

title: Not sure I’ll risk it again
text:
I’ve stayed here twice, both time I booked a daytime room so I can work and take a break from the office.

Both times my room wasn’t ready when I tried to check in, even though I arrived over an hour after my daytime reservation started. Had to wait another 20 minutes. The first time I got a connecting room and the couple in the room next to mine were havinf extremely loud sex the whole time so I couldn’t work. The second time I asked for a non connecting room, but of course I got one. I don’t know what the views are like because I’ve only gotten a room that looks out to the dark and unpleasant courtyard.

The room itself is actually nice and well designed. They make good use of the space and the bathroom is nice. There is a mini fridge for your things, but no mini bar unfortunately. There are nice eateries in the hotel as well. The neighborhood is awesome and if you’re visiting, you’ll enjoy being away from touristy midtown. 

I actually think this is a really nice hotel, but maybe it’s because I booked a daytime room or what, but I just felt like they gave me the lousiest room and didn’t care about me at all. And that sucks, considering that I paid $150 to spend 3 hours at this hotel.

title: Helpful staff, convenient location
text: We just stayed one night, but it everything we wanted for a meet-up with family and friends. We had a total of four rooms at the hotel, and everyone had a great time. We parked cars with the valet, and Tenzen came out and found us when the front door was blocked by a UPS truck. We made last-minute plans with the restaurant to have dinner there as a party of 10 and they were super accommodating even though the restaurant was fully booked. We had breakfast there the next morning. Food was excellent, we never felt rushed. Great location, easily walkable to where we needed to go. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Couldn't have been better!

title: Clean and comfortable room in a great location!
text: Quiet hotel a block from Union Square. Might be a little pricey, but it 's worth staying in a safe, clean and quiet place. Hotel rooms are comfortable and have great showers. Staff is friendly. This was my 3rd stay and I will only stay here during trips to NYC.

title: Not what I expected
text: Not like the Hyatt’s in Palm Springs. Requested early check in and didn’t get it.  Small tight but above avg.  No heat the 1st night.   No closet.   Construction in the room next to us.  Outstanding Bar.  Good restaurant and the fitness center is nice.

title: great subway spot
text: excellenet location if you are looking to use the subways. very close to NYU when we came for a family visit ask for a street facing room if they have it. staff was friendly and kind, especially claudia helped us with all of our questions

title: So so
text: Adjoining restaurant not very good.  Left items in the room after checkout.  They have my contact info but never contacted me.  This was quite disappointing considering the rates they charge.  Street noise was a little loud but I guess that is NYC.

title: Quiet quality in midtown
text: What a gem in the heart of midtown.  Central for everything we needed.  Very comfortable and incredibly quiet.  Friendly staff, small but very well designed and comfortable rooms with everything that you need on hand.

title: Never Fails
text: We love staying at this hotel not too far from NYU. Hotel is modern and tranquil despite the happening scene in the bar downstairs. We would not stay anywhere else after having been disappointed at the W nearby. Staff attentive and friendly. Rooms small but very well designed.

title: Small rooms, big heart
text: I've stayed at the  Hyatt Union Square a few times since it opened and I've always been pleased with the hotel and its people.  The rooms are New York small, but they are clean, comfortable and pleasant.

title: Stylish, Comfortable and Great Service
text: It was my first time staying at this Hyatt hotel.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  The room was clean and well maintained.  I was in town to attend an event at NYU and the location worked well.  It was a good stay and what I have come to expect from the Hyatt brand.

title: Nicest staff ever
text: We stayed for 4 nights and I have to say  this is the nicest staff I have ever encountered at a hotel. And we travel a lot! We are Marriott platinum members, but this hotel is so much better than the W down the street. Ellie, Ty, and Claudia ( manager) are the  most wonderful and helpful customer service oriented people! They all went above and beyond to make sure that we had a wonderful stay. It was such a pleasure seeing Claudia every day and her professional, friendly and great personality made this visit so pleasant. The rooms are cozy, bed comfy, inside rooms quiet ( it’s nyc: you pick: quiet or view!) we will definitely be back!!

title: Needs management improvement
text:
The location is central to using the subway, sitting in Union Square Park and plenty of eateries.
The check-in time was behind by 2 hours, that was disappointing. The bathroom was dirty; the floors in the room had dust on them. It was apparent the Hyatt does not maintain a standard of cleanliness.  Last to discover the hotel was doing construction to the rooms next to ours was also a breach of service. Last, there seemed to be a total disconnect with staff in terms of being hospitable and present to their guests.

title: Another Fantastic Experience
text: One of my favorite properties in NY.   Wonderful hospitality and service.  Great food - breakfast is superb and the lunch menu exceeds expectations.  Perfect location for visiting the area.  Will definitely be back!

title: Moderno
text: Ótimo hotel para se hospedar em New York. Moderno e bem localizado, sem estar no burburinho da maioria dos turistas. A região é ótima, com bons restaurantes e comércio. Região de Universidade (NYU), com muita descontração.

title: Not up to my standards
text:
The hotel is too sterile for me.  We had no runnng water in our sink and couldn’t control the hot water in the shower.  
The location of the hotel was why I choose it, however the room are very small.  The man who checked us out was nice.

title: Modern, clean, quiet
text: Location couldn’t be beat, one block from Union Square... Room handsomely designed, with hardwood floors, minimalist decor, had all the amenities, except no fridge or microwave. Bed was super comfy. Bathroom was a bit small, but walk-in  shower was roomy enough for two and had great water pressure....

title: Disaster
text:
Whole hotel is under construction.  Construction in the next room was so noisy that I could not be in the room for more than 15 minutes.  Hotel did not have the decency to notify that construction would be occuring when checked in or when booking.  When called to see how long the shaking would continue at 10am, was told until 5pm.  This is unacceptable that there wasn't even an apology.  This made it impossible to work in the room.  When looking for a place to work had to move to the bar but the weed smoke from the street is seeping into the building.  

While the place looks nice, they need to figure out how to treat globalists.

title: Modern, Cozy, Noisy
text: Very clean roomsExcellent AtmosphereGood FoodConvenient locationIf you want to sleep, bring ear plugs. Street noise is abundant at all hours.$30 uber to 9/11 Memorial and $16 uber to Time Square.

title: Perfect location and great place to stay
text: I had poor expectations-usually prefer the uptown area - but truly enjoyed my stay here. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly throughout my stay. The room was very nice and tastefully decorated, gave me the sense of relaxation that one needs when withdrawing from the hectic street life. All amenities were present in the room which also makes it a great place when traveling for business. Union Square is, as suggested by the name, one short block away. Also the hotel’s library bar was a nice place to hang out.

title: Nice hotel, polite staff, great location!
text: Hyatt hotel that did not disappoint! Great location, easy to get to the subway, call for a taxi, shop and is an especially nice location if you are visiting someone at NYU! Staff goes above and beyond to make you feel special and meet your needs!

title: Excellent hotel
text: This hotel makes the best use of space! Love, love, love! Four of us stayed in a room and it felt as though we had room to spare! Lovely hotel! Clean, friendly and helpful staff. Delicious restaurant and cool bar!

title: Pleasantly surprised by quality, service and comfort!
text: This is not an area of NYC where I have previously stayed, but I had a very specific event to attend and this hotel was frankly the most convenient. What a delight to find out is was also one of the best hotel experiences I've had in my many visits to the city! The staff was extremely welcoming, the room was lovely, well equipped and comfortable, and both restaurants were excellent. I will put this hotel on the top of my list for future visits!

title: Lovely visit
text: This was our first visit to this Manhattan hotel and we simply loved it.  Location is very good, close to the subway for adventures all over the island.  We were greeted in such a kind manner upon check in by both the doorman and the reception desk staff.  Our room was clean and super comfortable.  Elevators ran smoothly and quickly.  We will absolutely stay at this property again.

title: Great experience
text: Great experience, excellent location. It is not cheap, and it can be a little noise because of the traffic on the street. But the staff is very welcoming, the rooms are very good and even the soundtrack at the lobby is awesome (Velvet Underground, Beach Boys, R.E.M.)

title: Idéalement placé
text: Et surtout propre et personnel au petit soin. Rien à redire. Excellent hôtel que nous recommandons sans hésiter. Il y a Tout autour de l’hôtel pour se déplacer ou manger. Les principales attractions tout autour

title: Expectation wasn’t met
text: Overall staff were friendly but was given misguided information. The quality of food from Bowery wasn’t the greatest. The cleanliness of the room wasn’t at its best due to finding empty alcohol bottle from previous guest. Got an upgraded room but doesn’t see the upgrade of the room.

title: Hyatt Union Square Hotel
text: My family and I had a great stay at this hotel!  It is very centrally located to most large attraction in the Manhattan and surrounding areas. Great subway access with trains running almost anywhere you need to go.  Highly recommend getting a metro card if staying more than a few days.  The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and courteous. I'd recommend this hotel for anyone vacationing in NYC.

title: Hyatt Union Square is the place to stay in NYC
text: We stayed 4 nights over the holidays.  From the minute we arrived the staff was so accomodating and pleasant.  We had to call for an engineer at midnight to fix a thermostat problem in the room. He came right away and was so nice and cheerful.  The location of this Hyatt can't be beat - steps to Union Sq with every subway line you'll need.  Or just a 15/20 minute walk to the best restaurants in East Village, Greenwich Village and West Village.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointing
text:
We had 2 rooms at this hotel for NYE. The hotel is nice and in a good location. The room was comfortable and modern. The problem was one of the rooms was not cleaned at all, I called when I realized at 4pm and was assured it would be cleaned up but it did not happen. The second room was partially cleaned, the towels were changed out but dirty drink glasses were placed back into their original spot instead of being replaced with clean glasses. This hotel was expensive, so I was disappointed not to have clean towels for my shower the second morning. I mentioned it at check out the the front desk staff just said sorry to hear that.
Speaking of check out; that was a crowded, slow moving disaster. I wanted to pay cash, only one person could handle cash. I gave my valet ticket to the front desk staff and they never sent for my car, they ‘didn’t know I wanted my car.’ But they did know to charge me $75 a day for parking.  So after 30 minutes checking out I had to go back in and wait 15 minutes for my car.

title: Wonderful location, lovely property, fabulous staff
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights.  The room size is about average for NYC.  However, the layout and use of space was optimized.  The bathroom had a generous vanity area, wonderful shower with excellent pressure.  The bed was very comfortable.  We asked for a quiet room and received one facing an inner courtyard which worked very well.

The fitness center is very well equipped and includes a rowing machine.

The Bowery cafe which is attached served very good breakfast and the bar area offered at least 18 amaros to choose from.

The front desk staff was friendly, hip and professional.

Highly recommend as it is a great location for exploring this area and beyond.

title: Ottima scelta
text: Siamo rimasti 5 giorni in questo albergo, siamo stati benissimo. È anche vero che a NY non vivi in albergo, si esce di mattino e ritorni la sera tardi, ma ritornare in un posto dove ti accolgono con un sorriso, disponibili ad ogni richiesta, un Wi-Fi che funziona bene dappertutto, una stanza sempre ben pulita, ti fanno considerare che hai fatto la scelta giusta. Vicinissimo alla metropolitana e ad ottimi supermercati. Non mancate di fermarvi al bar della struttura, oltre ad essere fornitissimo di tanti liquori particolari, è bello tanto da fotografare. Consigliatissimo.

title: Elegant and warm hotel in a great location
text: Hyatt Union Square is a compact yet open and modern hotel steps from Union Square, NYC, Washington Square Park and other destinations for both tourists and regular New York visitors. The rooms are bright and comfortable, the staff warm and responsive. We enjoyed drinks in the bar and breakfast in the restaurant, both spacious and vibrant venues. We look forward to our next visit.

title: Fantastic Property
text: Was very pleasantly surprised by this property. A great location with convenient subway access and restaurants around, nice corner room provided space to do a little work, and the breakfast at the restaurant was really impressive. We'd be happy to eat at the restaurant for breakfast even if not staying a the hotel - prices were reasonable compared to others in the city - and we had several great dishes over the 3 day stay (avocado toast, pancakes and a super-good value breakfast sandwich). Nice elite treatment too.

title: Well-located, but some design flaws
text: Well-located hotel - clean, well-run.   All hotels in NYC are small - but some design flaws make this one tougher than most.   (1) there's almost no storage - no closet and only the tiniest of cabinets for hanging.
