(2)  the shower controls are installed such that you have to enter the shower, close the door, and then can turn on the shower... this is not safe (scalding) nor convenient.   (3) the wood-ish tile floors in every room look warm and inviting but carry noise so you hear the staff on their intercoms outside the room.

title: NYC Union Square
text: Great location, service staff and food was excellent. Rooms and bath facilities a bit cramped. I would recommkend this location to my friends and family. Not sure what else I can say except thanks for the great service we have now used three different Hyatt locations in NYC.

title: Pricey but convenient and the only good choice in this neighborhood
text: We have stayed at the Hyatt Union Square three times. The rooms aren’t large but they are well appointed and the staff is friendly and helpful.  The restaurant is pricey, has limited hours and the service is slow.  But, the food is uniformly quite good.  The bar is well stocked but the service is slow and the ambience is poor, somewhat due to the acoustics — it is very loud, so it’s hard to chat.  In this neighborhood, the Hyatt is the best choice by far and we will continue to stay there when we visit our friends in the Village.

title: Good Hotel
text: Reasonable rates, good location, recently updated, friendly employees.  Valet parking available (very nice doorman!), though rate higher than quoted on website.  No counter space in bathroom (all sink) and poor lighting, especially for doing your makeup.  Lots of ambient light from various nightlights, bring electrical tape if this bothers you.  Would recommend overall.

title: Hippest Hyatt in NYC
text: Just love this hotel.  It’s the best located Hyatt in NYC and the perfect combo of brand consistency and boutique feel.  The food is great.  The bar has ambience and the staff is like family. Great for business people in teach and arts and for torusists who want to be in the village vs midtown.

title: Eloise on Union Square
text: I’d found out too late that I’d booked the Herald Square instead of the Hyatt’s Union Square location, and found my stay here well worth the 1 night penalty fee to change reservations. Terrific downtown location, contemporary but still grown-up with an active bar and restaurant. The room service dinner of grilled romaine and crispy potatoes and its accompanying friendly server only added to my desire to make it my home in New York.

title: Great accommodations in a great location
text: Just a few blocks from Union Square, with restaurants all around...very "cool" area with easy subway access.  Bowery Road restaurant (in the hotel) is outstanding with many interesting options.  Retail nearby as well.

title: Great place and location
text: We've stayed in a lot of NYC hotels. We've now stayed at the Hyatt 3 times and will continue to stay there. The location is convenient to our son but also to the subway and lots of shopping and restaurants. Plus the in-house bar and restaurant are fantastic. Rooms are nice, walls are thin but for the price, we'll put up with it.

title: Great Location
text: I try to avoid hotel chains but I chose this spot for its convenient proximity to my friend's Gramercy home. I was pleasantly surprised. Small yet exceedingly comfortable room with plush bed and bedding. Very quiet (at least on the backside). Nice lobby, sleek bar, and good restaurant. Biggest plus is the central location - close to so much NYC action - Union Square, Gramercy, The Strand bookstore, and Eataly. Really enjoyed my stay. Will return!

title: Christmas in New York
text: Great location, with outdoor and Christmas markets nearby at Union Square. Make sure to stop by the Bread Bakery for the best chocolate babka in New York. And right across the bakery there’s non-stop happy hour. Exceptional service!

title: Nice Hotel for the Picky Guest
text:
Conveniently located.  Few steps to the train station.  Next to several restaurants.  You will surely not be hungry.  A Whole Foods store is close by in addition to several restaurants nearby.
Best Buy, Bank of America and Capital One are also within walking distance.  
Our room was relatively small but well-designed.  Very clean. Customer service is very receptive to the needs of their guests.
Would choose this hotel again.

title: Nice hotel with one negative
text: This hotel is very well located for travel to the Union Square and Greenwich Village neighborhoods. The restaurant and bar are both terrific, the staff is professional and the rooms small but comfortable. The one item I would note is that we had prominent sound leakage from the adjacent room. Perhaps it was only our room and not a general problem, but the guests next door were playing music and speaking loudly, and it was as if they were in a corner of our own room. For the price, I would expect much better sound insulation from adjacent rooms. Ironically for NYC, street noise was no problem.

title: So nice
text: Clean, modern rooms with lots of amenities and comforts. Great service, great location at a reasonable price. The restaurant and bar are also well done - cozy, updated decor and great food. The Hyatt Union Square Hotel is my first choice when I travel to NYC.

title: Lovely hotel in the Heart of Union Square
text:
Highly recommend the Hyatt at Union Square!!

Had a restful quiet nights sleep despite being in the middle of the city that never sleeps. 

Room was very very clean and bed was super comfortable. 

Front desk staff was beyond amazing. 
They were professional and demonstrated great hospitality! 

Specifically, Alicia at the front desk went above and beyond to make certain all of our needs were met! 

Alicia was so very helpful that I would recommend the hotel to anyone who is looking for personalized impeccable service. 
Can’t thank her enough for making our stay so comfortable!

title: Great NYC Location
text: Great location in the heart of NYC without the tourist distractions. Just south of Union Square the hotel is next to several shops and restaurants as well as subway and bus lines. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff was amazing.

title: Great Vacation
text: We recently stayed in NYC to see our son-in-law run in the NYC marathon. The hotel staff was great. Hotel was very quiet, no noisy garbage trucks in the middle of the night, no sirens, very tranquil. Bed was very comfortable as well, so we both slept well. Enjoyable stay.

title: Great location, good hotel, nice staff with one outstanding member (Francois)
text: All in the title. Great location & good hotel. The staff are nice enough: friendly, smile, do their jobs but don't go out of their way except for with one outstanding guy called Francois who just went above and beyond to do whatever we needed - totally redeemed this review.

title: Nice hotel
text:
The hotel is in a great location and has really friendly staff. The rooms are a bit small but very well designed. They warned us we may hear street noise from our room but on the 6th floor it wasn’t the case. 
The pillows are divine!

title: Wonderfull staff
text:
Before i talk about about staff of this property , i should say that the hotel is located in a very good location , a center of almost every thing , the rooms are good , clean nice and stylish , the food is also good , 

But for me the most impressive thing here was the staff , unbelievably trying all they can to help fir any thing even if the request was stupid one they do their best to do it for you , from the door man till the manger , 

Indeed one of the best hotels ,

title: Great hotel and wonderful staff. Beautiful room quiet and comfortable courtyard area.
text: Great hotel and wonderful staff. From the doorman to the desk attendant very welcoming. Enjoyed the proximity of the hotel and to nearby restaurants and shops. Easy safe walking area and a lovely park in Union Square.

title: Always stay here!
text: Cannot beat the location. So near my favorite restaurants and the Union Square farmers market. Staff is accomodating and professional. The Library is fun place for appetizers and drinks. Great gym with towels and water.

title: stylish hotel in a great location
text:
great stay; rooms are smaller- but you expect that of New York. 
they have one of the best gyms in NY and a great breakfast spread!
rooms are clean and quiet throughout the night without the disturbances from outside noises- union square does get really noisy at times!!
will surely return!

title: LocationLocation!
text: This was our second time staying at the Hyatt Union Square. Love the location. Can’t beat the access to public transportation. Rooms are very comfortable. We love the junior suite. Awesome bar off the lobby and great restaurant as well. We will stay again!!

title: Great spot, friendly staff
text:
We selected this hotel for its close proximity to our daughters work. 
I was not familiar with this part of NYC, but now think it is so convenient to everywhere. 
I do not think I have ever met more friendly staff who really try to help. The rooms are fairly basic, but extremely comfortable. 
Highly recommend.

title: Room with a view
text: We booked a room with a terrace & it was a true treat.Great location & a superb staff is what you get at the high price point.The room was very compact & comfortable with everything you could possibly need. The terrace was very enjoyable & very well set-up with furniture and lovely plantings.We used it in the early Am & every evening.And the biggest surprise was how quiet our room & terrace were & we were on the 2nd floor.

title: Wonderful hotel, great location, will be back
text: We made reservations at Hyatt based on the reviews and location. Our stay was wonderful and the hotel staff, location, facilities, and decor could not have been better for us. It’s a very modern style design but cool and inviting. We enjoyed staying in the Union Square neighborhood away from the pace of Midtown and enjoyed the convenience of the subway and ease of getting taxis. Will definitely be staying here again when we return to New York.

title: Family trip
text:
We visited the city in May as a family and stayed at the Hyatt Union Square. The hotel is very New York with tasteful modern but slightly industrial decor throughout. The rooms were very clean and comfortable but the only downside was they offered very little in the way of views of the city. 
However, the location was fantastic as we were no more than 15-30mins walk from the city’s best sights. 
The staff were very accommodating and friendly and offered free coffee and tea every morning in the lobby before 9am.
We would happily stay here again.

title: Great location, but small rooms and really expensive
text:
The hotel is located two blocks from union park, from here you can take the subway or walk time square and a lot of restaurants.

The hotel is really expensive for the size of the rooms, the hotel is nice but it is in an old building

title: Fab hotel
text: Lovely hotel, rooms are bigger than average for NYC hotel, front desk staff are super nice and helpful, right on Union Square where they have a great farmers market. Its about a 30-40 minute walk to Times Square, so probably not the hotel for you if this is your main attraction. Looking forward to visiting there again.

title: Nice hotel but overbilled
text: The hotel is nice ( probably 4 on a scale of 5).  Staff is friendly and attentive. The final bill, however, correctly reflected the agreed room rate but then added 36% for “taxes and fees”.  New York taxes are high but they are NOT 36%. The rest must be hidden profit. The hotel claimed that they outsourced the billing to a third party provider and they would not reduce the bill.  With all due respect, the third party provider is not my problem

title: Central Hotel Experience
text: The Hyatt Union Square offers respite in the midst of a busy city. Located at the core of midtown, the hotel offers easy walking distance access to many subway lines and easy walking distance to much of the city. Very clean, very modern and a refreshing approach to accommodation in the city.

title: So great
text: Wow. What a find! Very centrally located near NYU and Union Square, this incredibly well designed hotel has everything you need and is eye candy. Great service. Superb pricing. And from this former New Yorker one of the best restaurants I’ve eaten at in NYC lately Bowery Road.

title: Unique hotel in NY
text: As a women traveling on my own on business, I love this hotel as it is quite unique for NY.  Great rooms, great beds.  The hotel is fairly small but this offers a more personal experience.  You feel very safe and secure and the reception staff are wonderful, very personable and friendly.

title: Hyatt Union Square New York
text: Staff is uniformly courteous and helpful. A major line Subway stop one-half block from the front door. Within two short block radius, there are a host of food options ranging from grocery, coffee shop, sandwich shop or to the higher end dining. Having a "courtyard" situated room is not about the view but an option to be further buffered from the city street sounds and the option, if so desired, to open a window for fresh air. Yes, the hotel has functioning windows. If a car service is required, book it through the hotel for the best deal. There is a constant host of NY yellow taxi and Ober cars floating around this address.

title: What The Locals Say
text: This is one of my favorite hotels in the city.  The rooms are well thought out.  I am a tough customer by the way.  So, I don't hold back. The room has a small fridge which is good, but it also offers the right snacks.  A healthy but also satisfying array of snacks; and also the TV worked well and was easy to use; and I watched two movies.  But its the outside patio rooms that are awesome.  The unique experience is listening to the sounds of the city in your own oasis.  Its everyone's city dream.  I was sitting on my back patio singing songs.  I had dinner out there too.  The shower is also spot on.  Sink had a good work area.  Work area was well fortified with AC outlets.  I had room for yoga on the floor and outside.  What else, what else...Union Square Park is right there as well, which is space aged.  I think the locals say its trendy, but touristy.  That means you! Love through writing.

title: Wonderful Weekend Getaway!
text: Wonderful way to spend my Birthday Weekend! Truly enjoyed the King Terrace room! Had one small hiccup in the reservation and Jennifer Post at the front desk resolved everything! She was lovely and made my weekend so special!

title: Very Good Choice for Staying Downtown
text: Found a decent rate for this location and was very happy with the property.  Needed an accessible room and it was a nice, clean room with a very comfy bed.  The lobby staff was truly excellent, very helpful and very accommodating.  Really knew how to make guests feel welcome.  Would highly recommend to anyone who wants to be in the Union Square Area.

title: Great location. Extremely quiet for NY.
text: Great location. Very quiet. We were on 11th floor. Extremely quiet for NY. Great dark curtains. Slept late!! Thought it was middle of night at 9:00 am.  Liked the Library of Spirits bar. Great bartender and friendly. Can’t wait to come back.

title: May be it is NY, may be it is a chain but they do not care about guests
text:
The main reason for such low rating is the front desk/reservation experience we recently had. Booked rooms more than a month in advance. We needed two connecting rooms so called them to ensure this. First response was a usual for hotel chains “we cannot guarantee you connecting rooms but will do our best”. After some discussion I was assured that we would get connecting rooms and I received an email confirming this. A week before our arrival called to confirm and this is when some issues started - once you have a reservation, it is basically impossible to talk to a live representative-all automated responses. Tried to reach a representative a day before arrival - same result. And of course when we arrived (was not late at night) - we heard from the front desk “we gave all connecting rooms to other guests”. I tried to explain to the front desk person that we had booked in advance, showed her the email confirmation but this was useless.  She was so rude and did not even try to pretend that she cared and wanted to help. She actually started lecturing me how hotels around the world worked and none could guarantee connecting rooms and some other non-sense.  I asked to talk to the manager on duty. Same result (at least he was not rude). Finally he promised to move us to connecting rooms next day (we booked for 5 nights). Of course nothing happened next day. They really do not care and this is not a cheap hotel to explain such attitude. 

Hotel itself is ok but regular rooms are really small and “courtyard” view is ugly and depressing even on high floor like 8. Housekeeping was ok.

title: Nice Hyatt in Great Location
text: Nice, clean hotel in a convenient area of Gramercy. Nice staffand decent size rooms for NYC!  Plenty of restaurants - and the world outside the front door!  Parking garage located across the street is convenient.

title: Good hotel in great location
text: This is a good hotel. If you have business in Astor Place then you cannot beat the location. Also lots of good restaurants in the area with a wide range of cuisines. Rooms are large a comfortable for NYC. Staff is helpful and friendly.

title: 5 night stay
text:
On this trip to NYC, I was helping my daughter move into her new apartment in the East Village so I needed a place within walking distance (Hyatt Union Square was 1/2 mile from her apartment, about a 10 min walk) and not $400/ night as I was staying 5 nights, so I decided to give this hotel a shot.  
From the moment I stepped out of my Uber, the staff rushed out to greet me, help with my bags and check in.  The decor is chic & stylish and very clean. I requested a room overlooking 4th Ave which I was given.  The room was extremely clean and functional.  The bed was very comfortable, the linens of high quality and in good condition.  The bathroom was very well designed, clean and functional. Nice fluffy towels and great toiletries. The wifi was fast, as I did have some work to do while I was there.
But what really won me over was the staff.  A big shout out to Victor Mena, Ty Davy, Chris Singh, Kash, Tenzing and everyone else who responded so happily and professionally to all of my requests!  Thank you for making a stressful move much more pleasant.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Nice, quiet rooms with amazing service!
text: The hotel was very clean, Staff was very friendly. Especially the barkeepers were able to make every wish come true! The receptionists were truly amazing - e.g. when we were waiting for our cab in the rain they immediately ran out with umbrellas and offered us the Hyatt car for an airport ride! They were truly awesome!

title: Fabulous NYC accommodations.
text: The Hyatt Union Square is the perfect location and accommodations for an ideal NYC visit. The room was so comfortable and beautiful, and staff was always knowledgeable, friendly, and welcoming. I will definitely be back to stay.

title: Bello, spazioso e pulito
text:
L’hotel si trova in una location perfetta, il quartiere di Union Square.
Le stanze, per essere New York sono grandissime e molto silenziose (eravamo solo al 5 piano) con sufficientemente spazio di capienza, bagno spazioso e completamente nuovo. 
Veramente bello. C’è anche un bar decisamente suggestivo al pianterreno parte dell’hotel.
La colazione non l’abbiamo provata
Permanenza perfetta.

title: Short trip to manhattan
text: This was our first stay at this property.  The hotel is very nicely appointed, the staff friendly and professional, and the small rooms smartly designed.  I worked in the Union Square often for many years, but generally ventured north.  We explored the neighborhood south to the Bowery and now love that area.  This Hyatt is in a great location and the food and beverage options in the hotel are well suited to the neighborhood.

title: Hyatt Union Square Did Not Dissapoint
text: Our recent visit to Hyatt Union Square was an excellent experience. All of the staff members were considerate & professional. Our room was of good size for NYC. Adequate storage for a family of three. The hotel is well maintained and clean. Amenities are exceptional. The location is outstanding!  A vibrant area but not too overcrowded. A nice assortment of coffee shops, restaurants, yoga studios, easy access to NYU and wonderful shopping in close proximity. Within a block you can hop the train to visit other areas & tourist attractions of the city. Our family is extremely picky about our hotel accommodations and I struggle to think of any negatives. There is a fire station a block away...If you are a light sleeper, you might request an even number room on the interior of the building. However, ear plugs are provided. It’s NYC...Street noise is out of anyone’s control. It certainly shouldn’t deter you from the Hyatt at Union Square. Exceptional service and well appointed accommodations trump any small con I could relay in this review. We will definitely return!

title: Muy buen servicio
text:
Hotel muy bien ubicado y muy atentos y serviciales 
El desayuno está bien 
La cama muy cómoda con servicio se internet incluido
El baño cómodo y con bata y pantuflas de toalla. 
Tiene un restaurante y un bar agradables

title: Great for working moms
text: The whole hotel staff was extremely careful and gracious at freezing and handling my breast milk. Dealing with pumping and storing milk while traveling is a huge pain and stressful usually. I would highly recommend this hotel for working moms. They even have a small footrest in the shower to shave your legs. For once you can tell a hotel has women involved in the design and management. Special thanks to Brianna who was herself a working mom and took extra care to give the rest of the staff a heads up on my milk storage needs. Thank you!

title: Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms
text: Perfect location for our needs. Union square is just one block north, with trains that can take you all over the city. Most of our business for this trip was in Greenwich Village and Brooklyn, so easy walk within the village, and easy to get trains nearby. Bustling area, can be noisy. Staff was friendly with each interaction and the hotel was generally very clean and felt new. Really cool vibe overall. Again, location was perfect for our trip.

title: Love this hotel
text: Staff is outstanding ..service with a smile!! Eager to help on anything. Great location!! Rooms are different sizes. Showers only. Refrigerator in each room. A bar and restaurant are connected to hotel. Nice exercise room.

title: Great place to stay while in New York.
text: I am always looking for a good place to stay while in New York that is situated in and around Union Square. I stop in for business, but to also visit my children going to college nearby so the Hyatt Union Square hits all the musts for me. It is hip enough for my kids and their friends to visit us at, the restaurant is high quality and provides thoughtful dishes my choosy socially conscious crew would want and the Distillery Library next door has 700 bottles to choose from for after dinner drinks (pre going out). The staff are not pretentious, but still pay attention to service and detail which makes me feel like a welcome valued guest. Union Square mass transit is steps away and make it easy for us to navigate the city's other hip neighborhoods. I'd recommend this property as a good choice when staying in this area of town.

title: Stylish hotel with excellent service
text: One of my absolute favorite places to stay in NYC! My family and I have stayed here multiple times and will continue to book stays here when we need accommodations in the Union Square Park/Lower East Side area. The entire staff is stellar. Great customer service. The decor is modern and stylish. The rooms are impeccably clean. They are also surprisingly spacious and quiet for hotel rooms in NYC.

title: High class stay at even higher class prices. Not for the squeamish.
text: Booked in solely due to location. Was told that the room included two breakfasts. Instead I was charge $65 for the breakfast. Staff refused to listen, Classy place with outrageous prices. Burn your money.

title: Great Hotel, Tiny Toilet Space
text:
Perfect location.  A 10-15 minute walk to NYU, lots of dining options nearby and very safe area.  Close enough to all the action but not terribly noisy at night.  
Check-in/out staff was GREAT. Very responsive and knowledgeable about the area. Friendly and mindful.  I arrived early and they were able to accommodate my request to check-in early, which was also very nice.  
The room was nice.  The water is hot, the water pressure in the shower was perfect and the amenities were nice. The only downside is that the toilet space is ridiculously small.  They converted a closet space into a toilet area. That is really unacceptable.  Hard to potty.

title: Disappointed
text: Stayed for 18 days.  The room was dirty upon arrival and smelled of mildew.  We found used qtips in the bathroom and empty toilet paper rolls.  Terrace only had weeds growing in the pots and no cushions.  Rooms was loud because they booked a bridal shower next door.  And then a guest with a dog, which barked all the time.  We will be looking for another place next year.  Standards have dropped at this hotel.

title: Perfect Hotel!
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel for several reasons:
Easy walk to NYU, Washington Square, Union Square and SoHo
“Boutique-like” even though a Hyatt
Nice and comfy rooms
Excellent service
Will definitely stay here again!

title: Continues to impress
text: I have stayed at the Hyatt Union Square every year for the past several years and continue to be impressed. The staff at the hotel are all incredibly friendly, professional and helpful. I cannot say enough about their efforts to go above-and-beyond to assist guests. The convenient location allows you to easily walk to Union Square, the Village, Soho, Tribeca, midtown and beyond. I recommend this hotel without hesitation.

title: Convenient location, nice hotel, friendly staff
text:
Nice location, convenient walking distance of everything in the Union Square area. I walked to the park and to my office, and there are lots of good restaurants for lunch and dinner nearby, plus a great coffee shop with amazing pastries! 

Very friendly and helpful staff.

Was just there one night for business travel. Room is small but works...the desk is at the foot of the bed, so there's less than a foot of space between the chair and the bed when your working, but I liked the work space and was thankful for the free wi-fi!

Nice shower, comfy bed. The hotel is a bit noisy...they provide complimentary ear plugs! Seems like all noises in the hall echo and amplify, but I slept well regardless.

Ask about getting a room with a view. I could see 3 buildings and the rooftop HVAC from my room (#0514), but my boss was down the hall on the same floor and had a nice view.

title: Love this hotel
text: I regularly visit NY alone to visit my daughter at university and always choose to stay here . The staff are always friendly and approachable , the beds very comfortable and rooms clean. The restaurant and bar are both high quality and as a solo traveler I feel very comfortable being in either. A large hotel with a boutique feel . Well done Hyatt

title: Great Hotel
text:
We have stayed here several times visiting our daughter and it is a wonderful place. The service is great and it is dog friendly too. Since we started bringing our little dog we love to stay here. 

The Library (bar) serves great drinks in a relaxed environment. 

We will be using this as our base of operations when visiting our daughter. 

Only thing that is a little unusual is the bathroom layout. Some of the rooms don’t have a traditional layout. So if you are traveling with more than yourself and you are private, you should mention that at check in.

title: Where do I begin to brag about this place???
text: One of the nicest, cleanest, friendliest places I have EVER stayed at in NYC (and I've stayed in many)  Great staff.  Fabulous location.  Modern, clean, and large room.  I can't think of one single thing to rate below 5 stars.  BTW, perfect location for restaurants and subway.  Would stay here again if I needed this location.

title: GREAT LOCATION! GOOD FOOD! EXCELLENT SERVICE!!!
text:
Great location, Good food, Excellent service, the Bar the Best!!
Recomendation of the staff A Plus, Near Norstrom Rack, near Union Square, near Washington Square, the gym have everything you need! We are so happy with our vacation.

title: Home Away From Home
text: Hyatt Union Square is my first choice when travelling to New York.  Staff is excellent and the rooms are top shelf.  I always feel welcome and comfortable when I visit.  The front desk staff is very helpful and the restaurant is quite nice.  I have stayed here on numerous occasions, staying in rooms on various floors, and have never been disappointed.

title: Clean and friendly
text: Great hotel for nyu parents. Lots of good restaurants,  movies and both Union and Washington Squares are full of activities. Cost can be high but I was able to get a very good price on an early summer weekend.

title: Perfect spot for my trip
text: I read a ton of reviews on this property and others in the general area. I chose it because despite some of the negatives, it had a location that was good for me. I'm so glad I did. It was perfect. I was in town on business and also to visit my daughter who goes to school in the area. It was so nice to be in a quieter spot (versus Times Square area) and to walk around outside without being in the middle of chaos. I felt super safe and welcomed. The staff was extremely nice. Yes, the room was a bit small but not stupidly so. If I had one more person with me, we could manage but it would be tight. For a solo work trip it was just perfect. I LOVED my room with the terrace. Highly recommend. Ear plugs in cute little pouch on pillow was a nice touch but I didn't need them. Rooms and bathrooms were updated nicely. Pocket doors allow for more room in the bathroom and they don't skimp on towels. Slippers and nice robe for use. I read reviews that complained about the housekeeping. They leave a card in the room that clearly states how often your room will be cleaned and that it can be at any time between 9-6pm. If people read that stuff they wouldn't post negative comments. Just relax and enjoy the area. I have yet to find a hotel that has everything exactly as I want it but this one does a great job. Lots of outlets and ports on the desk and side tables. Lots of lights. One block from Union Square and the whole area is just so comfortable. This is my go-to hotel for my trips to New York from now on.

title: Great hotel in great location
text: I stayed here for business. Nice hip, modern hotel with well appointed rooms. The fitness center was surprisingly big for this size hotel, 3 ellipticals and space for weights, stretching, etc.  The restaurant looked great and the bar space was relaxing to chill after a day of work. The rooms comfortable and mine was quiet. I can imagine facing the street might be noisier as mine faced in.

title: 立地がいいホテル
text: ユニオンスクエアが目の前で立地的には抜群です。ホテル室内も設備が整っていて清潔、快適に過ごせました。土曜日はユニオンスクエアマーケットがお勧めです。

title: Quality service.
text: Quality service.  Friendly, helpful and professional staff. Great location. Rooms clean and modern. Restaurant and bar on site are good. On a side street near Union Square so not noisy. Welcomes business people and families.

title: Great location and decent value for NYC
text: The Hyatt at Union Square is an excellent hotel in a great location. The rooms are not large but a perfect size. Bathroom is nicely appointed with a walk in shower. Soaps are generous size. Request an interior room for less street noise.

title: Great customer service and room service
text: Customer service was incredible. In room dinning took a bit of time but was well worth the wait as the food was delicious. However, too much city noise from the third floor which made it hard to rest initially.

title: Perfect Stay
text: We stayed here for our daughter's 21st Bday which coincided with her move into a dorm for a summer school (college) program near the hotel. The location was perfect--we were easily able to walk her luggage to her dorm which was under 10 minutes by foot. We loved the attached restaurant and bar. Staff was very helpful, professional, and not the least bit pretentious. Couldn't have been happier, and we plan to return for our anniversary which is the same weekend she finishes school.

title: Muuy bueno
text:
La ubicación es excelente!
Aunque los Hyatt son regularmente muy grandes en otras ciudades, este tiene el tamaño acorde a la Gran Manzana. 
El mini bar está muy completo. La regadera tiene la presión perfecta para relajarte después de un día caminando por toda la ciudad.
Las almohadas te dejan descansar toda la noche, además de que no se escucha tanto el ruido exterior como en otros hoteles. 
Muy recomendable!

title: Almost Excellent but will return!
text:
Pros
Outstanding Staff...not just friendly but also you got the sense they are real people who are aware of what's  going on and think, not just robots trained to follow se set of procedures. Very refreshing. Would come back just for that. 

Location...Union square. Astor place. Happening. Food places. Easy access to everything. 

New / Good condition with good design sense

Cons
Smallish rooms even if that is standard for NYC
Sound insulation between rooms not great so get a room at the end of the corridor
Rooftop bar is now closed due to complaints from the neighbors! Boo!

title: Great location
text:
The location is fantastic , lots of shops and places to eat near by.  
Our first night was a disaster , the walls are paper thin so you  hear everything . 
The first we had a guy sing loudly all night repeating the same song over and over. In the morning I went down and told them the first girl said not much we can do but the other receptionist moved our room.  The rooms are pretty small even though you are paying top dollar.
Breakfast in the Bowery is very nice.
All in all not a bad Hotel just beware the walls are thin

title: Great location and lovely hotel
text:
Great Manhattan location with easy access to most parts of town. Rooms are small but standard for NY and very clean and up to date. Restaurant downstairs is lively and food is very good. Room service also had a good selection and were prompt.
Will stay again.

title: New York Gem
text: I found this hotel to be extremely comfortable and friendly. The front desk always greeted me as I passed by. I even had problems with my Ipad and two of them helped me work out the kinks since I am not technologically savvy.

title: Totally enjoyed the hotel.
text: I love this location and the hotel did a great job of being a safe haven A perfect haven after a long day of walking.  Surrounded by the Mecca of foodies favorites and hidden bars.  walking distance to so much of what makes the East Village the best part of town.  The staff however, made this hotel even better.

title: Great boutique-style hotel
text: Located in a nice area and within walking distance to lots of good restaurants, shopping etc. Staff are super friendly and accommodating. They have a nice sitting area in the lobby as well. Rooms are clean and neat. Can’t ask for more!

title: Great room and service from the staff
text: This would be 5 star except for the room service breakfast.  They served oatmeal and coffee lukewarm and without a spoon.  Everything else is great.  The rooms are small but so is everything in NYC.  This was the quietest room I have been in NYC and I have stayed at several hotels here.  The beds are very comfortable, the baths are great and the linens and towels are good quality.  I like the fact that they have wood floors instead of carpet.  Feels much cleaner and no odors.  The location is perfect,  The staff is friendly and helpful.  I will stay here again.  Pick one of the courtyard facing rooms if you don't want to hear street noise.

title: Quick Business Trip
text:
Location is excellent. Very handy for walking as well as Subway. Felt safe. Hotel is modern with a great restaurant and bar called the Library of Distilled Spirits. 

Rooms are very well appointed and serviced really well. Even the shower was powerful. No Cramer low flow issues here. 

Will be my goto hotel for business in NYC from now on.

title: Boutique Design W/Outstanding Service
text: Lots of choices in the area, with Nomad, Eventi, Gramercy hotels all nearby but Hyatt Union Square delivers on all aspects; its new, beautiful modern design, rooms are decent size for NY, quality amenities, and outstanding service for a boutique hotel.  It is also a different league above the W Union Square which has become dated. In terms of value, this is by far the best choice in the area and you get Hyatt points as well!

title: Booming A/C compressor's start-up is sleep depriving
text: Clean contemporary room with plenty of electrical and data outlets, good internet signal, great location, attentive staff, and an aged room air conditioning compressor that booms upon startup and continues throughout operation.  Do not plan on sleeping well.

title: Outstanding Staff/Great Location
text: The staff was outstanding!  My wife was in a wheelchair.  The staff was quick with opening the door, hailing cabs, etc.  The staff always spoke to us as we were coming and going from the hotel.  the hotel was conveniently located for our needs.  Will definately go back again!

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text: We had a family celebration to attend and needed a hotel for just one night.  We found the  Union Square Hyatt and totally enjoyed our stay.  The rooms were well designed and well appointed and a bit more spacious than the typical Manhattan hotel room.  The staff were lovely, and the fitness center among the best that I have seen at any chain hotel.  The location is great with Union Square close by and many restaurants and cafes.  Wish we could have stayed longer.

title: Love staying at the Hyatt Union Square
text: This was our second time staying at this property. The location is excellent and the staff is welcoming and super polite. I like staying here because it's in the Village which is lots of fun and you can conveniently walk to the subway system as well.

title: Be careful
text: The Hyatt at Union Square is an above average hotel in Manhattan. The room is small like is typical in the city. The service is correct, but average. The location could be excellent depending of your plans in NYC. But!! Be careful with the bike path in front of the hotel. The biker  go in both directions. I saw a lady,  probably in he mid sixties,  being hit by a bike while trying to walk to a taxi. She was badly hurt. I think the hotel needs to have a person 24/7 in front of the entrance to avoid such incidents. And the city should study ways to alert pedestrians of the dangers of irresponsible bikers and perhaps make them financially responsible of accidents they are involved.

title: Basic, not luxury and poor service
text:
Perhaps I was spoilt as I had moved from a suite at the Park Hyatt to a basic room here. I love the area here, more enjoyable around Union Square and feels more normal than the uptown feeling around 57th. Love walking the streets around the hotel as there are so many attractions.
The hotel itself though is not special, I was stunned when I moved into the room allocated, certainly not luxury, certainly not high ceilings and certainly no spaciousness or views.
They moved me to a room that had a better layout and I felt there was some space to work, move and relax.
The service though is totally inadequate, most are trivial in themselves but when it keeps happening, then you feel there is an inherent problem of no management or supervision.
-  asked for a wakeup call on my first night, going to a wonderful restaurant that would 
   have charged me $400 for non-appearance, no wake up call
- locked out of my room at 7 on the first morning, had to get my key recut
-  no room service, I understood they don't replace towels but didn't realise I was 
   opting for no cleaning or making the bed - had to go the desk about 6 on the second 
   night to ask how did the room service occur
-  terrible inhouse restaurant, tried to get breakfast but took an eternity, they seemed to 
   have about 10 servers (for not many more diners) , none of whom came near me 
   and then the excuse was that they were short staffed
-  mentioned some of these in passing to the front desk and they offered to comp me 
   for a drink in the bar when I returned from dinner, when I came to pay on departure,
   the drink was on my bill
-  they helped organise a driver to get to JFK on departure instead of me getting an 
   Uber - the driver must have asked me about 10 times was I paying cash,
   kept saying yes but even at the airport, he thrust his hands in my stomach and 
   asked, are you paying cash
   I know it's New York but in future, I'll stick to Uber which is so more professional
I know I can't blame the hotel for this other than vetting their drivers but it's not a good way to leave a city.

title: Favorite New York stay so far
text:
As mentioned in the title, I really liked my stay at Hyatt Union Square. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was neat and the breakfast was delicious every time. Location was perfect too for me, both for restaurants, shopping and work.
Highly recommend it!

title: Nice stay at the Hyatt
text:
Booked the Hyatt for a long weekend in NYC on the recommendation of a TA poster.  Location was great, easy walking to Chelsea, East Village, etc.  Room was very clean and a nice, comfortable size.  Ate/drank at both the bar and restaurant on premises, no complaints there.  Had a problem with our key one day and it was taken care of (battery in the door card-reading mechanism had died) very quickly. Room facing the street on 5th floor...could hear street noise but nothing that kept us up at night.

Would stay here again next visit!

title: Special trip- management heard us
text: In NYC w/my 87 yr old father for annual conference. Booked jr suite here, instead of conference’s discounted rooms at nearby hotels so dad would be more comfortable. Unfortunately, numerous “issues” with our suite detracted from otherwise lovely hotel in great location. I spoke to manager Alejandro. He bent over backwards to make it up to us. My dad and I were very impressed that management heard us, and understood this was a special trip. We felt valued and would def stay here again. Great fitness center and restaurant, too.

title: I would gladly make it a 5 star if they had a good restaurant and lounge/bar.
text: Rooms are nicely furnished, bed comfortable and bedding is good. It is low key and very pleasant. Ask for anything you need and the staff is responsive. This is my go to hotel in New York. I highly recommend it.

title: Excellent staff, room, and location
text: We've travelled quite a bit recently and the Hyatt Union Square has the friendliest staff by far. They did everything to make our stay perfect. The rooms were very clean with wood floors and no dirty carpet. They are a little larger than some NYC hotel rooms, with many amenities. This was my first stay in the Union Square neighborhood and I can't recommend it enough. The best coffee, food, and shopping were all within a short walking distance. For great food and cocktails you don't even have to leave the hotel. When you stay be sure to walk around the corner to shop at The Strand bookshop.

title: Great location and very comfortable rooms
text: I really love the location of this  hotel, so close to so many downtown activities and Union Square park. Rooms are compact but with lots of amenities to find hidden carefully within; coffee maker, work desk and chair, plush robe, wonderful shower, very comfortable bed with extra pillow and blanket, wifi and large screen tv all without making the room space feel crowded. Staff were warm and welcoming, with fruit and treats in the lobby that day celebrating their fifth anniversary. We walked to good restaurants and the New School conference right around the corner. There is some noise from the street but not enough to be a problem and probably less on higher floors.

title: Great Union Square Location
text: This was our first stay at this hotel but it won't be our last.  Very nice room, hip lobby, great staff.  Centrally located, right near lots of great shopping, eating and the subway.  Room was very spacious unlike many downtown hotels.

title: Excellent place to stay while at NYU
text: The staff at this hotel was extremely helpful and made our stay that much easier.  The rooms are small but very clean and the location is perfect for visiting NYU. Breakfast potatoes were to die for! Highly recommended.

title: boutique feel
text: Good stay. Friendly and clean in and out. Location is good esp if riding subways. Food is good with less expensive alternatives all around. Strand bookstore and clothing outlets within one block for rainy days.  Be aware of nearby fire station when picking lower floor room.

title: fine hotel
text: this hotel is a little strange. the rooms are kind of dark and odd and small, but they are still comfy. colette was nice at the front desk. i thought that the bar was cold. the location is great. not much more to say because it is adequate and fine.

title: A Must Stay
text: Welcoming staff and convenient location. Within walking distance to many fine shops and eateries. Vibrant bar and restaurant.  Comfortable rooms, easy check in and out.  Great for a weekend or for business.

title: Hyatt Union Sqaure
text: Check in and room was nice.  Staff was friendly upon arrival.  The gym equipment was disappointing as none of the entertainment systems were working - staff didn't care much when I told them.  The bar was awful - The Library of Distilled Spirits.  The waiter as well as the bartender did not have it together .  Didn't know how to make a drink and it took forever.  Almost missed a dinner reservation.  Advice - skip the drink!

title: Great business stay
text: Stayed here for business as it was close to the office. Had everything you need for the stay. Beds were really comfortable, amenities in the bathroom were great. The location is excellent, 30 seconds away from the subway, right on Union Square with lots of places to eat and drink. Excellent front of house services!

title: Amazing front desk staff
text: I have been having to come to nyc weekly the past few months.  I few like I am coming to my second home when arriving.  The front desk staff is what makes this hotel the only one I want to stay at.  For the last stay Whitney went above and beyond to help me find a room.  She is always helpful and friendly. Of course all the other staff is equally wonderful.  It’s this level of personalization that keeps me coming back.

title: Hyatt union square
text: Really nice hotel for this location. Service and staff are terrific and well trained. Restaurant was also really great both food and service.  And room service was quick as well. Only draw back is bathrooms are small for more than one person. I have stayed here a couple of times and will certainly stay here again when I need to be in the Village.

title: Worked Hard to Ensure We Had a Good Experience
text: As a frequent NYC traveler, finding a hotel with comfortable, quiet rooms to rest and get work done, yet also exuding a hip, upbeat vibe has been a challenge. From the moment you walk in and are greeted by warm smiles from door and front desk staff, it is clear this Hyatt values your business.  Front Desk Manager, Corretta, worked through some issues for us with a genuine "guest-first" attitude, and followed-up to make sure we were content. We look forward to many more stays with the Hyatt Union Square.

title: Magnifico hotel - boutique posizione perfetta
text: Sono stata a Dicembre con amici. Premetto che New York è la mia città preferita, era la mia sesta volta li. L’Hyatt in Union Square è un albergo boutique, di design. Le camere sono stupende anche se un po’ piccole ma con una vista mozzafiato. Strategica la location: a 15 minuti a piedi dal West V. e Meetpacking: sotto l’hotel hai la metro e puoi andar ovunque.. Eccellente il servizio di pulizia! Andateci !

title: Comfort, Style, Luxury!!!
text: After a night at the bar, we decided to stay at the hotel! Beautiful, well- appointed, excellent service, from check- in to check- out, and, for us, a terrific location, just south of Union Square! Breakfast room service was quick and delicious!

title: The Perfect NY Hotel!
text: I spent Friday night at the Hyatt after a very long day of moving my son up from D.C. into his new apartment.  The check-in was easy and the room was great!  I booked a King room and the hotel upgraded me to a King room with a large patio/balcony.  The bed was really comfortable, the room was nicely decorated, the shower was excellent, and I loved the really soft, hoodie style bathrobe.  There was almost no street noise other than 1 siren in the middle of the night and the hotel provided ear plugs (which I didn't use). I did not eat at the Hyatt but I grabbed a glass of wine in the bar before heading to bed and the bar was hopping.  I will definitely be back!

title: Great Stay at Hyatt Union Square
text: I stay at Hyatt Union Square whenever I need a hotel in NYC. I love the location of the hotel, and the accommodations are excellent. This past weekend I was upgraded to a suite which was huge (500 sq. feet) with a wrap around terrace overlooking the city. The suite was very nicely decorated and furnished, the bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was enormous. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Union Square Gem
text: Great location, close to everything and easy check in. Wonderful stay. Would highly recommend. My room was upgraded without a request. The only thing would be ask for extra pillows as they were a bit flat

title: NYC Trip for Business
text:
When I travel to NYC for business, I stay at the Hyatt Union Square because it’s close to the office. 

I’m rating it excellent because I’m considering NYC expectations. For example, the room is tiny, but is comfortable.

I loved the bar area and had a great burger there. The fitness room is also simple and well-appointed. There’s lemon water available and towels, which is a nice plus. 

It’s the little things that make this hotel special to me when I travel here for work.

title: Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay!
text: Stayed for a week over the holidays and everything was perfect! Truly exceptional customer service from all of the staff. Excellent location, spotlessly clean, and very comfortable. We will stay again!

title: Amazing stay and wonderful staff!
text:
Recently stayed here with a group of girlfriends and everything was absolutely perfect! The staff was accommodating from the moment we arrived and checked in to the moment we left. Everyone in the group commented how gorgeous the entire hotel was and it made our NYC weekend that much better, even with all the rain we got!! :)
Amazing hotel and most definitely will be staying here in the future!

title: Wonderful Staff!
text:
Each time I come back to this well located and wonderful hotel, I’m greeted by the most helpful and kind staff! Françoise,
Tenzing, Alisha and Coretta the on duty supervisor were helpful everyday! Fiato the bartender at the hotel bar is friendly and thoughtful. These staff members, the amenities,m and location are the top reasons why I continue to return to this hotel!

title: Hyatt Union Square is a Gem
text: Exceptional Customer Service and perfect location. The rooms are on the small side but not necessarily for NYC. The quiet boutique hotel with a perfect location, coupled with the wonderful hospitality more than made up for the small room.

title: Business trip, with my daughter visiting for weekend
text:
This hotel stands out amongst many others I have stayed at. So much so, that I do not stay anywhere else now in NYC.

My daughter took ill, and had to return back to the hotel as her airline refused her boarding due to being so ill.

She has been take care of by the hotel staff at such a high level, that I am beside myself with gratitude.

This is the standard that other hotels need to follow.

A shame there is not 6 stars

title: Business for me, Vacation for wife!
text: First time at this Hyatt and it was AWESOME!  Tenzing, Chis, Francois’ and ESPECIALLY Victor were the best... Very helpful with cabs, car service, food and sights to see.  The room was very comfortable and plenty of space to work.  The rainfall shower felt good on early morning wake-up!  We will definitely be back.

title: Bad front desk staff
text: They did not make up my room and I complained .   I speak Spanish , English , German and French . I complained in English to the front desk lady Monday morning .  She just looked at me and said I am sorry .  One minute later the door man came to me to tell me in Spanish that the rooms are cleaned every two to three days .... I was standing there .  The front desk woman asked him " Did you tell her ?"  I was in front of her ... lady ... how disrespectful can you be.

title: Winter visit
text: We have stayed here twice since last review in October. The issue with the bathroom sinks was taken care of. We have adopted the Hotel as our Manhatten place to stay. Attention to detail is impressive. They do it right!

title: Great location when visiting the East Village area.
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. Our room was well appointed and immaculate. The staff was just great too. We enjoyed a couple meals at the attached restaurant, Bowery Road. Great menu featuring local produce. We look forward to coming back.

title: Lovely stay!
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The location is perfect and convenient to everything. The staff were all extremely attentive and professional. They quickly addressed and needs we had, and were always pleasant. Seriously can't say enough positive thing about the staff. 

We also appreciated that the common bathrooms in the lower level are gender neutral and each stall is private. 

Our room was very comfortable overall. As with any hotel in NYC, it is on the smaller side. The only issue was lack of storage space - we had a hard time finding ways to organize our clothes and other items. 

Otherwise, it felt like enough space for a couple. The bathroom is a bit awkward and might be an issue for friends traveling together. The toilet is its own room with a pocket door and there is not much sound privacy. The shower has a frosted glass door but it is not completely private and is open to the rest of the room. Our toilet room could have benefited from a deep clean, but otherwise the room felt very clean. The toiletries are CO Bigelow and smell delish. The bed was comfortable and we did not find the street noise too loud (we were on the 10th floor). 

We had room service a couple times; it was delicious and very fast. It is definitely on the expensive side, as was the minibar. We had to frequently ask for extra (free) coffee pods as only two were provided at a time. Also, the coffee pots were really inconsistent. Our first one stopped working altogether; we got a second one and it worked but didn't brew complete cups and leaked occasionally.

We stayed in an Urbane Sky room. It was nice, but not sure it was worth the added cost. It was nice to be on a higher floor and this likely limited the amount of street noise we had. Generally, the room was very quiet although if people stopped to talk in the hallway you could hear them very clearly.

We would definitely stay here again.

title: If only...
text:
I was able to get a good night sleep in the room. Avoid the room behind the elevator.  You hear it going up and down all nite long. It dies down around 1am but starts up again at 4am. And to think this was confirmed at check in to be a quiet room. 

Otherwise everything else was fine. The room was small but clean and down for one person. I didn't touch the robe as it looked well worned out. The hotel is in a great location, close to the subway and restaurants.

title: Visit to NYC Feb 2018
text: Had a great visit to this hotel.  Excellent location in Union Square.  Clean rooms and lobby.  Comfortable bar area.  Helpful staff.  Quiet environment.  Efficient room recovery.  Close to things that I want to visit.

title: Far beyond my expectations
text: I’ve heard great things about this hotel but always like to experience things for myself, I couldn’t be happier I did. From the overall appearance of the hotel to the friendly accommodating staff, they made my birthday stay far beyond what I was initially hoping for. The Premier Suite was something out of a movie , outdoor patio that wraps around from the living room to the bedroom , tv in the mirror in the master bedroom, and a shower that could fit close to 10 people. When it came to food I didn’t even have to leave the hotel, a wonderful well versed menu for room service which many other hotels lack. The valet and express checkout help to make my departure a quick and pleasant one, although I wish I could’ve stayed longer ! All in all one of the best hotel experiences I’ve had.

title: Great location, great customer service
text: We stayed here over Christmas weekend.  The staff offered little treats in the lobby, a nice holiday touch.  Although we booked a double, our room was set up for one person.  Housekeeping took care of that immediately.  The bar was comfortable and well-designed.  Thank you, Victor, for your attention at the front desk.

title: Amazing Customer Service!
text: I had a great time staying at the Hyatt Union Square. Coretta at the front desk really made our trip. She was extremely accommodating when we arrived early and made sure to get us an early check in. She was very helpful and ensured we had everything we needed. The room was great and awesome location.

title: Solo buena ubicación
text: La ubicación en NY es muy importante, y este aspecto escla fortaleza de este hotel, muy céntrico y con una gran estación de metro a unos cuantos pasos...sin embargo las habitaciones del hotel son muy pequeñas, con casi nulo espacio para guardaropa y zapatos. Aunque el hotel es relativamente nuevo, falta de mantenimiento en las habitaciones y baño. Habitaciones ruidosas si dan a la calle.

title: Good location.  Poor housekeeping.  Loud, small rooms.
text:
We stayed here over the MLK weekend.

I enjoyed the hotel's location, right off of Union Square.  It was a nice change from the big hotels in midtown Manhattan.  Subway stops were within steps of the hotel, as was the Union Square Green Market, a Whole Foods, a great NYC bookstore, and multiple restaurants.

The accommodation was okay.  The decor was stylish; the room was where-do-I-put-my-bags small--perhaps not unusual for NYC.  Some of the design elements in the room were not particularly well-thought-out:  the closet, for instance, was so small that it could barely hold one person's hanging clothes for 2 days, much less clothing for two.  The room needed more drawers; better furniture could have easily solved for that.  On the plus side, there were plenty of plugs, and the lighting was well-designed.

The sleep quality was average.  While the bed and linens were comfortable, our room was facing the street, and the noise control was very poor.  Admittedly, NYC is a loud city, but I have stayed in several properties that were better insulated against street noise.  Tons of sirens, etc., all night long--if you're a light sleeper, consider staying elsewhere or at least requesting a room that does not face the street.

Housekeeping was very disappointing.  On the day I checked-in, soap was provided for the shower, but not for the sink.  On the next day, we left the room at 9:00a; when we returned to the hotel at 2:30p, our room had still not been cleaned.  I called to request housekeeping service after we left the room shortly thereafter; upon our return that evening, the service was sloppy:  the bed was made, but the trash cans had been emptied and sort of thrown back into the room (rather than placed under the desk), toiletries had not been refreshed, a bag of food waste had not been removed, dirty glassware had not been replaced, etc.  The pattern was similar the next day:  we were given conditioner instead of lotion, etc.  This poor attention-to-detail and incomplete service was surprising for a hotel of this price and brand.  To management's credit, when I complained about the service, I did receive an appropriate response.

While the hotel worked fine for a personal stay, had I traveled there for business, I would feel mixed.  The lobby was small, with limited space to work or have conversations.  At night, it was very loud, due to the lobby bar.  The hotel does not have an executive lounge.  Internet service was somewhat slow, although free.

As a Hyatt Globalist, I was extended complimentary breakfast in the hotel's restaurant.  Service here was excellent and the food satisfactory.

Overall, an average stay.  Given my experiences with the Hyatt brand, I expected a better experience than I had at this hotel.  I would consider staying there again, but I also would not make it my first choice in NYC.

title: Great room, friendly and helpful staff and best hotel bar I've ever been ti
text: The staff was friendly and accommodating. I was treated with great care and respect with a small billing issue (not the hotel's fault). The front desk and door staff were super attentive and the Restaurant Manager and bar staff were some of the best I've ever dealt with.

title: Great place
text:
Great weekend break. Excellent location, attentive staff, very nice restaurant and bar. Best Hyatt I have visited for a while. 

From check in to departure, with several interactions in between, the team at the Hyatt Really made us feel welcome and comfortable. Great job.

title: Business Trip
text: Great location! I love staying here beachside it close to my office and there are a lot of great restaurants within a 5 min walk.  The subway is also just a hop, skip and a jump away.  The location feels low key and relaxed.

title: Hyatt Union Square - Great Staff and Service
text:
I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for four days in early January.  The room, 912 was comfortable, quiet, and had everything I needed.  I've stayed in the City enough times to know that hotel rooms can be a bit compact to put it mildly.  

I was most pleased with the staff at this hotel.  There was a bit of a mix-up at check-in which wasn't the hotels fault and the staff could not have been more helpful to resolve the issues.  Hotel personnel in NYC have a reputation of being less than cordial and the staff at the Hyatt Union Square would completely dispel that perception.  Great staff and a great hotel.  If you need to go to the Union Square area of the City, check out the Hyatt.

title: Nice stay
text:
This property is will located close to Union Square with lots to do nearby.   Check-in was a bit more complicated than it needed to be but nonetheless we got through it.   

The room itself was nice, beds were comfortable and the shower was also pretty good. We mainly just slept there as we got up & left pretty early each morning.   Overall experience was pleasant.  Would consider returning again depending on the price at the time of our visit.

title: Location and close
text: Unplanned journey to visit friends and family. Delighted with being near Strand Bookstore, bakeries and our room was far enough up not to have street noise an issue. Room is large enough and has all you want at arms length. Customer Service was attentive and very personable. Brought car, valet service was $65 and if desired Icon parking was within eyeshot. Fitness Center was welcomed and available.

title: Recent family visit
text:
The hotel was suggested by a family member whom we were visiting a few blocks away so the location and the neighborhood are great. The room was well designed to be so small which is typical of hotels in this area of NYC but there are a few quirks, i.e. the faucet fixture is so close to the modern flat sink that one can barely wash one’s hands.
A comfortable and welcoming lobby and reception has been sacrificed for a large and loud lounge at the front door.

title: Beautiful Property, Small Rooms, Poor Service
text: The building is new and luxuriously appointed.  However the rooms are tiny, even by NYC standards.  Other high-end properties offer more spacious accommodations.  But the service is the real shortcoming here.  Front desk staff had no follow-through, and the restaurant hostess was rude.  I’m a Hyatt Globalist, but I probably won’t return.

title: Significant Drop in Service
text: My wife and I travel to NYC on a fairly regular basis, around once a month. We have stayed in a number of hotels, ranging from five star to barely one. We thought we had found our sweet spot with the Hyatt Union Square. We love the location and our previous couple of times had been fine. This trip however things went down hill fast. First we checked in and asked for a quiet room, preferably the same room as we have been staying in previously, 801. Floors 9-11 were closed to guess for some reason. Instead of a quiet room the front desk decided to surround us with a bus load of teenage girls who proceeded to stay up all night moving from one room to another with the music blaring.  This is why it was clear no guests were put on the upper three floors. It was more convenient to crowd every floor until it was full before opening up the next one. The next day after complaining to the front desk we went out from early morning, returning around 4:30pm only to find our room still not cleaned. We are frustrated as we have to wait in the lobby for 45 minutes only to discover the bed wasn't made, the room service trays and the trash was still in the room, after we were told the room was ready. Today we decided to be proactive let the front desk know that we would be out from 12-2 and could they please clean the room while were out. Came back, room hasn't been touched.  Never will we stay here again.

title: Extremely disappointing
text: Location is good and the bar is nice. The rest however, not great. We had our room changed when we arrived claiming this was a better one. We ended up on the bottom floor with the window facing loud fans and no daylight at all. Attached was the service room where the cleaners were starting to use from around 7 am everyday which helped us wake up early, exactly what you like on a vacation. The bath robe in the room smelled heavily from sweat (not ours.. luckily we checked before using) and it seems that the soap you get better last for the entire time cause they don't seem to replace it when it's empty. Seriously, how do they have such a high score is well beyond me.

title: Best front desk staff!! Caring helpful professional
text: Enjoy staying here every trip because the front desk staff is amazing! Always ready to help always pleasant and professional and most of all remember me from stayto staywhich makes me feel unique special

title: Apartment hubting
text: We stayed there while we looked for an apartment for my son. Great location, staff friendly, room awesome. I would highly recommend this hotel to all. Great price and fitness center had everything I needed.

title: Excellent
text:
I stayed there for 3 days for a business trip from 16-18 April'17. That was my first visit to NY and I really want to appreciate the guy on concierge desk (sorry I forgot his name). He came with a map and explained each & every thing in detail where could I find Indian food, metro routes for local sightseeing etc. It feels great when someone help you in a completely new city/country. He even helped in suggesting nearby shopping places.
I also got a complementary drink & free chocolates due to Easter. The only problem was the room size, may be because it was in mid of Manhattan. Overall, it was a superb stay.

title: Location, location, location!
text: This hotel is so close to the area where we need to be, so location was a big factor for me and my husband.  Walking distance from the NYU, Union Square, and local shops.  Subway is a block away, so making getting around the city very easy.  The staff were really nice and accommodating too.  Always ask to be upgraded.  You never know when these rooms are available until you ask, right?  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Everything but Room Service
text:
We just spent a wonderful but cold week in NYC at this very nice hotel.  The rooms are fairly standard for a NYC hotel - small but comfortable.  The location is wonderful as there are just so many great restaurants and shops close by.  Plus if you are ok with using a subway, it’s amazingly convenient since you are just a few stops from basically the entire city.   

The only real negative that is very hard to ignore is the room service.  If you like using room service , this is not the hotel for you.  We just had a horrible time getting anything right or in a timely way or they just would ignore us. Don’t understand it since the staff at the front desk seemed very nice and efficient.   And the housekeeping was perfectly fine. It was really surprising since the Hyatt product is usually fairly consistent but this was just so bad its hard to fathom why they would bother with having any room service at all.  Perhaps having ice machines and a small snack shop would do it and at least no one would expect anything more than that and likely would satisfy the majority of guests.

We still hand a wonderful time and again potentially would stay again since the location was so great and overall we had a good experience- we would just order in from Postmates or UberEats!

title: Paid $300+ a night and couldn't even take a nap!
text:
Checked in around 3:30 and tried to take a power nap from 4:30 to 4:50.  But there was a lot of banging noise from doors down the hallway.

I mentioned it the next day to a young lady at the front desk, who offered me another room in a quiet corner.  However, when I looked through the peephole for about half an hour, most of the banging noise came from the housekeeping staff; one of them would go from one room to another.  Then repeat.  Simple solution, why not just leave all the doors open?

Will not return unless something was done to the door closing mechanism or the housekeeping procedure.

title: No hot water
text: Generally I enjoy this hotel. I’m in NYC a lot for work and because my daughters live there. The Hyatt Union Square is convenient for my daughters and usually a wonderful place. In the summer have nice bikes they give to guests. And the staff is friendly and efficient. Unfortunately on my last trip there they had no hot water. Rough way to start the day. It was freezing outside and this may have been a one time occurance. Others in the elevator had the same experience. The staff was friendly and nice - seem to be happy working there and are quite pleasant and helpful. A quirky hotel that I enjoy due mostly to its location - my daughters live quite close in the neighborhood. I travel a lot for business and usually stay up at the Plaza Athenee or sometimes The Palace or the Mark. But when I am there to be with my girls the Hyatt Union Square has worked well in the past. Hard to recommend a hotel that has no hot water and has no follow up about it afterwards as well.

title: Christmas in New York
text:
Overall my wife and I were satisfied with this hotel. The staff were polite, courteous and helpful. I usually stay exclusively at Hilton Hotels being a Diamond member but this time I thought I'd try something different.

Firstly, the location of this hotel is excellent.

The hotel is very modern and clearly just been refurbished. The TV's are large flat screen LG's although for those who do this, I could not play films from USB key on them and had to use a HDMI lead from my laptop.

We never used the bar or ate breakfast. Breakfast is VERY expensive and there is a café right over the road from the hotel called Sandwicherie which does a very good breakfast for $6.

After the first night of our 7 day stay we found the housekeeping of the room to be a little sloppy having missed to clean / replace cups and glasses but this was not repeated so can be forgiven. We didn't raise this as a complaint, it was a minor misdemeanour. On another slightly negative note, when requesting some plates and cutlery to eat some cheese we purchased from a local shop, we had to request this twice as it was not delivered in the first instance.

Overall it was a good stay and the best part was the location... If I am honest I'd probably stay elsewhere in future, not that there was anything wrong with the hotel but it didn't wow me.

title: Would recommend!
text: I really enjoyed my stay here! My daughter and I had such a great time in New York. The staff was very friendly and always willing to help. The room was nice, but we would’ve liked a better view. If I come back to New York, I’ll come back to the Hyatt!

title: Happy holidays
text:
Ficamos 4 noites no hotel. Fomos muito bem recebidos e conseguimos um early check-in. A localização é excelente, com vários serviços 24 horas.
O único porém, é o armário do quarto q é muito pequeno. Mais no geral, valeu a pena. E voltaremos!!

title: Fun in NYC
text: Great experience at the Hyatt. Front desk attendants were very good, helpful and accommodating. Victor was great. We had a minor booking problem which was not the fault of Hyatt personnel. Victor found the problem, we all laughed and he  fixed the problem. Hotel accommodations were wonderful; rooms were very nice and clean. The Hyatt restaurant was very nice and the food was good both dinner and breakfast. We will definitely stay there again.

title: Beautiful property
text: My daughter and I stayed at the Hyatt for a girls’ weekend away. The location is amazing, and the hotel is gorgeous. I am a picky traveler and found nothing wrong with this property! I will definitely stay here in the future. (Try out the Ben’s Cookies a block away and be sure to hit the Strand Bookstore around the corner.

title: Short stay, cool room, great service
text:
Wife and I stayed here overnight for a party in NYC. Great, really pleasant service. Francois and Rashmi took immediate care of us, laughed at my corny jokes, and to our delight, upgraded our room to something that looked like we could throw a small party in. 

Interesting room, bright and airy, lots of amenities. Very neatly arranged for our arrival. Huge shower, loved that. Great bed, slept well.  Impressive minibar. 

Great location for exploring, dining, shopping. Close to subway. 

Would definitely stay here again.

title: Perspective from a 10-day stay
text: The Union Square Hyatt is situated in a superb downtown location.  The hotel has a chic boutique ambiance enhanced by the high quality amenities of the Hyatt brand.  Over a 10-day stay I experienced consistently excellent service by Tenzing and entire staff at all levels throughout the property.  If you are seeking an elegant Manhattan downtown lifestyle hotel experience, look no further.

title: Tucked out of the way - great hotel
text: I have visited the Union Sq area for many years, and was not familiar with this Hyatt Hotel.  Stayed there for one night in November, and was very satisfied.  The bathroom is sort of 'in the room,' but creatively tucked behind some mirrors.

title: True surprise
text: Stayed here one night for business. I was very surprised with this hotel. Check in was efficient. The room was spacious, modern and had a bug bathroom with a bug shower. Bed slept well and a nice touch were the earplugs on the pillow with a short note to wish me a good night. Roomservice was quick and of a high quality as well. Location for me was good as it was close to our office. On union Square there was a nice Christmas market by the way. Summarized, I liked this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

title: Great for Xmas market visits
text: 2nd time here due solely to location. Very Good beds, restful night in city street view location, staff tries hard, close to holiday Xmas market @ union square, getting pricey for what you get room wise. Weird bathrooms. Upbeat trendy vibe in an acceptable way.  music too loud in lobby.

title: Not very nice hotel for the money
text: Very disappointing for the price. They don't have valets to park cars - you need to go in and wait in line to ask the person behind the desk to take care of the car for you. Very loud street noise in the room. We were woken up by sirens. Next time we will try a boutique hotel.

title: Good hotel, great location
text: This hotel was great for my wife and I. Everything was newer and hotel was impeccably kept. We went to the hotel bar and had a wonderful time. The hotel is located in Union Square close to shopping and great food. Its also located close to a subway which was the best way of getting around. Washington square was a short walk away and had a great park and dinning options as well. I would highly suggest this location!

title: NYC Union Square Hyatt Hotel
text: Quiet, classy hotel in a convenient location. Close to Union Square subway, 5th Avenue restaurants. Hu’s paleo restaurant is a great place for breakfast, lunch or dinner for those with restricted diets.

title: Cool bar great staff
text: Just a short stay. Good location. fun bar cool crowd. Great staff, including Tenzing who took the time to remember my name even on a one night stay. Have stayed before. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect location
text: I visit NYC 4-5 times a year and stay at the Hyatt Union Sq as often as possible.  Sometimes the price can be an issue but the location, service and rooms are always great.  Bar and restaurant are also good but this is NYC and there are so many other options nearby.

title: Great Location.  Great Service.
text: The location could not have been better.  Cabs were readily available and a subway hub is just a short block away.  Enjoy the shops in Union Square.  Great food is close by, you just have to look for it.  In NYC, restaurants are not obvious.  Try Craft and the Daily Provision on 19th Street.  The hotel restaurant is excellent.  If you are not used to the traffic noise, the back side of the hotel is very quiet.  Great place to stay.

title: Great Location, Newer Hotel
text:
We stayed here for one night.  It's a newer hotel with very modern room decor.  That's good and bad.  More on that in a minute.  

Pros: location is terrific.  Right off Union Square so pretty easy to go anywhere in the City.  Nice restaurants around as well. The rooms are funky.  Hardwood floors are a plus.  The wardrobe in lieu of a closet is small but nice.  The technology is nice.  There are plenty of easily accessible plugs and lights. The beds were comfortable.Size was decent for NY.
