Cons:  with the modern decor they put in a really weird bathroom.  The sink is outside the bathroom.  The bathroom has sliding glass doors that don't lock and don't close completely.  The shower is part of the bathroom with a drain floor.  I was not a fan of any of this.Also they used dark modern tile which is already showing signs of wear and lack of maintenance.  A bathroom like that is going to be very difficult to maintain.  They need to do a better job.  Though the bed was comfortable, the sheets were just okay. Not the finest linen.  

Other:  there is a modern wine rack right when you walk into the room. It was cool but not sure what I thought of it.  The hotel bar was incredibly happening and loud on a Saturday night at midnight.

title: Very personal staff.
text:
So very friendly and helpful staff. Especially Franćois, Victor, Corettea and Tenzig. Haven’t forgot the other staff that was helping out. ( don’t have their names) Thank you for making our stay great.
Thank you also to the house keeping manager that found my brand new iPhone that I forgot in the room....so very grateful.
Location, location, location: the best location on Manhattan when you want to go uptown or downtown both by subway or by walking.
We will be coming back.
Bowery Road restaurant has super good food (modern, healthy and tasteful) the dining first night was a bit slow, but the breakfast was both good and quick.

title: I love this hotel
text:
I have stayed here a couple of times for work and really enjoyed my stay.  The rooms are clean and service is excellent.  All the staff are friendly and very helpful.

James, from the Bowery Restaurant, has looked after me on many occasion, his attention to detail and high level service takes an already enjoyable stay to a another level.

Thanks James and The Union Square Team!

title: Our Favorite Stay in This Area
text: Everything at this hotel is great - room, staff, service, bar, and location.  Close to everything, staff always ready to help with transportation and baggage.  The bar is a great place to hang out and meet up - the drinks and food there were really good.  All amazing for our stay.

title: Best night sleep.
text: This was our second stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The courtyard rooms were the only ones available and at first we were hesitant about that but after 2 blissfully quiet nights we will request that room again!

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: Hyatt Union Square had very comfortable and clean rooms, the bed was so easy to sleep on, the room was spotless and everything I needed was at my fingertips but above that was the customer service.  I lost a large sum of money and assumed someone had somehow broken into the room and stole it.  The Housekeeping manager did an audit on the door lock and found that only I had entered the room.  Feeling totally baffled by the loss of my money I checked the front pocket of my suitcase one more time and I found my money buried deep in a corner crevice.  When I told the staff that I found my money, they were not angry but were instead, very happy for me.  I am very impressed with the hotel staff at this facility.

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text: We were looking for a hotel in the Union Square area and this fit our requirements perfectly. Spotless (though small) room, no street noises, blackout curtains.  The bar/restaurant was excellent also. We had drinks, hors d’ouevres, and breakfast there.  Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful.

title: Amazing Stay
text:
Staff were super friendly, and helpful.
Well located
The beds were to die for 
it's a bit pricey but it's totally worth it 
I will definitely recommend it to my friends and family
And cannot wait to be back

title: Great Hotel
text:
This Hyatt is in a wonderful location near University Square. The staff are friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be coming back. The rooms are well laid out and updated. A restaurant and a vibrant bar are attached.
The are several wonderful restaurants nearby and walkable to Greenwich, SoHo, Midtown. Transit across 14th street. Ideal tourist location.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Comfortable room. Very friendly staff. Excellent hotel. I will return to this location and will recommend the hotel to colleagues. Location is also excellent. Union Square neighborhood has everything - restaurants, shopping.

title: Great location, friendly staff!!
text:
We stayed for three nights with my husband and found the Hyatt a good value for our money. Our room (Studio deluxe with city view) was good size, very clean and nicely decorated. A bonus for us was that there was also ironing facilities in the room. Next time I would not choose the sky view option even though the view was awesome it comes with a noise level that the windows won't isolate you from.

Front desk staff was friendly and quick to respond to all our needs.

The location I think is the best part of the hotel. In the Union Square area there are a lot of good restaurants in near by and a huge Whole Foods market right around the corner. The subway stop is also around the corner and there is lots of lines to choose from.

title: Fantastic Trip
text: We stayed here the weekend of the NYC Marathon and I just can't say enough good things. I don't normally post reviews, good or bad but felt in this case I should. The hotel is set right in the middle of a vibrant neighborhood and went the extra mile to get everything right. The staff, particularly Tenzing, were attentive and professional and took customer service to the next level. Our room was spotless and comfortable and offered a modern feel - not a cookie cutter room you might expect from many hotels. For those interested, the hotel lobby provided a nice choice in both restaurant and bar options. We happened to drive in so the valet service was important to us. It was fairly priced and we had our car ready to go within 10-15 minutes of requesting when it was time for us to check out. Without a doubt a place I will return to when back in NYC. Thank you Hyatt Union Square

title: Nice Hotel
text: It is clear the staff really cares and the do a great job. Very helpful from front door people and then the rest of the staff as well. Rooms are great and both the bar and restaurant are fantastic. Nice place that is consistent with service.

title: surprised with high quality
text: typically i stay in very high end hotels on business travel.  I am pleased to give the Hyatt Union Square very hight marks.  Very comfortable, pleasant staff.  Great location if you want to be in Union Square

title: We love Hyatt Union Square New York!
text: This was truly one of our most memorable Hyatt experiences anywhere.  The staff all make us feel like we are family each time we visit (which we do quite often!).  See you all again at Hyatt Union Square NYC very soon!

title: Great Location and Comfortable Setting
text: I had always found the Hyatt Union Sq to be an exceptional property and excellent hotel. But, the quality has slipped a little since my last visit.  The room was great but it had some functionality issues that should have been corrected before my arrival, the checkin process was cumbersome because their card reader didn't work and my room was not ready until 3:30 pm.  I will return to this hotel again. Hopefully things will be back to the quality I have grown to expect by my next visit.  Otherwise, the W Union Sq will be my go to place.

title: A must stay!
text: Incredible staff all the way around! Room was super clean. I have never experienced such a quiet room in Manhattan. I slept like a baby! Incredible bartenders at the Distillery!  Room service was delicious!

title: Great location, small rooms
text:
The hotel is located 30 seconds from the subway and a short block away from bustling Union Square. Whole Foods and Food Emporium are equally close. There's a great salad and sandwich place across the street that's open for breakfast. And there are restaurants for all budgets very close by.

The hotel is new, and free of the mustiness of some of its more famous competitors. Bed and bedding are both very good. However the rooms are small. I was traveling on my own this trip, so it was fine. But if my wife had been with me we would have been tripping over each other in the narrow space between bed and desk.

Shower but no bath.

WiFi is "free", but only for the slowest speed of service. This is a bugaboo of mine; I figure if you're paying a couple of hundred bucks for a room, they can throw in an internet connection. So I stubbornly selected the Free option, and it was fine. Even with multiple devices. As the price list helpfully explains, you'll need to pay if you want video streaming (Skype, Netflix), but regular email, internet and even Netflix downloads were problem-free.

Calls to Guest Services are answered promptly, and follow-up is quick.

There was no sign of a doorman when I arrived, which I assumed was part of the hotel's casual atmosphere. However every other time I went out or came back, there was someone to open the door or call a taxi.

My biggest complaint about the hotel is that the walls are thin and the doors are heavy. I had the misfortune to be next to a couple loudly in love, and it sounded like we were sharing a bed. Door closings are equally noisy. Bring ear plugs.

While there are plusher hotels in more famous locations -- several of which I've stayed at for years -- there's a good chance I'll be back at the Hyatt Union Square on my next visit. A quality hotel in a superb location is hard to beat.

title: Fabulous Hotel and Location
text:
We stayed for a week at the Hyatt Union Square last July. My husband is a globalist and we had used a suite upgrade since we were staying with our two children, but when we arrived, we realized the room only slept 3. The staff there was amazing. They offered us an upgrade for a minimal fee and we stayed the week in a fabulous room. They made us feel welcome all week long as we came and went. I cannot say enough good things about every single staff member there.
We loved the decor, and the flavored water was a welcome treat every day. 
The restaurant attached to the hotel has the best breakfast I have ever enjoyed at a Hyatt.
The location as perfect. We walked all over Manhattan from our hotel and enjoyed the close proximity to the Union Square Farmer's market. The subway is close by and has easy access to many trains.
We hope to stay there every summer.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Muy bien localizado, excelente servicio:  Habitación en muy buen estado, limpia y bien equipada. Cama muy comoda.  El personal muy atento y eficiente. el restaurante muy conveniente.  Definitivamente muy recomendable

title: Great Stay
text: Location and proximity to transportation and entertainment was excellent. Staff incredibly helpful with directions and allowed for early check-in despite not having put it on my reservation. Would recommend to everyone.

title: Great location with Bar and Restaurant
text:
We stayed for an extended time of around 10 days as we had moved our daughter in nearby to a condo ready for university.  The location was so handy for food, coffee, restaurants etc right near union square.  

The hotel service was also very good.  We had stayed at W Union Square on arrival for a few nights however the service at Hyatt was far superior, very friendly and welcoming.

The bar on the ground floor is excellent with cocktails, wine, craft beer and some good bar snacks.  The restaurant is nice although lacked real depth in the menu.  

The rooms are very small as is common in New York but well designed. 

We would stay again when visiting our daughter in New York or any time wanting to be near Union Square.

title: Easy and effortless!
text: Aside from the excellent location, just one minute from Union Square with its many possibilities, this Hyatt really surprised me with friendly and helpful staff, cleanliness and all the amenities I could wish for. King bed was comfy, and I loved the double blackout curtains. My room on the 4th floor was quiet, as I had requested that in my reservation.  I was able to leave my bag with concierge for several hours after the 11am check-out time - a huge help. I'll be back!

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: I did not know this hotel existed until my usual hotels in this area were either sold out or crazy $ for some reason.  This Hyatt was a solid experience. Everything in the gym is new.  The rooms are newly appointed or new.  My room was a bit small, but smartly laid out.

title: Ideal location, very comfortable small rooms and attentive service
text: A great choice in the Union Square area. Fresher and more modern than most NYC hotels. The staff was exceptional. The rooms are a tad small, but that is clearly the trend with newer, sometimes even older, New York City properties.

title: Great location and very friendly service!
text:
Spent three nights at this hotel.  Service was top notch from the minute we arrived all the way through the end of our stay.  We were celebrating our 5-year anniversary (brought our two year old son). On arrival, hotel sent us a bottle of prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries.   Room looks pretty new, is clean, and is well appointed (coffee machines, iron, etc.)

There are infused water and green apples in the lobby, which are "nice to have" when we are on the go.  

Location is very convenient.  Close to the subway station (easy to get to the Staten Island Ferry terminal), Union Square park (where you will find the farmers market), Washington Square park, and walkable to the Flatiron building. Lots of restaurants nearby and Walgreens is a block away (to pick up little things you need).  

Highly recommend this hotel!   

Ps. We moved to another hotel closer to Central Park to explore the park, museums, Time Square etc.  With our young son, it worked out well to split our stay in two different hotels so we would not spend a lot of time in transit.

title: Perfect location and great staff
text: Perfect location and great staff. I love the location of this hotel. You're halfway between time square and Chinatown. So many great places to eat. Staff is exceedingly friendly at this hotel. Hotel is very clean and modern. Only downfall is they do not have bathtubs. If you're looking for a place that is close to everything this is your place.

title: not able to retrieve left items from room
text: I stayed at Hyatt Union Square in Oct 2017. The room was clean and quiet. Also it's close to the places I wanted to visit, which is huge plus. The only thing is that I left a few items in the room before checking out. I tried to call them but the staff said they never found them :(

title: right place to be near NYU
text: Easy access by car and public transportation was 1/2 block away. Perfect place to visit the School too. New york does not have to be an intimidating place to drive to this hotel is simple to find and access.

title: Very good for NYU visit
text: 3rd stay here in the last 3 months or so.  good service, clean room, and a good location to reach any place in Manhattan by Cab.  Very convenient to NYU.  Only complaint is we had 3 in our party and room said slept 3, but was a king bed and small sofa that was not a sofa bed--a little misleading.

title: Better than any of their higher end neighbors
text: Forget the Hyatt label and anything you might think about a generic brand.  Everything here is personalized.  The property is modern, clean, inviting.  The rooms are quiet.  And the food at the on site restaurant is among the best you will have in the Village. An oasis in NYC

title: Hyatt union square
text:
Great location for Stuyvesant town family visit- The Smith nearby restaurant was a great recommendation. Walked to Nordstrom
Rack and easy Uber everywhere ! Room are contemporary with nice views and Bar is awesome!

title: Terrible experience
text: I checked in on Friday and checked out Sunday. When I logged in on the Internet got a message that my Internet would expire Saturday and yup the Internet went poof. Sunday morning I could not stay connected for more than half a millisecond. I called front desk was given a code, I was not able to enter a code. I was transferred to online support. After 20 minutes and poor customer service we got absolutely nowhere. I called front desk and asked to speak with a manager. The employee said the manager wasn't in but they would be there in 10 minutes. I get a call shortly after, the lady sends engineering to the room. After 10 minutes with his "help" we get absolutely nowhere. I called front desk again and it turns out the manager is not there today. No one in the hotel could help me, no problem at all since I was scheduled to work for ONLY 8 hours. I do not recommend this hotel to those that need to work while traveling, otherwise you might not have Internet and get a touch of no customer service. I thought the name Hyatt comes with service and professionalism, I was wrong. Instead I wasted valuable time, made me feel stupid and experienced POOR service.

title: Visit our Daughter at NYU
text:
Tenzing the associate working at the front desk was great. He checked us in and took care of our bags. Checked us out, took care of our bags and got us a car the airport. He did this with style and humor. Gives us cause to return.

Hotel was nice, except the sink in the bathroom was at most 2" deep and the faucet discharge was barely 2" above that! Could not even wash our hands without getting water splashing everywhere. Easy fix and should be done immediately.

So Tenzing will keep us coming back, but only once if we end up with a sink like that.

title: Great location and  surprisingly cool vibe for a Hyatt
text:
I spent two nights at the Hyatt Union Square and was pleasantly surprised by the great service.  I thought the hotel has a really cool vibe...especially for a Hyatt.  It is clear that they work hard to match the eclectic atmosphere surrounding area.  Union Square, just a block away ..is an "always on" reality show and the dining scene is just incredible.  

On Friday nights, the music from the bar lounge seemed like a fitting pre-game for a weekend NYC..  The Library of Distilled Spirits is an awesome bar with plenty of classic cocktails and a lively social scene.  

The rooms were very nice but tight...not a lot of walking around with two double beds...but hey... its NYC.   They did a great job fitting lots of amenities in a small space. The view from our eighth floor window was actually better than many I have seen in Manhattan.  The fitness room is in the basement level..well equipped, and well lit,  though no windows.

Tip:  valet parking is a bit pricey...$75 per night for an SUV.  If you drive in, you may want to park the car yourself at the lot on 13th street..just around the corner.

title: Pat & Paige
text: This hotel is very nice, clean and comfortable.  The staff was extremely nice and helpful.  This Hyatt is seconds from Union Square and they have they best Farmers Market.  This is also very close to Gramercy Park where my children live.

title: Favorite location in the city
text: I visit Manhattan monthly and love the East Village, Gramercy Park, & Union Square neighborhoods.  Relative to other parts of the city, there are far fewer upscale hotels in these neighborhoods. This was my first stay at the Hyatt Union Square, and I will definitely be back. Reasons: good restaurant and bar on the property, nice-sized rooms, & friendly staff.

title: Great location quality hotel
text: We keep returning here as it meets all our needs. Great location especially with proximity to union square. We find taking the subway still a great way to get around. Plenty of shopping and eating options. The rooms are Manhattan size but great modern layout and very comfortable. On site restaurant is quite good and helpful if you are tired or have bad weather. As title suggests we have returned several times as it is perfect for us. Highly recommend

title: Great location, great hotel
text: On the pricey side but good sized rooms, very new and great staff. The bonus is the location - perfect for accessing uptown and downtown. Exceeded our expectations - which is hard these days! Would be our first choice for next visit.

title: An experience to treasure!
text: We just spent a wonderful weekend in New York City. The experience was enhanced by our stay at the Hyatt Union Square, New York. The staff was attentive, friendly and very helpful. We want to give a shout out to Tenzing for his kindness and going out of his way to make sure we got where we needed to be when we needed to be there.

title: Exceptional customer service
text:
I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and had a great visit here. There was a small glitch with the room and the staff went over and above what they needed to do to make it right. In addition to fixing the problem they brought bottled water and a bottle of wine up to the room to make it right. 

The restaurant had just opened and they had some major issues there but again, they staff made it right. 

No hotel will be perfect, and the extra attention to doing the right thing makes all the difference when you're looking at different hotel options. 

The location central, and easy to get to a train that will take you just about anywhere in the city. 

The room was a decent size for NYC. 
The shower was great. 
The room was quiet.
The amenities were lovely. 

Overall I would recommend this hotel for sure.

title: Eh
text: Just ok...soft place to sleep.  Nothing special.  Incredibly understated and a bit dark in the entrance.   White lacquer in rooms are a bit much.  Room size is quite small, either sit on the bed or on the desk chair.  No other place to relax.

title: Perfect spot for the real New York.
text: The Hyatt was a little surprise for our 5 day stay in NYC. Perfect spot for exploring the east village - don't miss Verameat for unique jewelry, Cloak and Dagger across the road for cute clothes and Oiji for a fabulous meal. Nearby Union Square market is fun as is a stroll up Broadway to Fishes Eddy, ABC Kitchen ( not food), Marimekko and their beautiful Dutch designs and then a lunch outside at Madison Square Park. Don't forget a stop at Eataly. The Hyatt was a solid base for our return to NYC - we lived here for a few years and did not want to stay in a tourist area - Hyatt is a great choice for this. Bowery Road restaurant in the hotel is a great place to grab lunch or dinner without spending too much money and it is a solid meal. Try the skirt steak and tomatoes if you a doing the carb free thing, yum. We could not get over how quiet the street was for sleeping. It can be noisy at night in the city ( you get use to it) but I never heard a thing and slept well. Bathroom had plenty of space, could use a make up mirror and the room for New York was a good size. Union Square is at the 14th street subway station which is a transfer station meaning you can get anywhere in the city. Use the subway it's easy and best way to see the city. The staff were all friendly without being intrusive. We were very happy with our stay at the Hyatt and will be back.

title: Oasis in Union Square
text: Hip hotel with nicely appointed rooms in a great location. Very helpful and accommodating staff. Hotel restaurant -  Bowery Road - serves a delicious breakfast and the bar - Library of Distilled Spirits - is extremely comfortable with high ceilings and an ambience conducive to conversation.

title: Great location if you don't want to do the Times Square Thing
text:
This is the place for your second (or third) trip to NYC.  You did the tourist trap the first time around - this time you want to see another part of the city.

Its a great location.  Union Square for the farmers market and the barnes and noble book store.  It's a shoprt 9 block walk to Madison Square park for Eataly and Shake Shack.  4-5 blocks south on 4th avenue takes you to astor place and japanese part of town. Head east to 1/2 avenue and enjoy the east village.  Keep heading south and you're in the heart of the village and bleeker street - be sure to pass through Washington park on the way.

The hotel itself is nicely maintained - staff are friendly and attentive - the bar is fun and lively - the attached Bowery road restaurant is good and NYC-cheap!.

Enjoy!  We did.  And we'll be back

title: THE ROBES make this a 5 star for me!
text:
Holy smokes.  I'm a robe person at home (mainly from shower to clothes, but robes nonetheless).  I have to say, the Hyatt @ Union Square has the best hotel robes I've ever encountered in my travels.  Imagine your favorite shlumpy grey hoodie.  What you wear when you want to feel super comfortable.  Then add about 3 feet of length and you have the Hyatt hoodie robe.  So comfy, I wore it around my room whilst doing email and meetings.  L O V E.  

Besides that -it's a great location for the Union Square/Flat Iron/Shopping area.  Very close (shares the same big city block) with The Strand (18 miles of book shelves people) one of the oldest and certainly largest bookstores in Manhattan.  Great restaurants all around as well.  Tried the in room dining (Salmon and Roasted Cauliflower dish) my first night. yum. It's more boutique like than some of the other NYC Hyatthotels I've stayed at but nice.  The fitness area is decent size with multiple machines for cardio and a full weight/stretching area as well. 

Product in shower are great.  Towels are great.   My one and only beef would be the walls to the hallway are THIN you can hear every door open and close near by as if they were coming into your room.  It was a little disconcerting at first, but hey it's NYC baby it should be noisy.  That said - I had a window to the courtyard (806) and couldn't hear a bit of street noise.  so YAY.  :)

title: Clean room,  comfortable bed
text: This was my first stay at the Hyatt Union Square. I live in a moderate COL area so the price of the room is attention getting. Room had plank flooring which I think is cleaner and less allergy prone than carpet. Sound proofing from neighboring rooms and hallways is minimal.

title: Great hotel in the middle of everything!
text: Great hotel,  Modern clean decor and spacious rooms.  There are rooms with beautiful outdoor space.  We needed two queen beds and the room was very spacious for 2.  Great shower products and amenities.    We arrived late so we ate at the bar.  The cocktails were fabulous with 2 great mixologists behind the bar.  The food was okay.  Better than average bar food, but nothing special at the same time.  Note that the mushrooms are deep fried, sort of like the Outback Bloomin Onion, but mushrooms.  The menu isn't descriptive, so I recommend you ask questions.

title: A very nice hotel central to many attractions.
text: We have stayed in this hotel twice....our rooms are always very nice, well appointed and clean.  Check in is easy and the front desk crew are very pleasant.  In NYC most rooms are small and cramped, but we have always had nice large rooms with lots of windows.  Both the bar downstairs and the restaurant are quality places.  It's our new go-to for NYC.

title: Wow
text: This hotel is the only place I would stay in the city! It has the perfect location for those who enjoy the Union Square area, as well as the West/Village and the area around NYU. Of course walking everywhere is easy. I live in Switzerland and have very high standards when it comes to hotels, and this hotel exceeded my expectations (again). I was staying with my two little Havanese dogs for four nights, enroute to Europe by ship - after a summer in the Berkshires. The room was impeccable, modern and had wood floors (a dream come true), as well as being extremely quiet.....Super modern bathroom and roomy mini bar and coffee machine. I arrived with 8 pieces of luggage, all being put on the ship. The staff unloaded the car, brought everything to the room, and took all the stress away from the situation, including arranging for my rental car overnight garage. They took the car there so I didn't have to worry about doing it myself. There is a nice in house bar, and a good restaurant right on the premises, which caters to vegans. Great morning coffee! Have to end this review with special mention to four of the nicest, warmest, most helpful, accommodating staff members: Francois, Victor and Tenzing, Chris (?), who went out of their way to be helpful. In fact everyone I encountered at the desk was extremely friendly and nice. Whoever handles the human resources department at this hotel deserves and award! We will definitely stay again on our next visit, and hopefully for longer!

title: Excellent hotel
text: The staff is helpful and friendly. The location is perfect close to subway station. The rooms are a good size for NYC standards and they are nicely decorated and very clean. The restaurant and bar are very nice as well. Strongly recommend it!

title: Fantastic service, property, location!
text: We can't say enough positive things about our recent visit to the Hyatt Union Square.  Location was perfect for everything we wanted to do in NYC - from seeing shows near Times Square to listening to great jazz, going to museums, dining, etc.  The staff was also outstanding.  We were amazed at how attentive they were to every detail of our visit.  We stopped in the bar to grab some glasses of ice to bring to our room...the person at the front desk immediately asked if he could send up a bucket of ice.  Everyone at the front desk went out of their way to be friendly, open the door, asked to grab a cab, etc.  Rooms were clean.

title: Someone else paid
text:
Hyatt Union Sq is the kind of hotel I would not be willing to pay for myself...but I was happy my work was willing to. Room was excellent, spotlessly clean, comfy bed, and top quality toiletries. My view out the back of the building was closed-curtain-worthy, but, hardly unexpected in NYC. Staff was very polite, very helpful.
All in all, exactly the quality you would expect to get for the price paid (whoever it is that pays it).

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: The guest rooms and common areas are like new and very comfortable. The hotel bar is quiet and a great place to visit with excellent special drinks. There are many excellent restaurants in the area and the subway station at Union Square is only a couple of blocks away.

title: That Union Square
text:
Staff are kind and courteous. Service was great.

Room was clean but small. Bathroom could use more racks/ hooks to hang  clothes. Unfortunately, had an inward looking room. But still had light and was quiet.

Room doesn't quite justify price.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel
text: The hotel great location.  However with the hotel prices are expensive and they don't provide free water.  The refriger provided was stocked with overpriced products so no room to put things in it.  Great blinds and blackout curtains.  They have a fitness center but was under construction.  They came to our room first nite and gave us chocolates but didn't come second night.  Only gave us 1 small bottle of shampoo and conditioner for two people and second day was not replenished.

title: Outstanding decor, staff and location!
text: The staff, decor, amenities and ideal location are so worth it!  The new management at the hotel's restaurant even better then before! The dishes are divine! I usually do not eat at the hotel in which I stay because I like to venture out.  But my last visit was for two nights three days and I ate at the hotel's restaurant and bar lounge four times! I will continue to be a repeat guest!

title: NIce mid size hotel
text: Very nice hotel. Small but clean room with modern interior. The service is good, especially the staffs at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. Very good location, within walking distance to Union Square and SOHO area. The price is not cheap for a small room. But overall, I had very nice stay.

title: Super location, quiet room!
text: We are always on the lookout for nice hotels, near in-laws who live in the East Village.  This Hyatt is great.  We've stayed there with a toddler and appreciate the blackout curtains and the lack of street noise.  Sometimes its difficult to get a room at a reasonable rate without significant advance booking, but the Hyatt is always our first choice if available.  Valet is expensive, but not out of line with other NYC hotels.

title: Gem of a hotel in the East Village!
text: On a trip to New York to visit my nursing student daughter at NYU, she recommended the Hyatt Union square due to its proximity to her subway stop and that she knows I like Hyatts.  It was a small and vertical building.  It didn't have some of the amenities that other Hyatts have  (a market, sundries store), it had sufficient services.  The gym was very nice.  There was a newer bar specializing in spirits from all over the world.  However, I didn't try the bar or restaurant.  The location is great.  It's surrounded bu any kind of store you could want.  From Walgreens, to French Bakeries, everything was within a couple of blocks at the most.  My room seemed brand new.  While not larger, it was very nice and efficient.  It was like a studio but had a great view and all the amenities I could have asked for.  The staff was super friendly and helpful.  I'm looking forward to going back to visit my daughter again and will definitely stay at the Hyatt Union Square again!

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Beautiful hotel, lovely staff, perfect location. Much more luxurious than I was expecting. We used valet parking, which was great. Also had breakfast downstairs (I was selected Globalist of the day, and so breakfast was free!), and it was great. Will stay here again!

title: Convenient location and great service
text: Was in town to visit my son for a quick 2 day trip. This was a perfect location, only 2 blocks from his apartment. It is also walking distance to NYU and many shopping conveniences. Will definitely stay there again on my next trip to NYC.

title: My favorite NYC Hotel
text: Incredible staff, location, amenities - I just love this hotel and the staff!  My favorite and would stay no place else!  There are shops everywhere, the Metra is a short walk away, Whole Foods around the corner, and incredible coffee shops on the same block.  The staff almost makes me feel at home and remembers me from each of my trips - even if it's MONTHS in between!

title: 立地は最高、部屋も綺麗
text:
2013年に改装したらしく、部屋はとても綺麗でした。２人用にしては少し狭いですが。
立地は、地下鉄もバス停にも近く、ミッドタウンとロアーマンハッタンの中間にあるだけに、
マンハタッン島のどこに行くにも非常に便利。駅からも近いので、遅い時間まで公共交通を利用できるのも良い。
価格は、NYCとしては標準的でしょうか。同価格の古くてぼろいホテルよりはずっといいです。
バスタブが無いのは、NYCでは我慢の範囲内なのでしょうか。
唯一の欠点は、冷蔵庫が完全センサー式で中をまったく触れないようになっており、
買ってきた水のペットボトル１本さえ冷やせなかったところです。

title: Excellent service. Very small room.
text:
This is a good hotel for someone traveling alone. Great location, excellent staff, nice facilities. Unfortunately the room is very small although it's clean and modern. The bathroom is not separated from the main room.  
Breakfast was very good.

title: Superb Customer Service and Excellent Rooms
text: Our experience at the Hyatt Union Square was excellent. Truly conscientious staff that were helpful as well as sincere. The rooms were comfortable, pleasant, clean and reasonably priced. The hotel bar, The Library of Distilled Spirits was excellent.

title: Location, Convenience, Elevated Comfort
text:
This is the second time my family and I stayed at the Hyatt Union Square New York. The location is amazing because you are right off Union Square, with many subway lines and walking proximity to many neighborhoods in NYC: the East Village, NYU, Chelsea, the Flatiron, West Village, etc. 

1. Rooms: small by world standards, but standard when comparing to NYC hotels. We were upgraded to a room with a private balcony, which was lovely! The rooms are modern, with clean lines and many outlets. The separation between toilet and shower is a nice touch.

2. Dining: We didn't eat at the hotel, but we had a couple drinks at the newly renovated bar. It's a nice place to grab a cocktail or a glass of wine before heading out.

3. Gym: Very good! I'm impressed that this hotel even has a gym in the first place. 

4. Service: Very good indeed. The staff remembered us from last year - from the front desk to the doormen. Warm, pleasant, friendly overall.

title: Love This Hotel
text: I always stay at the Hyatt Union Square when I visit New York. The staff is great. The hotel is perfectly located. A short walk to Union Square. It is clean. Beds are so comfortable. I highly recommend it and love it.

title: Great Service that is much beyond expectations
text: During my 6-day stay at Hyatt union square hotel, I am indeed impressed by their two employees: Sabeli and Francois Etienne.  On my first-day arrival, Sabeli patiently helped me to set up the Wi-Fi connection step-by-step.  In addition, she assisted me to call my shuttle bus company twice to confirm the pick-up service and advance the schedule. She was so considerate that she even actively inquire Uber about pick-up fee for my reference. Without her supports, I might be late for my flight. I could feel her passions for her job and I believe every customer enjoys her services.  Furthermore, I really appreciate the help of Francois Etienne. I had no idea that 4th road was blocked for marathons every weekend and waited for my shuttle bus to JFK airport on Sat morning. Francois actively contacted Supershuttle company and called the driver to change the meet-up location. Besides, he carried my big luggages and took me to the new pick-up place. It was a great support for tourists like me, who doesn't have local SIM card and can't contact shuttle bus driver for emergencies. Hyatt's service is indeed beyond my expectation.

title: Very good hotel, excellent lication
text:
The hotel is located in an excellent point in NYC, close to subway, many shopping places, and many restaurants at the center of action...
The room
Was great (corner room), clean, beautiful, fully equipped including espresso machine. Free WiFi.
The staff is very polite and helpful. The hotel restaurant, the Bowery Road is an excellent place to eat all meals.

title: Great Location in NY for Quick Trips
text: Wonderful minimalist room, pleasant staff and great location. This hotel is ideal for business trips. The price is a bit high but that is NYC in general. The room is snug, but they have done a wonderful job in utilizing the space. The bathroom is very modern. The location is superb, away from Times Square but plenty of action, 1 block from Union Square. Walgreens is across the street and is 24 hours and most rooms have a mini fridge. Ideal for a quick stay for those who want to be out in the city and have meetings.  I also requested a quiet room and they gave me noise cancellation device which absolutely helped me sleep soundly! I recommend requesting this if you have difficulty sleeping.

title: wonderful location
text: For a Manhattan Hotel, the rates were very reasonable.  It is a boutique hotel in a fine Union sqare location.  The rooms were nice, although somewhat small.  They were howver very adequate.  The service was wonderful

title: Excellent team in a wonderful hotel in a great location, love the gym.
text: I love the vibe in the lobby as you first enter the hotel.  The hotel restaurant, Bowery Road, is excellent (try the Brisket) as are the cocktails at Library of Spirits (great old fashions).  The gym is great.  I love being able to work out with 60 lb dumb bells rather than the traditional 50 pounds.  The rooms are nicely done with modern deco and hardwood floors, and the bathroom is clean and elegant.

title: Weekend visit
text: Great hotel in midtown, extremely helpful staff made our stay very enjoyable. Rooms clean, although small exactly what you expect in New York, convenient to subway, great location. We had two rooms with our kids and everyone enjoyed the weekend.

title: New favorite NYC hotel
text: I stay in a a lot of NYC hotels, and the Hyatt Union Square is definitely my new fave. I love the cozy, hip feel of the hotel, the food at the delicious (healthy and farm-fresh) Bowery Road downstairs, and the ample space and storage in the hotel room. It was also super quiet... such a rarity in NYC.

title: Tensen was amazing
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Union Square. The room was nice and attached bar very good for drinks and appetizers but the best part of our stay was the helpful and friendly employees. Specifically, Tensen was there offering anything we needed from the moment our car pulled up to the hotel until the moment we left.  He went the extra mile and we really appreciated it. We will definitely be back.

title: A great hotel at a convenient location for work
text: Within 4 blocks of work and easy to find. Very clean & well designed.  High end appointments. The room was efficient and comfortable. Modern & newly constructed from the looks.  Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: NYC Gem
text: Great location, staff and rooms are fabulous.  Onsite restaurant and lounge food is very good, not  a huge menu of appetizers, but  options tried were delish!  Rooms are small but have a really fun vibe to them modern nd sleek and very comfy bed.  Nice bathroom amenities

title: Location, quality, and comfort
text: We selected Hyatt Union Square primarily to be near a conference hosted at Parsons School of Design. We took advantage of the location to enjoy the neighborhoods comprised by the Village. This vibrant area teems with great food, jazz venues and alternative theatre. The newly remodeled hotel itself offers Bowery Road and the Library of Distilled Spirits providing quality food and drink. All members of the staff were competent and pleasant. We enjoyed our week there very much.

title: Ιδανική επιλογή
text: Πολύ καθαρό, κομψό δωμάτιο εξοπλισμένο με όλα τα απαραίτητα (σιδερόστρα & σίδερο, ομπρέλα, σεσουάρ κλπ). Η εξυπηρέτηση ήταν άψογη, οι υπάλληλοι στη ρεσεπσιόν πρόθυμοι να δώσουν οποιαδήποτε πληροφορία και να βοηθήσουν για την ευχάρηστη διαμονή των πελατών. Τοποθεσία πολύ καλή, σε ήσυχη περιοχή με άμεση πρόσβαση σε μετρό, καφέ, σουπερμάρκετ, σινεμά και πολλά άλλα καταστήματα. Όχι πολύ μακριά από το Μανχάταν (περίπου 40 λεπτά βόλτα με τα πόδια, 10 λεπτά χωρίς πολύ κίνηση και 8-11 $ το ταξί). Οι τιμές λογικές σύμφωνα με τα στάνταρ της Νέας Υόρκης, καλή σχέση τιμής - ποιότητας.

title: Great location & friendly staff
text: I recently stayed at this hotel for the second time and was reminded of why I like it. The hotel is perfectly situated in walking distance of many NYC sites, great restaurants, and subway stops. The staff are friendly, helpful and professional. The rooms are comfortable - not large but a typical NYC size hotel room.

title: Необычно большой депозит. Будьте внимательны!
text: У отеля прекрасное расположение, хороший дизайн номеров, уютный тренажерный зал, быстрый wi-fi. Перед бронированием мы звонили в отель, спрашивали о дополнительных оплатах и сумме депозита, чтобы избежать непредвиденных ситуаций. Нам ответили, что ничего не нужно, тк тариф с полной оплатой номера и налогов.Однако при заезде нас попросили заплатить депозит 1500 долларов. Иначе отказывались селить. При этом деньги нельзя получить обратно, когда уезжаешь из отеля, а обещают через месяц прислать чек почтой, затем его надо будет обналичить в банке.Очень долго длились выяснения . Мы впервые столкнулись с необычно высокой суммой залога и сложным способом получения его обратно. Отелю стоит указывать такую информацию в описании условий на сайтах бронирования.

title: Hyatt Union Square
text: Very quiet rooms. Location on south end of Union Square is unbeatable. Clean and modern rooms with adequate cable TV selection. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Good value too considering the location.

title: The hotel location and staff were amazing, so helpful and nice!
text: The hotel was beautiful, loved Union Square with the park and restaurants. The staff was so helpful and kind, ensuring no issues and going above and beyond to help with luggage, directions, trip to the airport, etc.

title: Prime location, amazing service!
text: Recently remodeled hotel right off of Union Square. The service was incredible and the room was clean, modern and very comfortable. The restaurant has a new menu and it was farm-to-table fresh and delicious.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel Feel
text: Stayed here with my family for a weekend of fun in NYC.  The room (with patio) was fabulous and the staff was very professional, helpful and friendly.  Union Square has a lot going on and has good access to the subway to easily get to further reaches of Manhattan and Brooklyn.  We will be back!

title: Exceeded expectations
text:
If you build  a hotel in a fantastic area that has great rooms and complement that with exceptional staff and management you'd end up with the Hyatt Union Square. 

I checked in Friday in a panic because I left my cell phone in a cab. Thankfully someone answered when I called my number and Tenzing went out of his way to coordinate the return of my phone to the hotel. 

I've stayed at a fair number of hotels but really feel the staff and management here go the extra mile.  When something isn't quite right management goes above and beyond to make it right and I think that's the true measure of a great hotel.  Thank you Steven and David for an stay that far exceeded every expectation which I will not forget. 

If you're in NYC you really must check out this hotel. You'd be hard pressed to find the combination of staff, look and feel of the rooms and location that provides what this hotel provides.

title: Kindness and a stylish room too
text: Rooms at this Hyatt have an Asian influence, very compact, sleek and designed not to waste an inch of space. We enjoyed the look of the room as much as it's comfort. The staff was helpful and caring when we accidentally left an item in a taxi. The taxi driver--not Uber--returned it to our hotel within an hour and the desk attendant looked as happy as we felt and greeted us by name to tell us the good news. That was really memorable and gave us an even better impression of Hyatt courtesy and quality.

title: Very expensive, doesn't worth the value
text:
The hotel it's ok and well located if you are on a business trip. I spent two nights during the week and I paid ~$380 per night. For that price I was expecting great service and amenities. The bed it's ok (6/10) and the room was small, but that's fine for a business trip. My biggest concern was the WiFi. The first day didn't work at all (on a business trip this is a major problem) and the second day was horrible slow. I also had issues with my key a few times and I had to wait 20 minutes until it was fixed.
Next time I'll stay in a different hotel, for that price you can get better options.

title: staying again
text: the location is excellent, the food is fine, the staff are excellent doorman was so very helpful, room service excellent, close to NYU; don't go to nail salon across street, but you can go to tanning place next door we will stay again bookstores close

title: Loved it!
text: The personnel give consistent friendly and efficient service. Our room was comfortable, clean and modern. Rain shower was delightful. Price very reasonable, especially for the location. I'll stay again upon my return.

title: Excellent Service
text: Just stayed at this hotel over the weekend of July 4th. I came to visit my daughter who is staying at NYU dorms during her summer internship.  I wanted to stay close to her and this hotel was perfect. It is a great central location. The hotel and staff are top notch. Special shout out to Tenzing and Jorge for helping me get my return car service scheduled, print out of theatre tickets, and just being so friendly!

title: Swanky (In a good way)
text: The hotel is in a very happening part of Manhattan and is minutes from many popular sites. The rooms were very modern and the staff was phenomenal. When I'm back in the City I will surely stay here again.

title: Convenient location
text: This hotel is conveniently located right next to Union Square; within a very short walk from subway stations servicing many lines reaching practically all NYC locations. The hotel staff was friendly. The room was clean, compact with a comfortable bed and a desk/ chair. We had a night cap at the nice bar lounge in the lobby one night where service was good and drink prices reasonable. We did not try the gym in the basement since we already did a lot of walking. There are plenty of coffee and food choices just across the street. A Walgreens drug store and a wine shop are very close by. We enjoyed shopping at the Rack on 14th. And there is a theater and a bookstore in case you have time to spare. We had a good stay and will definitely come back.

title: NYU Drop-off
text: First time at the Hyatt Union Square New York.  It was 4th of July weekend so traffic seemed a bit lighter in the City.  But, it is important to know that there is a drop off lane on 4th Ave right in front of the hotel entrance at the corner of 4th and 13th where you can park and drop off luggage and if you desire valet park the car (fee was $75 for a 24 hour period).  There were cars lined up but space was available quickly and going around the block once if you miss it is simple.  The front desk and bell team were excellent (thanks to Tenzing for all his help).  The hotel was very comfortable and the rooms were excellent and brand new.  The beds and pillows were excellent.  The mini-bar prices were extremely fair and not outlandish if you need a snack. There is a great "oh I forgot something service" that offers free personal items.  There are so many  places to eat and grab coffee nearby that we didn't use the hotel food service this time.  The staff was outstanding and the location perfect for NYU summer session drop off.  Thanks to all the wonderful staff at the Hyatt Union Square!

title: Very nice stay
text: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  The hotel itself is nicely located in Union Square, convenient to subway.  The room was exactly as described - very comfortable for two people.  Bed and pillows were very comfortable.   The rate was in range with the size room for that location.   We had a wonderful breakfast in the on-site restaurant.  Will definitely stay again!

title: Amazing hotel, beautiful rooms great location
text: Had a very good 6 days stay at the Hyatt Union Square. Anazing room (I recommend the urban studio), very nice an helpful staff! Very good location, walking distance to from the village and Soho, a subway station two minutes away. Enjoyed every minute of it.

title: Nice Place
text: Stayed here for several weeks for a work assignment. Newly renovated hotel with modern decor. Close to subway, Whole Foods, Planet Fitness and various shopping. Staff was friendly and attentive. Nice place to stay in NYC.

title: Hyatt Union Square, Nee York
text:
Liked the updated look but it's more form over function.  The sink is too shallow - not much space between the faucet & basin. Towels had seen their better days, a bit thread-bare. Not much space for clothing for a 4 to 5 days stay.  Pillows & bed were very comfortable. Spacious shower and well vented seperate toilet are well appreciated. Air conditioner came on too frequently regardless what temperature was set throughout the day & night.  Made sleeping difficult.  Front desk was friendly & helpful, but housekeeping was inconsistent. Neglected to restock amenities just about each of the 5 days we were there.  We had a late check out but the housekeeper kept knocking on our door for cleaning...
New restaurant Bowery Lane was. Rey good and reasonably priced.  Gym was well equipped.  Never had to wait long for the elevator.

title: Fantastic Hotel -- Great Staff, Location, Accomodations
text:
I had a fantastic week at the Hyatt Union Square Hotel in June.

The staff is welcoming, gracious, attentive, and low key.

The room is very well appointed, dining excellent, location superb.

I cannot wait to visit again!

title: Things are improving!
text: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the hotel, and things are definitely improving.  The restaurant has been redesigned, and the staff seem to much more "on their game".  I was given a corner room on a low floor (I think, in fact, the very same room I was given on my first stay) and the noise was not as bad as first stay (which was a weekend...and this stay a week day).  All in all, a very pleasant stay.

title: Above 5 stars - will definitely stay here again!
text: This hotel exemplifies SUPERB hotel management and customer service. Upon checkin, we took a late flight and arrived the next day but had the previous day booked so we can freshen up at 8am ET/5am PT. The manager (?) who had a flower on his lapel apologized for the wait (it was barely 5 min) and communicated to the check in receptionist while they dealt with one computer working our reservation info. Great communication between the staff. I also had to pump and store my liquids in their fridge up to 4x a day and they always delivered the bag quite timely with a smile and picked it up from my room without any complaints. It was really wonderful to be greeted with a genuine smile by the doormen upon entering and exiting the hotel. Location was also superb as it was close to the train and a lot of trendy restaurants. Will definitely come back here again and I've been telling all my friends to stay here when they visit! I used to only stay in Midtown but after this experience, I strongly prefer this location. Only wish the other Hyatt locations (especially the London Churchill one) could be half as wonderful. Don't stay at the London Churchill - absolutely dreadful

title: Terrace in Union Square
text: Upon arrival I was greeted by a friendly staff and an upgrade to a room with a terrace.  This was fantastic as the terrace area was the size of the room.  It was a great place to hang out on a beautiful night in New York.  The rooms are nicely decorated and modern, which is my preference.  Keep up the great work!

title: Excellent hotel in a great location
text: Hotel is in a great part of town and so conveniently located to restaurants, bars and activities. Have stayed here twice for business trips in the last 6 months and definitely my go-to hotel now whenever I'm in Manhattan.

title: nice boutique hotel vibe
text: This is a great location for the Hyatt. It's not like a large business hotel - very centrally located to Union Square and SoHo. Went to the Union Square farmers market - just a short walk and got to see another bit of local neighborhood. The service is very nice and helpful. Rooms are on the pricey side if there's high occupancy (like most of the hotels) but they're also very small. Nicely renovated, but there is every bit of space used. We stayed on the 7th floor and it wasn't too noisy (by NYC standards) but there is a fire department very nearby so we heard quite a few sirens through the nights. Loved our stay here. We had to change rooms (for a larger room) after a few nights and they moved us quickly and easily (for us).Nice fitness center on the bottom floor of the hotel.

title: Bait and switch!!
text: Hyatt Union Square New York @hyatt Hotels.com this is not an urbane terrace!! This is not what I waited a month to check into!  This is not what I paid for with my hard earned money!! I am beyond pissed off!! The person at the counter was pleasant but seriously you had my money for over a month!! Now I'm so pissed off that my weekend is totally ruined!  This is not the way you conduct business! A courtesy call to let me know this morning with options would have at least been a little less stressful but you waiting til I got here hungry and weighed down with bags!!! This room is half the size of what I paid for and $100 compensation is not going to give me back my weekend!! Shame on you... first I was done wrong by your Times Square location and now again here in your union square location!! I was stupid to choose you again!!! I would love to hear what excuses you will give me next? Rain really?  You are a global brand!! Shame on you ... I hope you read this! This is the last time!!

title: Top price hotel
text: The hotel is in a great location, you can't beat that.  The staff was young but very courteous and helpful.  The room was a little tight but it is NYC so I guess that is expected.  Bed was comfortable. There is no closet only two armories that were not deep enough for my garment bag and too short for my wife's dress.  For $600 you would think the bottled water and the little snack tray would be complimentary but noooo.  $6.00 more for a water and I didn't even bother trying to see how much the snacks were.  Seemed a little cheap having a tray of things to buy on the desk in the room. Maid service was OK.  beds were made but they left all the dirty glasses from the night before.

title: Great place!
text: My husband was having an eye surgery at NYEE, which is very close to this hotel.  Let me first say that JORGE IS AWESOME! From the moment we walked in, he did everything he could to make this stay as easy as possible.  Had it not been for his wonderful customer service, my stay would've been 10X harder.  The room was beautiful, quiet and clean.  The hotel restaurant was excellent as well.  I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

title: NYC Union Square
text:
The SERVICE was excellent at this location.  The staff was available for all our needs and friendly.
The LOCATION was great.  This Hyatt was perfectly located for my needs and near a subway station which was very helpful.
Unfortunately the ROOM ACCOMMODATIONS was lacking (especially in this competitive market at this price point.)  For a woman, the bathroom was poorly planned.  There was literally no countertop space for personal items and make-up.  There was no make-up mirror. Also, the single robe was sized for a man only. A man would have found this room adequate but it was unexpected and disappointing as a female (frequent) traveler.

title: Nice place run by children's brigade
text: The hotel is comfortable and desk staff wonderful. But after many stqys housekeeping is still the weak link in this organization.  this time the housekeeper threw out my magazines and New York Times before I had even read them (not old but that day's).  I would love to train them myself- as it is now they are absolutely clueless.

title: Lovely boutique feeling hotel with good room, well appointed bathroom, great service
text: Great small boutique feeling hotel with exceptional service in convenient location in Union Square.  The room and bathroom are well appointed with more than ample room for everything and luxurious amenities.  The Bowery Road restaurant is very good and reasonably priced - fresh well prepared food .  Overall, one of the best hotel experiences I have had in Manhattan.

title: Favorite Hotel in best neighborhood in NYC
text: Our second stay and loved it!  Room was clean, contemporary space.  Small (of course it is NYC) but efficient and not crowded\.  Staff is knowledgeable and accommodating.  Location is fabulous with great restaurants, music venues and shopping nearby, not to mention Union Square farmers market!

title: Noisy guests
text: Everything was great- until I fell asleep. I was awoken around 1 am to loud, noisy neighbors. Loud music, opening and slamming doors, someone in the hallway (on the phone I think?). I believe it took a few hours before the hotel staff addressed the issue. For the price I paid, I hoped to have gotten a good night's rest, but this did not happen!!!

title: Sexagenarian in the City
text:
Celebrated my 60 th bday here. It's noisy due to a local fire station but the place is well appointed and convenient. 
The Bowery road restaurant is worth visiting. Best green salad ever among other delicious apps. Entrees, desserts...

title: Great staff
text:
An excellent "smaller" Hyatt with exceptional customer service. 
Definitely will return. 
- great position
- calm, if not quiet (New York)
- warm and welcoming Front Desk
Forego the View and ask for a back room.

title: Great location and service
text: Union Square Hyatt is very convenient to restaurants and activites within easy walking distance. The staff was very friendly. We did not eat at the restaurant, but it looked popular. The room was nicer than some other rooms in NYC that we recently stayed at fthat were similarly priced. We had 2 double beds and we still had room to move around. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the shower was awesome! The room rate was high, but that is probably true for every hotel like this in a good location. I recommend this hotel highly.

title: Okay Room. Awesome Service
text: My parents stayed at the Hyatt Union Square for my graduation and I was with them for most of the time. The room they booked was a little small for the price they paid, and the balcony was not really worth it. But the service here is amazing, from the front desk to the restaurant. It's my third time dealing with the staff and they are always exceeding expectations. The casual vibe of the hotel is also really pleasant. Also a great location. I definitely recommend it.

title: Staycation In Luxury
text: They gave us free champagne and even brought us glasses and whatnot at midnight. We had friends and family staying in the hotel as well. Many did not speak English very well, and, yet, they were very accommodating. The interiors were recently updated, so, it did not feel like a small stingy room. We locals and I have to admit, it is kind of difficult to impress us, but they did. Nothing worthy of a story, but I at no time did I feel like they would not try to solve problems we might have had, always at the ready. And isn't that what we really want in a hotel? A place that does not create stories to tell and yet give us every assurance that if something were to happen, they would be ready to solve it.

title: Very friendly and good quality for this price range
text: My first time at this hotel and would return. Staff assisted happily with any request. At Bowery Road, food quality, menu, service and value for money was great! A great location to start time in NYC.

title: New York City
text:
I wish they would had a mini refrigerator in the room for us especially since we were there for one week.
The hotel was clean and staff was friendly.
Free coffee to guests would have been appreciated.
A room with a balcony would had been nice as depicted in the picture.

title: Good place to stay in NY
text: One of the better places in NY. The union square park is within a minutes walk, as are a number of good stores for shopping and eating. The Strand bookstore is also next door, though easy to miss. The staff are courteous and friendly.

title: Excellent stay
text: We were having trouble with the cab when we first arrived.  Jorge came out and helped us and handled our check-in. He saw that our weekend wasn't starting out on the best foot and really helped turn that around.  Can't say enough about Jorge, really turned our weekend around.

title: wonderful
text: We stayed at the Hyatt Union Square on 6/10/17.  the staff here was absolutely the most polite, friendly and helpful staff I have ever encountered.  They went out of their way to help us with anything we asked - exceptional !!!!

title: EY NYC Conference
text: Very customer centric staff, helpful In checking and an providing dining recommendations. Hotel has a very trendy feel to it. Rooms were small but well appointed and the beds were very comfortable. Would have been nice with a fridge in the room.

title: First Class Manhattan Lodging
text: Hyatt Union Square was a thoroughly enjoyable experience for a weekend NGO board meeting. Decor is first class, the restaurant was excellent, as was the bar. Those two facilities are very new and multiple staff were unfamiliar with the advertised spirits specialty, but I can order my own drink, thank you. By next time, they will probably have been briefed. My standard room was small but adequate, especially by NY standards, and quiet. However, form did trump function in several respects: Clothing storage was minimal - room for one man traveling light for three ngihts but not much more. The only empty drawer was about a square foot in area and two inches deep!  A well-dressed couple who were attending the same event said they were living mainly out of their suitcases. Our group had a hospitality suite that included a wonderful outdoor patio. Free level of Internet service was good and usually worked with user-friendly credentials. There was a bi-lingual (Mac/Windows) computer and printer off the lobby that let me print a return flight boarding pass. Lobby staff were very attentive and solicitous. Housekeeping was prompt but took away many barely used towels. Room lighting was good, somewhat automated, and only a bit confusing. I would be happy to stay here again under similar circumstances.

title: Hyatt Union Square Was Super Convenient!
text: 1 block south of Union Square, aka "The center of the universe" - you can access major subway lines uptown, downtown and to brooklyn or queens just steps from your hotel. East village and west village are also short walks and there are many great coffee shops and restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel itself was solid - updated rooms, some with a view depending on what floor you're on. Staff was very kind and welcoming to us every time we returned - and the bar and restaurant are excellent.

title: Business and weekend stay
text: Tenzing at the front desk was very helpful.  Upgraded to a room with better view and light,  A/C was a little weak. This was 3rd stay in 6 months.  Each time very reliable, clean.  Not sure about evening turn down service.  First night service but not other two.

title: Would definitely stay there again
text: Great hotel staff, friendly, very efficient and remarkably helpful. Good rooms on a modern hotel with a new restaurant, Bowery Road that was absolutely great. Their adjacent bar, the Library of Distilled Spirits was a nice place to have a drink.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel, friendly, excellent restaurant! Good location, people at reception extremely helpful , not so common in NYC.Had a great room with a nice terrace . I would definitely recommend it to friends and I will  most likely return on my next trip.   It's even pet friendly . The new bar adjacent to the hotel is a nice place for drinks before dinner. Fantastic Happy hour.  Well done. A nice experience in a New York City.

title: Great hotel in Union Square
text: The hotel's staff was one of the most friendly and remarkably helpful we've had in New York City.  Nice modern hotel with a new restaurant that was absolutely great, way better than most hotel restaurants.  My wife and I ate there several times, as it was just that good.  The crushed avocado appetizer was one of the best we've had.  Also, the Library of Distilled Spirits was a nice place to have a drink.

title: Great staff, property and location, you will be very happy here!
text: This is a fairly new property and it is beautiful and right in union square and you walk south to soho, little italy lower eastside etc!  Very clean hotel and rooms.  We just stayed here as we were moving our daughter into NYU housing.  We had the Sanctuary suite.  It was perfect as we were entertaining most nights and the patio could hold 30 or more people!  The front desk was great, everyone of them.  Tenzing was extremely friendly and helpful.  They do not have a dedicated concierge but the front desk is cross trained to do most things.  When I asked for reservations, Frenchie took about an hour researching options specifically for my family..  I was so surprised as it exceeded my expectations.  Free coffee, newspapers and wifi.  Valet very expensive, $75 per day. (but its NYC).  Thank you all for a great stay!!

title: Already Booked My Next Stay Here!
text: I had such a lovely time staying at the Hyatt Union Square recently, that I've already booked it again for my next visit in a few weeks! Very clean, room was bright, tidy, and had a cool atmosphere. Loved the lighting in the room as well. Only problem I might have had was that it took a little while for the room to cool down but that wasn't a huge issue. Hotel staff was really friendly and accommodating, I felt safe and well taken care of. Looking forward to my return!

title: great location
text: Great location, great bar, very quiet for all the activity in the city!  Room was very clean and concierge was very helpful on choosing where to eat!  Would recommend AND stay again for business and pleasure!

title: Stayed Here Twice
text:
I've stayed here twice and each time the staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was small but modern and comfortable. Plus it's a fantastic location! 

In May, the restaurant and bar had just reopened as new concepts and the staff could not have been nicer. I'll definitely stay again.

title: Say Goodbye Son
text: Needing to drop off our son at a NYU dorm for the summer, we booked the Hyatt because of its close proximity to it. It is a very nice hotel. We were greeted every time with a smile when we entered and our room was also very nice. The neighborhood has many restaurants to choose from. It is also close to the subway station. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice Hotel with Courteous Staff
text: A conveniently located hotel to universities, subway and restaurants.  Enjoyed my stay, clean room and the attentive staff.  Restaurant recommendations were "on the money".  Would stay here again. Thank you for an enjoyable stay.

title: Great Stay!
text: Staff was very courteous and location was fantastic! I highly recommend this hotel!  Walking distance to great restaurants and great sights!!  Whole Foods nearby as well as subway. Great bar right in hotel!

title: Excellent property
text:
Perfect NY hotel. Spacious stylish rooms 
Excellent service.  Nice food selections in comfortable restaurant and well stocked bar. Adjoining rooms are available as are several rooms with patios. Perfect place to stay

title: Perfect home away from home
text: Location, lovely caring staff, we requested a quiet room and got one! Third stay here and coming back. We are accustomed to the small-ish NYC HOTEL rooms so don't be dismayed, many other hotel rooms are even smaller. And greatly enjoyed the bar. Lobby staff are welcoming and thoughtful to our every need.

title: First time at Hyatt in Unions Square
text: We had not stayed before but loved the location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and service throughout the hotel was excellent. Our only complaint, and yes this is New York, is the room is small for 3 people. We would probably return if we wanted to stay in lower Manhattan but it fits 1-2 people more comfortably than 3-4.

title: Boutique Hotel?
text: Location and staff were very good. Room was very small and no walls for bathroom. Toilet and shower opened directly into bedroom. Very limited closet and drawer space.  I tried to upgrade to larger room (suite) but none available.  Good room for single traveler or a couple of nights.

title: Loved the hotel and the neighborhood
text: We usually stay in mid-town, but this time wanted something different and I'm really glad we stayed here.  You can walk to the East and West Village from here, and the immediate neighborhood has lots of activity and good restaurants.  Another plus is that these rooms are very soundproofed, which I appreciate - and the decor is modern with excellent lighting.  I would stay here again!

title: Amazing
text: This hotel was incredible. We were celebrating our birthdays (my wife and I) and the staff went out of their way to make it a special weekend. We really can't recommend this place enough. The rooms are immaculate and the location is great. Close to lots of fun restaurants and bars. On saturdays the farmers market is great.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Hotel was lovely though room was small. No refrigerator in our room, though apparently we could have asked for one, as similar rooms do have refrigerators. Excellent food at the Bowery--traditional with a definite twist. The Library (bar) was lovely but way too loud for us--couldn't talk over the music. Bar staff was lovely. Would definitely stay here again--location was outstanding.

title: Hyatt union square
text:
convenient and wonderful hotel
staff friendly, helpful and kind!  They go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and happy!
I really enjoy staying there as its super convenient to get anywhere from union sq. and the union sq farmers market is one of my favs.

title: Excellent location, amazing stay!
text: Hyatt simply beats my expectations. This place is a must visit if you're in new york city. Don't forget to try out their amazing restaurant downstairs - Bowery Road. Brilliant breakfast in bed. My personal favorite being the Almond Joy cake for dessert. Their french toast is neat too! The gym is excellent with fruits available in the gym.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: After researching every Hyatt in NYC, we decided on this one. Not in the middle of all the time square craziness, but still by tons of stuff. Great area and awesome hotel!! The staff went above and beyond to help us fine restaurants, get us taxis, and just make our stay very enjoyable! We loved it and will definitely go back!

title: Lovely visit
text: I stayed here for NYU graduation.  The staff were friendly and accommodating.  At no point during my three night stay did I encounter any "brainless wonders".  I did not blame the hotel for my headaches, frizzy hair, or lack of diet Coke  on the premises.

title: Very good hotel at Union Square
text: This is a very nice hotel in a relatively quiet location.  The rooms are clean but a bit small.  The bed was very comfortable and the service was quite good.  I would definitely recommend this hotel as a mid to upper range hotel in a quiet location.

title: Clean and comfortable
text: Everything about this hotel made us feel good. The refreshing scent in the lobby, the super clean and comfortable rooms, the amazing shower, the constant replenishing of toiletries. It's an excellent value for money. Would definitely stay there again.

title: find somewhere else to stay
text: hubby & i have stayed at many hotels all over the place, including nyc. we chose this over the hotels in midtown with larger rooms bc we were spending our time in the village. big mistake. HUGE. when we checked in we watched our car sit outside for 45 minutes before someone parked it. we could have found a parking space on the street in that time. before we went to dinner we set our thermostat to 65 (we like it cold and i suffer from allergies) and would have set it lower but that was it. i was getting ready for dinner, in may, and my hair was full of static. what is that? when we came back the room was at 69. we called engineering (mind you it was almost 11) and they said they just reset the compressor. if it didn't get cold call the front desk & switch rooms. and no they couldn't override the a/c to let us lower it in our rooms. i knew what was going to happen. i tried to explain it...no go. we had purchased waters & wanted to keep them cold...no ice bucket. they had to bring it up from the front desk. never in my life have i seen that. i wake up in the morning...migraine from hell bc of the lack of air & dryness in the room. hubby calls downstairs to try & get me diet coke...he was told to take it out of the mini bar. he told them there was only diet pepsi so the brainless wonder on the phone told him there's a machine outside the restaurant. and he couldn't order it thru room service. say what? he goes downstairs...nothing. goes into the restaurant and the tap is broken. he literally had to leave the hotel and go across to walgreens to get me a drink. we get up, i get dressed, and static city again...but worse. we go out to eat, come back and i ask to use the restroom...it's a unisex restroom outside the fitness center. i choose a stall that says women & they don't even have toilet seat covers in the stalls (ewww). i was horrified. all in all for an expensive night this was a fail.

title: Hyatt Union Square
text: If you desire to stay out of the hustle and bustle of Times Square this may be the place.  Friendly staff, clean rooms in a modern decor and an umbrella in every room made for a pleasant stay.  Rooms could be considered small, but I have seen smaller at higher priced hotels.  Consider it.

title: Excellent visit
text: The staff was friendly and helpful.  The service exceeded my expectations.  I enjoyed the accommodations and would stay there again!  I had several questions about travel inside of New York city and they were extraordinary helpful and knowledgeable.

title: NYU graduation week
text: The Hyatt Union Square was the perfect location for us.  Near the Subways, great restaurants, Whole Foods and NYU.  The service was very good and for NYC standards the room was big.  The hotel helped make a wonderful week in the city.

title: Very nice room
text: The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom was open to the room so if someone got up during the night it disturbed the other person who is sleeping.  Very clean room and update was done very nicely done.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: I had to stay in NYC for a business trip and the hotel was very clean and the staff very nice. My only complaint was that there was no fridge as the one they had was full of stuff to buy and if you moved any you would be charged.

title: Best Hotel Near NYU
text: Great place to stay in New York University area.  Friendly and professional services, clean and spacious guest room and lobby. Easy access to the city, convenience location to everything you need. Highly recommended.

title: Intelligent design, great location, excellent staff
text: Simple, comfortable, and sharp. Special shout out to Hannah, Nasley, and the gentleman who worked with them at the front desk the weekend of 5/20-21 whose name I didn't catch: Friendly, efficient, and consistently looked for opportunities to be of additional service during our comings and goings.

title: A most welcoming & accomodating staff - both front desk & beyond
text: The entire staff of this hotel provides superb, superb service; I felt like an honored guest! One had the feeling they are present only to answer my questions, address my issue, quickly & efficiently. The location, Union Square, is perfect; nicely positioned between lower & upper Manhattan, East River & Hudson; it's the crossroads of subways leading to the rest of the City. The neighborhood is a grand place to explore, relax and hang-your-hat for a few days - or more. The rooms are very generous, comfortable, spotless and with all amenities. You can't beat the service, location, accommodations and price!

title: always impressed with the hotel and the team
text: I love the location of the Hyatt Union square for both business and personal travel in NY.  The location is close and the access to most locals is efficient and easy.  The is always friendly and very helpful.

title: Great Experience - for the 3rd time
text: Great location, great staff, pleasant environment.  This is my third time at this property in NYC - easy walk to restaurants, bars, quick subway to central park.  Staff is awesome.  Room cool, quiet and clean.

title: No no no
