text: Don't fall for it.  Yes, it is in Union Square, but there are so many better hotels in the city for this money, despite this being a good location.  First, a valet comes to help with your luggage, but does not even introduce himself as a Hyatt employee or have a uniform on, so you just think someone is taking your luggage.  Then upon check in they announce loudly how you are paying for the room - don't need the world to know how much I paid, or if I used points.  Then you discover the rooms are tiny with only two usable drawers and only enough space to hang your trousers if you remove a lot of stuff from the tiny closet like the ironing board.  Then don't try to get your laundry done - they returned mine undone with no note to say why it wasn't done and I had a wedding to go to a wedding the next morning.  When I tried to talk to front desk, they had no explanation.  When I tried to escalate to a manager they said none was on duty.  When I asked for prompt return of my call, no one called after 20 min and I had to call back.  How sad.  Never coming here again. Do not recommend.

title: Visit the kids
text: My wife and I stayed here when visiting our two grown children who live in NY.  It is conveniently located, clean and the service is excellent.  The on-site restaurant and bar were convenient and served us well.

title: great location!
text:
this was our 2nd stay here. we choose it because had a great experience first time.

we visited during their remodeling of the lobby/restaurant area and you would never know. The rooms are clean, comfortable. great location in the city.

title: Hyatt union square
text: Hyatt union square excellent service delicious food great location clean room very nice staff a little noisy because my room was by a utility closet very hip and fun would definitely stay here at Hyatt US again

title: Beautiful Adults Only
text:
Lovely hotel in a great area! The room was large and clean and felt very new.

Disclaimer: if you are traveling with children, this hotel may not be for you. The bathroom is an updated "wet bathroom" meaning once you step inside, whether you are showering or using the bathroom, you are in water. Example: my fiancee took a shower and got dressed. I then took a shower and during the time I was showering, my fiance needed to use the restroom. He had to take his pants and shoes back off because water from my shower was practically all over the toilet area floor. His feet were showered twice (lol!!) We laughed and said, if we had kids this would be really awkward and we would have sneaker mud prints everywhere. However, for 2 adults, we considered the design hip.

The food and drinks were delicious. There is a restaurant connected to the hotel that opened the weekend of our stay. We were going to eat out but are more than happy we stayed in. We loved the food so much that we had breakfast the next day inside the hotel. If anything, have the breakfast. It is in a quaint space with an open kitchen. Not pricey but delicious.

The doorman was so nice. He helped us find free street parking around 9pm right in front of the hotel. He knew who was leaving when and had no problem sharing that info. True gem.

We will be back!

title: Excellent Service -Clean and Friendly Hotel
text: We felt welcomed from the minute we arrived until the time we left. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that we had everything we needed. The remodeled rooms were clean and easy to access. We enjoyed the lounge area, and would come back in a heartbeat. Jorge was outstanding

title: Last minute getaway
text: Decided to check into Hyatt Union Square last minute. When I walked into Lobby I was greeted by concierge. She was incredibly warm and welcoming. My room was incredibly clean. I usually have trouble sleeping in hotels. The bed was incredibly comfortable.

title: Remarkable customer service, great location, even better bar!!
text: The service in this hotel is par to none. Everyone greets you with a friendly smile and genuinely cares about making your stay special. However, there is one amenity of this hotel which you can't find anywhere else... THE BAR!!! It has over 1200 spirits lining the walls. I've never seen anything like it. If you appreciate good spirits, this is the place to stay!

title: Great hotel, exceptional guest experience
text: Stayed only one night yet we had an excellent experience. Very attentive staff, beautiful room, very clean. Great neighborhood - just a great time. Valet parking at the hotle was a breeze, and the staff was fantastic. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great employees, Great Hotel, Great Restaurant to not eat in!
text: I stay here often and have gotten to know the front desk people really well--Jorge,Chris, Victor,Francoise, Johanna, Sabeli and more!  They make me feel special. The new restaurant was the source of all our problems: food was not good, service was slow, etc. There is not enough room here to go into detail. I told the front desk about one episode and they deleted the bill.

title: Amazing concierge service, made up for construction
text: We stayed here for our anniversary and to celebrate the wedding of a friend.  Because it was our anniversary, the front desk sent a charceuterie platter to the room and it was a great way to get in a bite before the wedding.  We would have loved to eat/drink in one of the hotel bars, but both were still under construction.  The staff more than made up for this and even invited us to the "friends and family" mock service at the hotel bar.  The entire staff - desk, door and bar were fantastic and we will stay again.  Note: Victor/Steven was our concierge during the stay.

title: Great hotel and great location
text: The hotel is nice, clean, and comfortable. It is located in a very central area which makes it easy to go around, by foot, bike or subway. Staff has been very friendly and helpful. Will definitely come back.

title: Welcoming Staff
text: Nothing better than a warm welcome at arrival. Except of course if that very same warmth is given at each and every arrival and departure.  Enjoyed the newest restaurant upgrades and food options.  The bar and bartenders are on point.

title: NYC weekend!
text: We stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights.  Wonderful hotel in a great location, convenient to everything.  The rooms were clean and new looking.  The staff was so helpful and friendly too!  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay!
text: Lovely staff. Great location. Hip rooms. Would definitely recommend to friends & business travelers. Rooms are smaller than Grand Hyatt but location and amenities can't be beat. New bar & restaurant are lovely. Will be back.

title: Great hotel, staff and comfort.
text: If you like Union Square this is a lovely hotel with top notch service.  The location is surrounded by restaurants, cafes, shopping and the subway.  Union Square has a market and constantly is full of entertainment.  Theres a great shopping market at Christmas.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
I was debating between here and the W Union Square.  I ended up booking here, though I was very concerned about 230 SF studio rooms.  The day of, I upgraded to an alcove loft, which they generally charge an extra $75-100/night.  I’m so glad I did and I loved our room!  It was spacious and had great amenities such as two TVs, robes/slippers, tons of storage, separate living area, huge shower, comfortable bed, etc.  I was also worried that we were on the 3rd floor, but the noise was not an issue.

Some other highlights: 
- The location was so central and easy for getting around
- 24 hour Walgreens across the street if you need anything (it’s pretty huge)
- The lobby always has fruit water and apples which is a nice touch
- We ordered room service which was surprisingly amazing – probably one of the best room service breakfasts I’ve ever had. 
- The staff was very nice and accommodating.

All in all, I would absolutely return here!

title: Great option for union square
text:
Great stay at Hyatt. Staff were super friendly, hotel is really lovely (new?) feels more boutique hotel than w hotel across the square (we stayed at the w on the same trip and had an entirely different experience). Joanna from front desk was especially good. 

Would highly recommend.

title: Five Star Hotel
text: On rare occasion, a hotel exceeds expectations.  This hotel did just that.  The customer service is exemplary, the room is beautiful, the furnishings are modern, great location, wonderful amenities, and comfortable beds.  I would recommend this hotel highly.

title: Great location, staff excellent and amenities perfect
text:
Stayed in studio on 9th floor. Room was clean and very nicely appointed. Desk was large enough to work on. Staff was kind enough to check me in early, I believe around 10:30, which was huge. Adjacent restaurant was excellent as was bar in hotel. Additionally, the fitness facility was actually a fitness facility and not a broken down exercise bike with medicine balls as some hotels try to call them to entice a stay. There were state of the art treadmills and free weights. I'd definitely go back. Price was OK. Not the cheapest but also given my favorable review also on the high side.
I would definitely go back but if price increased I'd broaden my hotel search.

title: Perfect except for LACK of bathroom walls.
text: Perfect location. Decent price. Friendly and professional staff. Clean. Beautifully decorated. BUT where were the bathroom walls? Even after 35 years, there are certain things I do NOT want to share with my husband, and vice versa. What a shame. If only the bathrooms had walls this would be our favorite NYC hotel.

title: Great Hotel - Great Service!
text:
This was our first visit to the Hyatt Union Square Hotel, and we enjoyed every moment of our stay. The staff did an amazing job of attending to every single one of our requests and needs, and we couldn't have had a better stay. From the quality of the food, to the comfort of the bed, everything thing was terrific! Tenzing - at the front desk - was particularly helpful and attentive to what we needed and wanted. 
We can't thank you enough - we'll certainly be back!!

title: Top service at the Hyatt
text:
We recently spent the last weekend in April at the Hyatt in Union Square, New York City. It's a great location right in the heart of Union Square. We were delighted with the service - personnel greeting us on the way out and back, and with the amenities - thank goodness for wood floors in the rooms instead of dirty carpets, Bigelow shampoo, conditioner and body lotion, delicious cookies upon entering our room and windows that actually open. 
We had a mishap with the toilet which was not repaired on the first visit but satisfactory fixed on the second. Later on in the afternoon, a fruit plate with an apology note sent by someone on the staff named Thalia, appeared in our room. What a pleasant surprise. 
When we return to NYC in December, we will definitely stay at this lovely hotel. The staff is top notch professional and seem to sincerely welcome our business.

title: Restaurants and Bar closed for renovation
text: I would have given them a very good, except I was not told that 2 out of 3 restaurants and the bar was closed for renovations. I just made the reservation. They knew of the limitations of the hotel, but said nothing. Once the restaurants reopen, I'm sure the ratings will come in at very good. Two drink vouchers were given, but my room rate of 350 for a king size bed in an ordinary room, was very high. They should have reduced the room rate in my opinion while renovations being done.

title: Great NYC Property
text: Great property. Currently the bar and restaurant are being updated. I stay at this property on average 1x/mo. Staff is great - they always remember me and what I like (high floor, away from elevator). Not the largest rooms, but clean, good HVAC, great bathroom/water pressure. Great neighborhood: union square and NYU practically steps away. Movie theatre across the street in addition to a Wine store. Tons of restaurant choices in walking distance. Highly recommend!

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
text: Beautiful "boutique" hotel close to Union Square and a short walk to Washington Square. Very modern design yet warm feeling. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated and well-designed. The staff were extremely professional, warm and courteous. We were there visiting NYU with our daughter for Admitted Students Day.

title: Bonitinho mas pouco funcional.
text: Estive no hotel na primeira quinzena de agosto de 2016. Boa localização, porem os quartos são pequenos, a pia do banheiro tinha uma cuba cuja torneira fica a uma distancia que não cabe uma mão para se lavar o rosto, etc. (tirei foto do absurdo). Fora isto, a equipe de funcionários foi bem pouco prestativa. Meu passaporte sumiu no quarto assim como o travesseiro que levei do Brasil. Isto se deu em uma troca de quarto. Por 3 dias insisti que procurassem pelo passaporte e pelo travesseiro, e nenhuma resposta recebi por parte da gerencia ou outros. Apenas quando ameacei ir a policia e ao consulado brasileiro, apareceram com meu passaporte e com o travesseiro molhado. Tinham levado a lavanderia (graças a Deus o passaporte não estava lavado).  Ou seja, a equipe de funcionários foi negligente, pouco atenciosa e demorou para tomar providencia de uma situação tão seria.

title: Excellent hotel with some small problems.
text: Excellent location near Union Square. Very friendly staff, without being disturbing. Good courtesy coffee and apples in the morning. Good hot chocolate on a rainy and cold afternoon. Lobby is being rebuilt, hence sometime very loud construction noises and dust from these activities. Excellent shower, one of the best which I experienced in my last hotel stays. Quality of mattresses is rather poor. For this price a harder and less worn-out marrasse is expected.

title: Amazing stay
text: Although the restaurant and and bar were under renovation, our stay was still great. The room was amazing with floor to ceiling windows that opened! Bathroom was like brand new, and it had an awesome shower. Wood floors made it so homey and the bedding was comfortable. With all that aside, the staff was by far the best about this visit including Tenzing. They were always pleasant, helpful, open doors, carry luggage, you name it they did it. Definitely happy that we choose this smaller hotel to stay in rather than a touristy one!

title: Small Hotel-Quiet Atmosphere
text:
Stayed one night in a king courtyard room. 
The location was perfect! So many restaurants, coffee shops, etc nearby. Union Square is one block away. 
Taxi cabs were plentiful. 
Check in and check out were fast!
Our room was modern with plenty of outlets built into the furniture. The mini bar was nice but expensive.  Coffee maker-adequate. Bathroom area was roomy. 
I was surprised that the room didn't not make me feel boxed in. 
Unfortunately the hotel was undergoing renovations which I didn't not know about. The lounge was closed. 
Also,the service was very slow. Upon arrival we asked for extra decaf coffee. Two hours later it was still not brought up. 
Asked for ice twice until we finally got it. 
The mattress was firm. The air quality was not good in the room. The air in the room was dry!

title: Watch Out!
text: Watch out.  When you shorten your stay at the Hyatt they raise the nightly room rates by 30%.  Booked 2 night at $319 per night.  Needed to shorten the stay by one night and the room rate went up to $425.  So much for a 24 hour cancellation policy.

title: Great location, friendly staff, wonderful hotel!
text: My husband and I stayed here for weekend while getting out and about in NYC. Excellent location. Lovely room. Friendly staff.  Only negative was the restaurant was closed and there was building work going on...which we only found out about when we got there. But it was a great place to stay and would definitely go back!

title: This one is a pass
text:
Beware ! Some of the rooms are obviously what is pictured but my high floor city view king room was SMALL, DARK and DIRTY!The floors are some fake wood something that had not been washed in a very long time!! The lobby is under construction which they failed to tell me when I made my reservations- ever hear of email Hyatt? Or do you just want to make sure you take my money. 
Room service messed up my order every time I used it (& wanted to charge me $5 for a cup of tea.  I understand NYC prices but really??)
The location was perfect for what I needed but I could have stayed at several other locations.  Chose Hyatt bc of its reputation but this one is a pass

title: Not Wheelchair Friendly
text: Overall - The hotel general presentation was nice.  The stay was merely unpleasant due to the 'ADA Room' not being wheelchair friendly (possibly due to age of hotel, but these were upgraded rooms at some point).  It's clear they haven't taken a wheelchair into the room and used the facilities as one might normally.  Won't stay at this particular Hyatt again.

title: Under construction, like a dungeon
text: Check your timings before you stay here, the hotel was under renovation on a recent visit--visible construction happening in the lobby/restaurant area, temporary dining in the basement, you'll be told the quiet rooms away from construction overlook the back courtyard of the hotel where there is no sunlight to be had. When I told the front desk during checkin that I used to be a Platinum status years ago, they actually laughed and then told me to "start over" in World of Hyatt. Arrogant, weird service attitude. The room was small but nicely appointed. I never thought I would miss The Standard.

title: over priced for the construction going on in the hotel
text: The hotel staff were accommodating, but not overly friendly.  Rooms were nice and clean small for more than one person.  For the price I paid for this room I wouldn't expect to have construction going on and would expect top notch restaurant and bars but there was not because they were under construction.  They offered a 10% discount, doesn't seem like much for all the noise and lack of amenities.

title: Great Location in NYC
text: We were there to visit our niece who attends NYU and this location was great!  We were walking distance to just about everything we wanted to see and only a quick subway ride to Central Park.  Great restaurants, bars and coffee shops were all moments away.
